job.title: Executive Assistant
job.description:
Background
Please Touch Museum, the Children’s Museum of Philadelphia (PTM) was founded in 1976 and was the first children’s museum to focus exclusively on young children ages birth to seven. PTM is multidisciplinary, providing exhibits and programs in the visual and performing arts, including theater, music and dance, literacy, humanities, math and science. PTM’s exhibits are themed environments that are hands-on and interactive helping children to learn, develop and practice the skills and social skills they need to be ready for and successful in school and in future careers. The mission of Please Touch Museum is to enrich the lives of children by providing learning experiences through play. In 2008 PTM moved to Memorial Hall in Fairmount Park, a National Historic Landmark Building built for the 1876 Centennial Exhibition.
Position Summary: The Executive Assistant manages the administrative functions and effectiveness of the office of the Museum’s President & CEO, acts as a liaison for the Museum to the Board of Directors, and to the community. This position performs time-sensitive and often confidential functions that involve writing, organizing information using various forms of technology, and communicating in person, by telephone, mail and email with varying constituents.
Essential Functions:
· Facilitate the day to day needs of the office of the President & CEO, handles all aspects of calendar coordination for internal and external meetings and event coordination; complete all necessary advance work including setting up conference calls, preparation, collation of presentation materials, and follow up for interactions with outside constituents. · Act as first contact for calls and visitors to CEO; answer questions; forward calls to appropriate person, or handle requests accordingly to ensure that information is communicated effectively and efficiently between constituents (Board, staff, community). Serve as contact and liaison for Board of Directors, Executive Department with other museum departments and internal catering partner. Provide updates to staff. · Opens and sorts CEO’s mail; manage and update electronic contact system. Coordinate use of Executive Suite Meeting Room for all staff. · Act as liaison to Board of Directors: coordinate Board and Committee meetings (schedule, set up, address all technical and/or catering needs; attend, document and follow up) prepare and distribute Board and Committee meeting minutes; prepare and distribute agendas and Board meeting packets: monitor Board participation and assist with new Board member orientation; maintain up-to-date lists of Board contact information and Committee Membership; maintain Board portal. · Prioritize and administer multiple projects simultaneously and follow through on issues in a timely manner; prepare and draft letters, memos, email, contracts, and other correspondence for the CEO. · Coordinate special projects which may include: planning and coordinating multiple presentations, disseminating information and coordinating direct mailing. Help prepare the agenda for regular all- staff, executive and senior staff meetings. Participate in internal committees and activities, representing the Executive department providing various administrative needs. · Make reservations for meals, meetings, or events held outside of the Museum; make travel and hotel arrangements for President & CEO and senior staff; prioritize and manage multiple projects simultaneously and follow through on issues in a timely manner. · Manage museum participation in community events; manage receipt of event invitations, ticket purchases, RSVP’s and payments; request ticket donations from Board of Directors as necessary. · Tracks Executive departments budget expenses monthly in collaboration with Accounts Payable. Coordinates subscriptions and memberships for museum. Manages UPS account; US Airways vouchers. · Other duties as assigned.
Competencies Needed for Position:
Adaptability Organization and Planning Communications Client Service Teamwork
Minimum Qualifications: Associate degree with emphasis on Field of study: Administrative Assistant Communications, Museum Communications or related fields. International Association of Administrative Professionals (IAAP); Business Professionals of American (BPA), or other certifications are an asset. Minimum of 3 years’ experience supporting a senior level executive/manager, preferably in a non-profit organization; Ability to prepare concise, direct, and discreet memo’s, agendas, meeting minutes and other forms of internal and external communication Experience and interest in internal and external communications including but not limited to working with board members and donors and political constituents. Strong writing and presentation (oral and written) skills; Experience in database management, customer service practices, spreadsheet applications, presentation and report preparation. Advanced time management skills; Demonstrated ability to work cooperatively in a team environment. Able to work independently. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite. Excellent office skills, including but not limited to: typing, filing, faxing, answering multiple phone lines, scheduling, data entry, mass mailings, customer service Highly organized and able to multi-task with ease. Demonstrates excellence and competence, collaboration, innovation and commitment to the mission of the museum. Must demonstrate strong interpersonal skills, maturity and good judgment and be capable of communicating with a diverse range of individuals. Strong initiative, problem solving skills and sound judgment to effectively coordinate and maintain activities. Able to provide support to a variety of projects, work with various people’s schedules to create meetings in timely fashion. Able to multi-task with various people and departments in time-sensitive situations. Detail oriented; ability to follow through and organized. Flexible, able to adapt to changing priorities with ease. Establishing and maintaining complete filing (electronic and paper) and bring forward (BF) system; mailing, copying, note taking during Board and Committee meetings. Respect for organizational detail Please Touch Museum offers an excellent working environment; a comprehensive benefit package and competitive salary. To apply for this opportunity, please mail your cover letter , resume and salary requirements to: Director of Human Resources, Please Touch Museum, 4231 Avenue of the Republic, Philadelphia, PA 19131: Email: employment@pleasetouchmuseum.org fax: 215-581-3182 Office telephone: 215-581-3189 EOE

job.title: Franchise Sales Representatives
job.description: The U.S organic industry continues to grow at a rapid rate. This is not surprising when you consider the fact that eight in ten (81%) US families purchase organic products at least once a week. As more and more people become aware of the dangers of conventional farming practices, the demand for access to clean, safe, chemical free food has exploded. Since 2012, Organics Live has been a premier provider of 100% certified, locally focused, organic foods to homes and businesses each week, at prices up to 20% less than retail.We are looking for passionate franchisees to join the Organics Live team in Pennsylvania, Delaware and New Jersey, and are currently seeking seasoned franchise sales execs to join our efforts in the Tri-States area.

job.title: Sr. VP, Marketing
job.description: Sr. VP, MarketingReminderMedia, publishers of American Lifestyle magazine, a growing King of Prussia based company is currently hiring. We help businesses solidify the key relationships that are driving their business. Due to growth, we have a unique opportunity for a Sr. VP, Marketing. The Sr. VP, Marketing is responsible for developing and executing strategies that measurably drive growth, improve customer retention, increase revenue, improve brand awareness and advance brand image. The Sr. VP, Marketing provides executive leadership and delivers integrated marketing and advertising strategies that achieve business results.Duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:• Work with the CEO, Sales Manager and executive leadership team to address the most urgent resource optimization issues including product transformation, organizational change, and core competency needs.• Identify, articulate, and address strategic issues that affect company growth and sustainability, including company mission and vision; adoption of a market- and mission-driven philosophy; products, pricing, distribution and related topics.• Serve in a leadership role with bottom-line accountability for product management, marketing, and sales/business development functions. Will also maintain leadership role in resource optimization initiative, setting objectives, directing activities, and ensuring successful outcomes.• Regularly perform market penetration and competitive analysis by customer channel and recommend strategies to improve market position, improve quality, and reduce costs.• Develop an annual marketing plan in support of organizational strategy objectives. Establish and implement short and long-term goals, objectives, policies and operating procedures.• Oversee marketing communications including branding, public relations, advertising, white papers, trade shows, seminars and events collateral materials, analysis and market research management, website design and content, webinar development, and social media programs.• Partner with the management team to ensure the best possible service and effective communications with customers.• Provide input and support to company leadership in the development of joint ventures, affiliations, and partnership arrangements.• Create a company-wide marketing reporting function that can track, measure, and analyze performance.• Promote positive relations with partners, vendors, and distributors.• Other related duties as may be assigned by the CEO or COO.Qualifications:• Bachelor’s Degree in related discipline with specialized leadership training and/or demonstrated capability to perform job responsibilities through previous experience and education. Graduate degree preferred. • A minimum of ten (10) years of senior leadership experience in marketing and sales management, specifically in business to business marketing. • Deep experience in the areas of information-driven marketing to include CRM, sales leads management, implementation of social media lead generation programs etc. Working knowledge of advance analytical modeling.• A proven track record of success developing marketing and advertising strategies that drive traffic, increase customer retention, increase revenues, improve brand awareness and advance brand image.• Experience directing and using marketing research in program development and evaluation.• Previous experience in Real-estate and/or Finance a plus. • Some travel may be required.• Strong understanding of the digital/interactive marketing space.We help business professionals connect with their core clients, on a consistent basis, in order to help them generate repeat and referral business. If you’d like to learn more about ReminderMedia, we encourage you to check us out online at www.remindermedia.com. See what we do, how we do it, and why it works!Please apply through our website or via the link below:http://chc.tbe.taleo.net/chc05/ats/careers/requisition.jsp?org=REMIMEDI&cws=1&rid=344

job.description: Overview Site Reliability Engineer (SREs) is integrated within the infrastructure team, and were looking for engineers who want to be a part of developing infrastructure, maintaining it, and scaling it. As a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) you will have proven experience in supporting mission-critical 24/7/365 IT cloud-based and virtual computing infrastructures, and internal/external end-users. Requirements: At least 4 years of Linux system administration and support experience in an enterprise IT environment. Hands on experience including, but not limited to: Strong AWS experience across the full breadth of AWS technologies. Linux OS Administration, preferably RedHat Enterprise Linux (RHEL 5 and 6). Ability to troubleshoot java server applications (Tomcat) and APIs in distributed environments. Apache deployment, tuning, and support. Experience with Zabbix or Nagios or similar monitoring solutions. Ability to script in at least one of the following: Shell, Perl, or Python. Oracle and MySQL Database administration from an operations standpoint. Working with storage solutions (Netapp, Isilon, EMC) using iSCSI and NFS. Responsibilities: Monitor site reliability and performance while improving the quality of our infrastructure Work with ticketing systems & troubleshoot site down issues Create and maintain technical documentation Scale infrastructure to meet demand Document system design Communicate effectively with other engineers, teams, and business partners Participate in on-call rotation Education or Equivalent Experience: o Bachelors degree or equivalent experience

job.title: Route Sales Management/Distributor, Full Training
job.description: Start building your career and future now!Mac Tools was founded in 1938 in Sabina, OH. Today, Mac Tools is an international business with Distributors and Franchisees in the United States, Canada, Europe and Japan and is part of Stanley Black & Decker, Inc., a brand synonymous with quality and impeccable customer service.Today, Mac Tools has a product line in excess of 42,000 items, and still uses the direct sales approach with a mobile sales force of distributors. The Mac Tools philosophy of excellent quality, price and service remains unchanged over the years, and the company spirit that made them successful in 1938, is the same spirit that makes them a leader in the automotive tool and equipment business todayWE CURRENTLY HAVE A LOCAL ROUTE AVAILABLE.________________________________________EVERYTHING YOU NEED TO BUILD A SUCCESSFUL BUSINESS IS HERE:No cold calls.No Experience necessary, we will train youUnique Route & Territory (Approx 325 customers)Your Mac Tools truck, which will become your own personal mobile tool storeInitial Inventory of top-selling, high-transaction toolsMobile Business Software to manage your businessFinancing for Qualified CandidatesWorking capital to help your business growNational marketing support________________________________________NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARYYou don't need an automotive tools background to be a high-performing franchisee. People from all walks-of-life have found success with the Mac Tools brand!UNPARALLELED TRAININGIt all begins with Tool School at our headquarters in Ohio. Here, Mac Tools professionals apply over 75 years of experience in the mobile tool industry to provide you with the training you need to get started.After Tool School, your District Manager will ride with you on your route for ten days offering sales and business training. They will assist in merchandising your truck and help to implement the promotional techniques that can increase sales at every stop.LOW START UP COSTWe understand that starting your own business can be financially trying. With our low start-up costs, for qualified individuals, we offer a variety of options to fit your unique financial needs.AWARD WINNING#1 New Franchise 2014 Entrepreneur.com#3 Fastest Growing Franchise 2014 Entrepreneur.comTop 100 Franchise 2014 Entrepreneur.comOVER 75 YEARS OF KNOWLEDGEMac Tools® has been operating in mobile tool distribution for over 75 years, creating a well-established brand with a long history and heritage. In this time, we have refined the model to help you be successful as a franchisee.Additionally, Mac Tools® has the power of Stanley Black & Decker Inc. behind us, allowing us to be stronger than ever.ON YOUR OWN, BUT NOT ALONEAs a Mac Tools Franchisee, you'll discover that, although you operate an independent business, you're far from being alone. You'll have one of the most extensive support systems in the industry right at your fingertips.Customer serviceTechnical serviceOngoing Field Excellence Meetings every eight weeksCustomer Credit ProgramDISCOVER MAC TOOLS!Once your application is approved, we will send you on a Discovery Day with an already successful Mac Tools franchise owner so that you can learn more about the mobile tool business. These events will help you to experience the business and learn about the full potential of the opportunity. There is no cost or obligation to participate in a Discovery Day.So what are you waiting for? If you've always aspired to run your own business and be a part of one of the leading mobile tool companies in the industry, then you owe it to yourself to learn more today!________________________________________IMPORTANT NOTE: We have limited routes available in some areas. So don't delay, send your resume today before the open route in your area has been filled.ASK US ABOUT OUR SPECIAL INCENTIVES AVAILABLE FOR VETSMac Tools®, a division of Stanley Black & Decker Inc.505 N Cleveland Ave.Westerville, Ohio 43082The offer of a franchise can only be made through the delivery of a Franchise Disclosure Document. Certain jurisdictions require registration prior to the offer or sale of a franchise. We do not offer franchises in jurisdictions where we are not registered (or exempt from registration) Apply on Career Site

Project Engineer / Assistant Project Manager
job.description:
We are a San Francisco based real estate development company specializing in high-end, technologically advanced green building in the Bay Area’s most exclusive neighborhoods. We work as one collaborative, transparent team to deliver contemporary living at its finest, environmental responsibility at its most innovative, and sophisticated design at its most livable. We bring luxurious appointments, advanced technology, and sustainable building practices together in a rare fusion of beauty, livability, and eco-sensitivity.
Currently, we are looking for a full time Project Engineer / Assistant Project Manager to join us. This position will primarily support the Director of Construction throughout all phases of a project’s design, construction, and sale. The ideal candidate for this position will have a background in construction management with some background or education in interior design or architecture. In keeping with how our team functions this position will have a wide array of duties and work as part of a highly collaborative group.
The candidate for this position must have experience with green building and the certification process. Knowledge of LEED, LEED for Homes, Living Building Challenge, and Passive House are all highly desirable. A full understanding of sourcing building materials that meet sustainable certification requirements and how to obtain the required documentation is necessary in this position.
This position can expect to assist the director of construction with all stages of design and building. The ideal candidate will have the ability to work with subcontractors, source and purchase materials, manage inventory, prepare and update specification books, and maintain construction schedules. They will be a key part of the design process and need a deep understanding of both aesthetic and functional design, specifically in choosing plumbing and lighting fixtures.
The ideal candidate will have exceptional attention to detail, be highly organized, have a commitment to green building and sustainability, have an understanding of contemporary design and enjoy working with a highly collaborative team.
Responsibilities include: Working with subcontractors LEED documentation and / or documenting other sustainable certification programs Sourcing appropriate building materials Prepare and execute purchase orders Track purchase deliveries Manage inventory Construction schedule support Assist with government incentives and rebate programs Assist with design in researching and selecting products for finishes, and fixtures, etc. Implement redlines for interior elevations, lighting plans, etc. Prepare and maintain specification books Collate home owner maintenance manuals and disclosure packets Manage and organize materials and product library
Qualifications Construction management experience required 3-5 years prior experience with construction, architecture, or design firm is preferred LEED certification highly desirable Advanced knowledge of CAD, MS Project and MS PowerPoint Proficiency with Adobe Suite and Microsoft Suite Understanding of contemporary design required
Our company is a place where you can put your innovative thinking into high gear and work alongside other highly creative and motivated individuals.
Please include your salary expectations and salary history.

job.title: Full Stack Instructor
job.description: Instructors at gSchool don’t just teach: they guide. Not just the hard skills – they dig into personality types, habits, and learning styles. And they don’t just talk the talk: instructors lead by example and immerse students in the agile development process from day one. In addition to giving lectures and white-boarding, instructors lead inquiry, pair program and provide ongoing student feedback. gSchool is looking for instructors that are interested in teaching the fundamentals of software engineering and full-stack web development using Ruby and Rails and Javascript. We offer an intensive, 24-week web development courses that focus on an understanding of how the web works and how to tackle technical challenges. Our full stack curriculum includes Ruby on Rails, Sinatra, Javascript, CSS3, HTML5, Responsive Design, PostgreSQL, APIs, Version Control, and Test Driven Development - but our main focus is full-stack development with Ruby on Rails. We are seeking instructors to spearhead new Full Stack Web Development classes in San Francisco, Seattle, Denver, Boulder and Fort Collins and help train a new instructional team on the ground. AS A FULL STACK ASSOCIATE INSTRUCTOR AT GSCHOOL, YOU WILL: Support students during class project work and pairing as necessary Identify activities to support and enrich existing gSchool curriculum Develop internal tools to support the gSchool program Assist in student assessments and the placements process Provide feedback to teaching teamCoordinate program logistics (guest speakers, etc) EXPECTED EXPERIENCE: Has mid-level Ruby, Ruby on Rails, and Javascript knowledge and professional experience working with agile web development teams Thrives in a continuous feedback environment and welcomes feedback from students and other instructors Previous background in teaching and/or mentoring aspiring developers – or a deep interest in giving it a try. Background in pair programming and TDD. Apply on Career Site

job.title: Contract Marketing Field Representative
job.description:
Sonic is seeking a Contract Marketing Field Representative to join the Marketing team. Department: Marketing Position: Contract Marketing Field Representative
Sonic is seeking a Contract Marketing Field Representative who will support all marketing efforts in the City of Brentwood, California with an emphasis on door-to-door Sales. If you are passionate about Sales and enjoy creating a strong connection with your target audience, then this is the role for you. In this role, you will be required to uphold brand standards and positively convey Sonic’s brand message to potential and current customers during sales opportunities. The ideal candidate will be articulate, positive, and capable of supporting the Marketing team’s efforts in Brentwood. Requirements Include: Traveling to Brentwood, California Flexible schedule Excellent language skills Ability to work weekends Speaking to the public about Sonic’s products and answering inquiries Creating and executing door-to-door sales and marketing campaigns Skills/Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge or experience in event management and public speaking. The individual should have self-confidence, be able to manage complex situations, and be able to work under minimal supervision. Education and/or Experience The ideal candidate must be self-motivated and comfortable speaking to the public about Sonic’s mission in a dynamic technical industry. Must possess strong presentation skills, be able to communicate professionally, organized, and able to effectively problem solve. B.S. in Marketing, Communications, or related field, or prior experience in Event Management and/or Communications is preferred. Physical Demands and Requirements The physical demands and requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Physical Activity: Frequent Key/Type: Frequent Sitting: Constant Walking/Climbing stairs: Frequent Crouching/Bending/Stooping: Occasional Reaching: Occasional Pushing/Pulling: Occasional Near vision: Frequent Far vision: Occasional Hearing: Constant Talking: Constant Lifting/Carrying/moving (up to 50 lbs): Occasional Travel: Frequent or occasional; Dependent
How to apply Please apply online at https://custsvc.sonic.net/jobs/ and submit your resume and cover letter to careers@sonic.com. Apply on Career Site

job.title: Property Manager
job.description:
Immediate opening for a full-time Property Manager at a large Class A commercial office building located in La Mesa, California. Responsibilities include daily interaction with tenants, coordination of maintenance and operations, property management functions and contract management, participation in all aspects of the negotiation, execution and implementation of commercial leases, financial planning and accounting responsibilities along with supervision of on-site personnel and outside vendors. Responsibilities related to leasing include: approving and overseeing advertising, showing prospective tenants vacant office spaces, communicating with brokers and business principals in LOI negotiation, lease review and execution, space planning, construction management and payment. , There is also some level of interface with the City of La Mesa, La Mesa Beautiful and two local Chambers of Commerce. Responsibilities: Develop a strong customer service-oriented relationship with tenants. Ensure positive communication, responsiveness, efficiency and cost effectiveness on all tenant requests and projects; supervise execution and completion of all maintenance work orders and service requests from beginning to end to include managing vendors/subcontractors or in house staff. Log and track all maintenance daily items Issue purchase orders for maintenance related activities, review purchases made by staff, code invoices, obtain insurance certificates, and maintain all records in a neat and orderly manner to building standards Implement safety policies and train on site personnel to ensure safety in the workplace as per governmental regulations and corporate safety programs Must have strong understanding of financial reports, including variance of actual vs. budget numbers. Experience and understanding of project management related to tenant improvement and capital expenditure projects. Conduct onsite inspections to obtain facility condition assessments. Combine data and obtain bids for clients based on this information for project related requests Monthly reporting regarding vacancy, leasing, delinquencies, maintenance, AP, and tenant or capital improvements as applicable Thorough working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook Lease administration – review and input leases into Sage Timberline Software, prepare tenant monthly statements, post checks as received both in Property Management Software and electronic bank. Track delinquencies throughout the month. Prepare annual Direct Operating Expense reconciliations Prepare annual budgets Requirements: Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from four-year college or university preferred Minimum of five years of directly-related work experience and ten years of professional experience CA Real Estate license preferred RPA or CPM professional designation or candidacy preferred Compensation and Benefits: Competitive starting salary of $60,000 - $75,000 depending upon background and qualifications, plus achievable bonuses, health benefits, a vacation plan, Defined Benefits Retirement Plan and other benefits are available. There is only minor, local travel required. Business hours are consistent and only occasionally outside of normal business hours. We encourage all qualified veterans of the US Armed Forces to apply.
Background on the Employer: The Employer has been in business since 1965 and owns and manages a diverse real estate portfolio across Southern and Northern California, with additional holdings in the Midwest. The employer has owned and operated the subject office property for more than twenty-five years.

job.title: Clinical Research Physician
job.description:
Profil Institute for Clinical Research, Inc. is an early phase clinical research organization and innovator of research methodologies for diabetes and obesity. The company is renowned for its metabolic clinical research and development based on its scientific expertise, advanced methodologies, and it’s completion of more than 200 early phase diabetes and obesity studies involving every clinically relevant diabetes drug class. Summary: Provide medical leadership, oversight, and management of human clinical trials while ensuring the integrity of the studies and the safety and well-being of human subjects. Perform duties in accordance with company’s values, policies, and procedures. Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned at the company’s sole discretion. Clinical trials: Participate in clinical trials as Principal Investigator and Sub-Investigator. Provide input to the Science team for protocol development; review and edit protocols as needed. Participate in regular study meetings with staff and sponsors. Lead or participate in data review and discussions regarding results. Review and edit clinical study reports as needed. Screening: Perform medical histories, physical exams, and protocol based assessments for qualification of subjects for studies. Determine suitability of study volunteers for enrollment. Clinic activities: Admit, discharge, and monitor subjects including reviewing lab results, EKG’s, and telemetry. Review training documents and complete any accompanying quizzes. Supervise mid-level practitioners. Assess and manage adverse events and medical emergencies. Participate in safety and dosing assessments. On call responsibilities: Share in rotation of weekly call schedule. Education/Experience: Medical Degree plus at least one year of clinical experience in adult medicine. Experience in clinical trials and/or drug development preferred.
Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities: Knowledge of current principles, methods, and procedures for the delivery of medical evaluation, diagnosis, and treatment. Understanding of basic physiology of glucose homeostasis, diabetes, and obesity. Ability to manage medical care of diabetic subjects, obese subjects, and other common medical problems, including medical emergencies. Thorough understanding of Good Clinical Practices and FDA regulations governing conduct of clinical trials. Must be willing and able to take call and work weekend shifts. Certificates and Licenses: Current unrestricted license to practice medicine in the State of California. Current DEA license. Current Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS) certification or ability to be certified within one month of employment. Supervisory Responsibilities: Manage and oversee mid-level practitioners. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Supervise the overall conduct of studies when serving as Principal Investigator for the studies. Apply on Career Site

job.title: Graphic Designer/Production Artist
job.description:
Candidate must have a minimum of 2 years or more related experience and the ability to work in a fast pace environment, while multi tasking and managing time efficiently. Automotive background a plus.
Required skills: - Thorough understanding of Graphic Design and Production principles - Must have strong Adobe InDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop abilities (MAC platform) - Experienced in but not limited to Designing Catalogs, Brochures, Promo sheets and Packaging - Photography and Photo editing skills - Familiarity with Social Media posting and analytics - Degree in Graphic Design or equivalent work experience - Knowledge of Dreamweaver software is a plus - Filming and video editing experience is a plus
Responsibilities include: - Must be able to effectively layout and design catalog & literature - Design point-of-purchase displays with artwork - Create Advertisements for national magazine and online sources - Web design skills in order to update website - Product photography and photo editing - Plan, Acquire and Schedule all content needed for Social Media postings - Post daily/weekly on Social Media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, etc.) - Track all Social Media results weekly, monthly and annually - Engage Social Media followers and distribute internally all inquiries and or comment - Review tagged photos and hash tags: Viair, ViairCompressors - Upload all YouTube video’s onto Facebook - Collaborate and assist Sr. Graphic Designer with other ongoing projects
With resume, please submit 2~3 pieces of previously designed artwork or provide a link to an on-line portfolio.
Compensation: $28,000 ~ $34,000 annually. TBD commensurate with experience.
Company Description: High performance parts manufacture/distributor in Irvine, Ca. seeks a full time in house Graphic Design/Production Artist. Full benefits after 60 days of employment and 401K eligibility after 1 year of employment. Full background check required on all prospective employees.

job.title: Content Manager
job.description: The content manager position is responsible for the supervision and execution of all content marking for Wright Brothers Inc. This position is a key element in constructing the “voice” for our company. We’re looking for someone who is hilarious, heartfelt and insightful. This position will manage all outsourced bloggers and content writers, while publishing content in-house. They will also be responsible for handling any inbound marketing, social media, and brand management for the company. Roles and Responsibilities: Manages all web content and projects related to the websites Edits and proofreads all new content to ensure that it meets established content standards. Works with developers to assess any technical challenges in displaying the content. Finds and edits appropriate media for accompany the content, including, but not limited to; photos, infographics, videos, etc. Writes and publishes blog posts for various WBI products. What this Employee Looks Like: Has a wide degree of creativity and latitude. Highly organized to ensure all content is published correctly and appropriately. Excellent attention to detail, exceptional spelling and grammar. Constantly researching new trends in content marketing and providing suggestions on how we can improve content and make it more dynamic. Has excellent communication skills and is able to manage and direct bloggers and writers to provide the best possible content for our websites. Excellent and stylistic writer who is able to write phenomenal articles and blogs that are engaging and captivating to our readers. Apply on Career Site

job.title: Behavior Therapist
job.description: Be a part of the dynamic team at H.O.P.E. Consulting! H.O.P.E. Consulting is a highly respected and rapidly growing agency specializing in the treatment of children diagnosed with autism in the greater Sacramento, Roseville/Lincoln, Citrus Heights, and Elk Grove area. We utilize the scientific principles of Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA), proven to be most effective approach towards the treatment of autism. H.O.P.E. Consulting is seeking energetic individuals to join our team as Behavior Therapists. Responsibilities include: - Provide 1:1 direct instruction in the child's home or school - Implement lesson and behavior plans - Teach appropriate socialization and communication while taking data on progress - Serve as an integral team member by providing consistent quality service Therapist education, experience and skills/knowledge requirements include: - Must be at least 18 yrs old - High School Diploma/G.E.D. - Must be able to make a one-year commitment - Have reliable transportation/vehicle - Experience with ABA and working with children diagnosed with autism beneficial - Enjoy enhancing the lives of children and their families! - Ability to squat, kneel, and lift at least 50 lbs. - Basic knowledge of autism and applied behavior analysis principles H.O.P.E. offers an excellent benefits package including PT positions and internships with flexible schedule if needed, health benefits, complete initial and on-going paid-training, and rapid career advancement. Successful completion of a background check and TB test is required. Interested applicants must submit a resume, cover letter, and hours of availability to: employment@hopeconsulting.net. For more information please visit our website at www.hopeconsulting.net.

job.title: Administrative Assistant
job.description: The Administrative Assistant provides clerical, administrative and technical assistance to the office; assists internal and external department members, clients, etc. with various requests, inquiries or problems.ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:• Codes and submits invoices to accounting department for payment.• Manages calendar for corporate apartment, including responding to internal reservation requests.• Responds to questions, requests, or problems or directs to appropriate person/department.• Greet and announce visitors in a professional and courteous manner. • Coordinates travel arrangements, makes reservations, and manages expense reports.• Opens, stamps, sorts, logs and distributes mail and various documents; prepares and processes outgoing mail; determines appropriate routing for correspondence.• Organizes and maintains various filing systems.• Performs administrative support functions, including: notarizing documents; maintaining various inventories of supplies, forms and equipment and placing orders for same; performing general housekeeping functions; and completing related functions.• Performs duties in the support of various meetings including: organizing meeting sites and scheduling meetings; organizing and maintaining documents, records and related information; preparing agendas materials; sending notifications; setting up and attending meetings; preparing reports and related documents; monitoring audiovisual equipment; and taking/transcribing notes and preparing minutes.• Formats and types letters, memos, forms, labels, agendas, notices, reports, requests for proposals or other correspondence and proofs correspondence and related documents of staff.• Maintains database(s) and/or tracking logs related to office or departmental functions or activities; enters data or verifies information for accuracy; updates database(s) as needed; prints reports; files or submits documents/reports to appropriate department or director/manager.• Assists with special projects and research as needed.REQUIREMENTS:Education and Experience:• High school diploma or equivalent; and,• One to three years of progressively responsible clerical and administrative support experience; or,• Any combination of education, training and experience which provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform the essential functions of the job.Licenses and Certifications:• Notary Public Preferred.

job.description: The Administrative Assistant provides clerical, administrative and technical assistance to the office; assists internal and external department members, clients, etc. with various requests, inquiries or problems.ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:• Codes and submits invoices to accounting department for payment.• Manages calendar for corporate apartment, including responding to internal reservation requests.• Responds to questions, requests, or problems or directs to appropriate person/department.• Greet and announce visitors in a professional and courteous manner. • Coordinates travel arrangements, makes reservations, and manages expense reports.• Opens, stamps, sorts, logs and distributes mail and various documents; prepares and processes outgoing mail; determines appropriate routing for correspondence.• Organizes and maintains various filing systems.• Performs administrative support functions, including: notarizing documents; maintaining various inventories of supplies, forms and equipment and placing orders for same; performing general housekeeping functions; and completing related functions.• Performs duties in the support of various meetings including: organizing meeting sites and scheduling meetings; organizing and maintaining documents, records and related information; preparing agendas materials; sending notifications; setting up and attending meetings; preparing reports and related documents; monitoring audiovisual equipment; and taking/transcribing notes and preparing minutes.• Formats and types letters, memos, forms, labels, agendas, notices, reports, requests for proposals or other correspondence and proofs correspondence and related documents of staff.• Maintains database(s) and/or tracking logs related to office or departmental functions or activities; enters data or verifies information for accuracy; updates database(s) as needed; prints reports; files or submits documents/reports to appropriate department or director/manager.• Assists with special projects and research as needed.REQUIREMENTS:Education and Experience:• High school diploma or equivalent; and,• One to three years of progressively responsible clerical and administrative support experience; or,• Any combination of education, training and experience which provides the required knowledge, skills, and abilities to perform the essential functions of the job.Licenses and Certifications:• Notary Public Preferred.

job.title: Senior Engineer Full Stack Web Developer, User Environment Manager ( UEM)-End User Computing
Senior Platform System Test Engineer
job.description:
ActiveVideo is the developer of CloudTV, the only cloud-based software platform that enables service providers, content aggregators and CE manufacturers to virtualize CPE functions in the cloud for the purposes of delivering next-gen user interfaces, online content, and interactive advertising for TV to millions of set-tops and connected devices.
CloudTV™ enables service providers, content aggregators and CE manufacturers to deliver consistent, branded video entertainment experiences from the cloud to millions of devices. CloudTV overcomes browser incompatibilities, eliminating the need to develop and maintain native, device-specific applications. ActiveVideo is based in the heart of Silicon Valley, with offices in Los Angeles and Hilversum, the Netherlands.
Senior Platform System Test Engineer Responsibilities and skills: System and Product Test Execution of both manual and automated tests used by TV network operators. As a part of Test team you have to work on a common solutions and system platform. Ability to test end-to-end system and customer scenarios. Manual and Automated testing (Black Box testing, Scenario, User Acceptance, Reliability and Robustness testing). Design test cases from System Requirements/User Requirements. Reporting & Tracking of defects, defects resolution and verification. Report test summary and status to management. Good in Manual and Automated Testing of any Consumer product and/or applications. Expertise in Cloud/SaaS, HTML-5 based web services software testing and design, networking and virtualization. Ability to understand User Experience, Networks, Client-Server environments etc. Ability to design test plan and develop Test specifications from System Requirements Qualifications: 5+ years hands-on experience in production Linux (Readhat/CentOS) environment• 6+ years of experience in the technology area required. Expertise with Cloud-based SaaS and Cloud-Platform architecture. Experience in User Interface, User Experience, Video/Display domain etc. Experience in Validation of applications, front-end/back-end systems and solutions. Knowledge of computer networking a significant plus. Experience in any scripting languages like TCL/PERL/ Python etc. a bonus. Ability to apply different test strategies/techniques like risk based testing, exploratory testing etc. based on the project situation, a definite plus. Ability to work with worldwide and out-sourced teams a definite bonus. Designing Test Architecture and Tools like Aspera, Google-Cloud, HTML-5, and SaaS-based systems. Education: Minimum Requirements Education: BS in EE or CS. MS preferred.Experience/Skills: 6+ years in related domain. Note, there is no relocation offered for this position, local candidates preferred. EEO Employer

job.title: Director of Managed Care
job.description:
Job Summary: The Director of Managed Care primary responsibilities are to develop and successfully execute managed care strategies to ensure corporate achievement of revenue goals for oncology services by securing and maintaining positive medical policies and diagnostic contracts for Agendias franchise products as directed by the Vice President of Managed Care (VPMC).
Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Establish relationships with regional and national payers as well as key professional organizations as assigned by the VPMC. Execute strategies and follow up required to secure positive medical policies and contracts with all types of payers Present thorough clinical and cost-effectiveness information to key decision makers Analyze specific markets to understand ordering and reimbursement processes and any marked differences from national trends Negotiate contracts as guided by corporate goals and strategic significance of payer Perform in-depth data analysis to identify opportunities and challenges surrounding reimbursement and payer activity Develop strategic plan to address opportunities and challenges as described above Provide support in the creation of managed care marketing materials Review all legal and profitability aspects of contracts before submission to VPMC Maintain database of customers and targets in Sales Force Dot Com Present status updates to VPMC and Executive Management Team Work closely with marketing on regional market trends, competitive threats and new testing opportunities Follow all Agendia, Inc.s health and safety policies and procedures Perform all Company business in accordance with all regulations (e.g., EEO, FDA, DEA, OSHA, PDMA, EPA, etc.) and Company policy and procedures. When violations are noted/observed they are to be immediately reported to management. Demonstrates high ethical and professional standards with all business contacts in order to maintain Agendias reputation within the medical community Provide consistent, timely and complete administrative duties and responsibilities. All expense reports, call reports, and communications are completed effectively and on time Perform other related duties as required or assigned The above listing represents the general duties considered essential functions of the job and is not to be considered a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be inherent in the position. Contacts: The Director of Managed Care interacts with existing and potential clients, vendors, as well as internal company departments Education and Experience Requirements: Bachelors degree from four-year College or University, preferably in life sciences or business 6+ years of field sales experience in the diagnostic, oncology, lab services, biotech, or other related industry 2+ years of experience at the management level (District Sales Manager, National Account Manager or equivalent) 2+ years of managed care experience, preferably with diagnostics, in the NAM or RAM role
Skills and Qualifications Requirements: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions Strong negotiation skills Large account management experience Ability to perform detailed, payer-focused market research both domestic and international Executive suite presentation experience (CMO, CFO, CEO, President, VP) Prior managerial and leadership experience is strongly preferred Business planning skills, both strategic and tactical Successful track record with molecular diagnostics contracting and medical policy implementation preferred Strong understanding of coding and reimbursement for both commercial and government payers Proven track record for consistently meeting or exceeding financial and/or other quantitative targets, as well as qualitative goals Ability to communicate effectively and professionally with all members of the organization, customers and external contacts Ability to travel with overnights and attendance at some weekend programs Ability to translate key scientific information supporting product, competitors, science and marketplace to a broad range of Oncology customers Advanced knowledge of concepts and practices with the ability to use in diverse business situations Ability to complete and implement attainable business plans Strong understanding of commercial carrier plan designs, state and federal government reimbursement and diagnostic payment channels Supervisory Responsibilities This position requires no supervisory responsibilities. Environment/Safety/Work Environment: General office environment. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Maintains a clean, neat, and orderly work area. Adheres to Department Specific Safety Guidelines. Travel: Ability to travel to meet regional requirements 70% travel expected on average Physical Demands: Standing, sitting, walking, bending, reaching, manual manipulation, and lifting up to 15 pounds

Associate PhD
job.description: ​​​​​​Who We Are Cornerstone Research is a leading economic and financial consulting firm with more than 500 staff members across eight offices. Together with an extensive network of internationally prominent faculty, we conduct rigorous, objective research applying the highest standards from academia to address complex financial, economic, accounting, and marketing issues that arise in litigation and regulatory investigation. Cornerstone Research is involved in a broad variety of high-profile legal cases and disputes. Current matters focus on such topics as capital markets, business and securities valuation, M&A and corporate events, risk management, market competition, the impact of marketing on consumers, and patent infringement. For example, we address issues affecting the ongoing development of financial markets, such as applying the intersection of finance and industrial organization economics to evaluate price setting in derivative markets. Beyond the financial markets, we address financial economics issues arising in a range of sectors, from such innovation-driven industries as life sciences and high technology to energy, telecommunications, and industrial markets. We address economic issues when evaluating potential mergers, claims of anticompetitive conduct, and the impact of intellectual property infringement. We also address marketing and economic issues arising in cases with allegations of misleading marketing or false claims. More detail can be found on our website at www.cornerstone.com. Associates at Cornerstone Research Cornerstone Research provides an interesting and rewarding work environment. Those joining our firm enjoy long-term career opportunities supported substantially by our investments in their professional development and an escalating compensation structure. Associates work at the core of our client project teams and in the development of our practice, assuming increasing levels of responsibility. The firm has grown steadily over more than twenty-five years and we maintain a firm culture that is collegial, supportive, friendly, and collaborative. We benefit from close collaboration with renowned leading academics in finance and economics. Associates help devise and apply innovative analytical approaches meeting the highest academic standards to address challenging issues arising in our work. We invest heavily in leading edge information resources and computing capabilities, and often have access to proprietary data to inform our analysis. Associates help guide teams supported by our outstanding research analysts. Career development includes staying attuned to – and contributing to the development of – the latest academic research. Associates continue to hone their own research skills while building communications and managerial abilities. The firm supports the development of those interested in becoming testifying experts in some or all of their work, and of those not choosing that path. Either approach provides opportunities for career advancement. Candidate Profile Cornerstone Research provides exceptional career opportunities for those who have pursued doctoral studies in finance, economics, accounting, or marketing. Casework at Cornerstone Research challenges Ph.D. candidates to apply the entire breadth of theoretical and empirical skills gained through their doctoral training. Candidates must have the ability to apply academic research to real-world issues and present concise explanations of complex analyses. The ideal candidate has demonstrated strong analytical, communication, and teamwork skills. We offer an industry-competitive compensation and benefits package. Interested candidates should please refer to the How-to-Apply section of our website for information on required application materials. We are currently hiring in our Boston, Chicago, Los Angeles, Menlo Park (CA), New York, San Francisco, and Washington, DC offices. We will be interviewing at the ASSA/AEA annual meetings in January 2015. Cornerstone Research provides Equal Employment Opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to legally protected categories, such as age, sex, gender, gender identity, race, color, creed/religious belief, medical condition, predisposing genetic characteristics or genetic information or testing, disability, marital status, pregnancy status, military status, veteran status, arrest or conviction record (except where permitted by law), sexual orientation, ethnic background, citizen status, ancestry, national origin, or any other consideration protected by federal, state or local law.​​​​ Apply on Career Site

job.title: Information Security Intern
job.description: The Information Security team is looking for self-motivated individuals with an insatiable appetite to learn and a strong desire to pursue a career in information security. Our internship program will assist in further developing your professional skills in the field of Information Security. You'll have the opportunity to better understand the different facets of an effective Information Security Program and gain practical experience as you work alongside security professionals in a highly regarded and respected bank. You will be assigned a mentor to shadow as you work on various assignments within Information Security. KEY SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES: Demonstrated leadership in academic and professional careers Possess strong analytical and critical thinking, communications, and organizational skills Works well in a team environment as well as independently Detail oriented Quick learner and has a willingness to take on new responsibilities Embrace the First Republic Values: Do The Right Thing, Provide Extraordinary Service, Respect the Team, Take Responsibility, Think Positively, Move Forward, Move Fast, Have Fun, Grow REQUIREMENTS: Applications accepted from undergraduate, MBA, Master's, JD and PhD students and/or recent graduates. Minimum 6 month commitment Current students must live within commuting distance of the Bank year-round. Hourly Commitment: Minimum commitment of 15 hours per week during the academic year, and a full-time schedule of 40 hours of week during the summer and winter breaks. Computer skills are a must MENTAL/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: The ability to learn and comprehend basic instructions; understand the meanings of words and respond effectively; and perform basic arithmetic accurately and quickly. Vision must be sufficient to read data reports, manuals and computer screens. Hearing must be sufficient to understand a conversation at a normal volume, including telephone calls and in person. Speech must be coherent to clearly convey or exchange information, including the giving and receiving of assignments and/or directions. Position involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. Must be able to travel as position requires. May be required to lift 25-50lbs.

Sr. Mgr, Product Management Support & Services
Senior Loan Analyst
job.description:
Responsible for overseeing all stages in the Commercial Real Estate loan process, from initial qualification to loan funding. Ensure that all multi-family, commercial, and unsecured loans are analyzed, underwritten, and processed in a timely manner while achieving a high level of customer service. Responsibilities primarily focus on underwriting commercial real estate loans but may include analysis of other loan types including but not limited to unsecured lines, stock secured loans, and complex residential loans. Write loan narratives which include the analysis of both client financials and a variety of income property including but not limited to multi-family, commercial, mixed-use, and industrial properties. Underwrite Unsecured Lines of Credit and some complex residential loans. The underwriting entails analyzing and summarizing appraisals, rent rolls, leases, and property cash flow to evaluate operating performance, trends, and risks. It also entails analyzing borrower tax returns (business and personal returns), financial statements, real estate schedules, liquidity positions, financial ratios, recurring sources of cash flow, and client ability to service debt (approximately 50% of time). Size and qualify loans for approval and present deals to Executive Loan Committee (ELC). Collaborate with Relationship Managers (RMs), ELC, and clients to help determine loan structure, loan amounts, and products. Communicate directly with clients to obtain missing financial information and answer questions related to deals. Print and organize all financial documentation and compile loan files. Review loan files for completeness, identify missing documentation, and generate needs list for clients and RMs. Complete property inspections with Executive Loan Committee and appraisers to ensure loans are adequately secured. Identify and report to RMs any risks related to loan collateral and/or client financial state. Complete some basic loan processing, such as entering loans on system (PowerLender) Order third party reports and open escrow. Work with all third parties to ensure reports are completed on time. Manage loans through closing and funding stage. Work with escrow to coordinate closings. Update Maturity Report and Assist Loan Monitoring Group with collecting any financial information needed for financial covenants. Manage constant deal flow and prioritize to ensure loans close on time with high degree of accuracy in a deadline-oriented environment Work positively and proactively with all members of the team Cross train other team members, when applicable. Work on special projects for RMs as needed Perform duties and responsibilities specific to department functions and activities. Performs other duties and responsibilities as required or as assigned by supervisor. Responsibilities include the following: adhering to, and complying with, the applicable, federal and state laws, regulations and guidance, including those related to anti-money laundering (AML) (i.e. Bank Secrecy Act, US Patriot Act, etc.) adhering to Bank policies and procedures completing required training identifying and reporting suspicious activity to the AML Officer verifying the identity of any customers that enter into a relationship with the Bank
SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND ABILITIES: High school diploma required; college degree preferred. Experience in underwriting multi-family and commercial real estate loans. Advanced analytical skills, with a focus on underwriting commercial real estate and client financial data. Familiarity with commercial real estate appraisals. Ability to multi-task and work in fast paced/deadline oriented environment. Effective written and oral communication skills Detail Oriented. Proactive, positive, and open-minded attitude with high degree of accountability and ability to work independently and with the team Advanced Excel and Word skills PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS: Vision must be sufficient to read data reports, manuals and computer screens. Hearing must be sufficient to understand a conversation at a normal volume, including telephone calls and in person. Speech must be coherent, to clearly convey or exchange information, including the giving and receiving of assignments and/or directions. Position involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. Must be able to travel in a limited capacity. Excellent customer service skills and willingness to communicate with all members of team

job.title: Maintenance & Repair (M&R) Supervisor
job.description: Position Responsibilities, not limited to: Supervise M&R Vendors Perform pre- and post-repair inspections in field, authorize repair where applicable. At ILWU facility, ability to pre inspect chassis in shop and high dollar amount estimate prior to repair Perform timely audits per month or as needed; evaluate and control quality of repair vendors work. Make decisions on behalf of Trac Intermodal, pursuing the lowest total-cost options; assessing whether or not repairs are necessary and appropriate repairs are prescribed. View take off tire inventories, ensure accuracy of vendor marking and coding, track tire usage, inspect tires for cause of failure, identify and submit failures for pursuance of warranty credit. Review tires being delivered to the terminals as well as take offs being returned from terminal Review take off tires returned to TRAC tire recapper to verify condition as well as casing recovery rate on TRAC casings. Invoice Processing Functions Review vendor repair invoices for accuracy; ensure all invoices are submitted and received parallel to terms in M&R Vendor Agreement; re-send to vendor for revision when inaccuracies are found and communicate with vendor steps needed to take for correction; decline when situation is warranted and is justifiable; approve accurate invoices for payment; assist with vendors inquiries regarding outstanding invoices. Assist to Manage 3rd party billing process to assist the Vendor Compliance group. Support M&R Management program Periodically assemble statistics for management, including but not exclusive to audits performed, expenses related to a particular vendor or repair category, operational efficiencies, perform physical inventory reconciliations and report findings, etc. Logistics Support Perform daily count of available and damaged chassis by chassis size as needed. Review ocean terminal operator information to determine grounded or mismatched member line containers and outbound equipment forecasts and delays Complete chassis reconciliation at ocean terminal with TRAC Intermodal / Trac Lease system in conjunction with TRAC Pool Manager Requirements: Must have a valid drivers license, pass a background check, meet Rail Terminal facility security requirements, and have or be able to obtain a TWIC card. Must be able to perform walk-around inspection of chassis, as well as using a crawler to check brakes and axles. Must be able to lift and move truck tires. Must be able to multi-task, and work independently as well as contribute to the overall success of the team. Must have a command of MS-Office package, Outlook, Word, and Excel. Must be able to receive and communicate repair instructions verbally and in writing in a professional manner Understand and comply with all safety precautions. Have M&R experience and operational knowledge of rail, marine and port, CY, and depot facilities. Candidate must be free of potential conflicts of interest IICL Chassis certification / wheel end / brake / tire / electrical training a plus. Ability to travel a plus. Bi-lingual (English and Spanish) a plus.

job.title: Game Designer
job.description: Who you are: You are wonderfully creative, but unafraid of thorny math problems when it comes to game balance and tuning You enjoy devising economies for fictional kingdoms in your spare time You love to find multiple solutions to problems because you enjoy the challenge You enjoy social games and like to deconstruct them to find out why they work You have a wonderful sense of humor! What You’ll Contribute: Design features for our social games that both delight our users and solve business problems Create systems within the game that add value for our players Prototype your ideas working with artists and producers Develop wireframes and design docs to communicate your amazing concepts clearly and simply Work with engineers to develop features using agile development methodology Get to know our audience, understand what they want, and design something special for them Present your ideas enthusiastically and effectively Be part of a positive team dynamic, balancing outstanding creative skills with practical flexibility Requirements A strong background in designing free to play games At least 3 years of prior work experience designing successful social and/or mobile games Designer credit for at least 2 shipped titles on mobile, web or Facebook Ability to analyze game systems and understand why they work Strong knowledge and understanding of the competitive market, especially social casino games Knowledge of Bingo Blitz – must have played at least to level 10 Ability to fully document features including game systems, game mechanics, economy, UI, characters and story Ability to present concepts and receive feedback Willing to take creative risks Additional beneficial skills: Knowledge of Flash, Balsamiq, or any other prototyping tool Ability to build spreadsheets Knowledge of art pipelines Previous experience working with JIRA is a plus Employment is contingent upon passing a drug screening and background check. Playtika is an equal opportunity employer

job.description: Sonic is looking for an Account Executive to sell our Internet based products. We are a Sonoma County based company, very established with an impeccable reputation. A portion of your appointments/opportunities will be set for you and some account management provided from an inside Associate Account Executive. Sonic provides a detailed training to get you started, so don’t be concerned if you are not a technology expert. The Account Executive is responsible for increasing Sonic’s customer base and promoting growth in revenue by presenting Sonic’s products and services to potential customers and closing business, in person and over the phone. A true ramp up period, no draw against commission! If you like to sell and enjoy providing products and services that almost sell on our reputation alone, then Sonic is for you! Inquiries should be sent to careers@sonic.com. All emailed resume submissions should be in plain text format, with no attachments.

job.title: Marketing Communications Assistant
job.description: Marketing | Santa Rosa, CA | Full-time Sonic, an Internet and home phone service provider, was founded in 1994 at a time when many people hadn’t yet heard the terms Internet, email address or World Wide Web. Today, Sonic is the largest independent Internet and home phone service provider in Northern California and grows every day. Why Sonic, you ask? Sonic believes in the power of listening to its customers and being nice. With an emphasis on customer service, privacy, and uncapped speeds, Sonic offers a fresh approach to Internet and home phone. Each career opening at Sonic is an opportunity for personal growth, career development and most importantly, making a difference towards one, clear goal: Internet freedom for all. www.sonic.com About the Marketing Communications Assistant position: The Marketing Communications Assistant will play a crucial role in daily campaign management. Sonic’s Marketing Communications Assistant will support all Marketing efforts, including creation of content, management of projects, and timely implementation of projects. Responsibilities include: Manage and execute direct mail campaigns, such as EDDM, and priority mailings Develop customer-centric content and copy for virtual campaigns, including social media posts, email communications, and presentations Daily review and management of social media outlets such as Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn Assist with the development and execution of events; ability to occasionally work weekends Fill-in as receptionist when necessary Bonus points: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, or related field Prior experience in Marketing or Communications role Passionate about writing, creating powerful messaging and the Internet Physical Demands and Requirements: The physical demands and requirements described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Physical Activity: Frequent Key/Type: Frequent Sitting: Constant Walking/Climbing stairs: Frequent Crouching/Bending/Stooping: Occasional Reaching: Occasional Pushing/Pulling: Occasional Near vision: Frequent Far vision: Occasional Hearing: Constant Talking: Constant Lifting/Carrying/moving (up to 50 lbs): Occasional Travel: Occasional Apply on Career Site

job.description:
Location: Agendia, US Position: Oncology Sales Specialist Connecticut Territory Job Summary: The Oncology Sales Specialist (OSS) primary responsibilities are to develop and successfully execute sales strategies to ensure achievement of revenue goals for oncology services by focusing on strategic selling opportunities of Agendia franchise products (i.e. MammaPrint, TargetPrint, BluePrint, etc.) within an assigned territory.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Identify, target, educate and manage accounts in the assigned territory including hospitals, pathology groups, oncologists, and surgeons on Agendias Symphony cancer products. Analyze the designated territory to understand prescribing and purchasing decision processes and any marked differences from national trends Drive new oncology business, maintaining customer relationships and exceeding sales targets Achieve sales forecasts and targets Participate in organizing and facilitating meetings for the exchange of medical and product information in line with the companys policies, regulatory and legal requirements Represent company at trade shows, attend company meetings, training programs and functions as needed Recognize changes in the work environment, develop and implement alternate plans to achieve objectives, modify call plan/business plan activities accordingly Identify key physicians, health care providers and organizations within assigned territory Focus targeted sales activity on high-end revenue, volume opportunities, and on Community Based Oncology and Surgery practices Support company sales strategy and contribute in fostering a team environment Present a positive and professional image of Agendia, and ensure activities are consistent with and enhance the companys ethical marketing policies and procedures Travel independently throughout defined territory to drive oncology sales Develop and maintain relationships with Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs) Provide ongoing communication to Regional Sales Manager regarding business opportunities and issues. Maintain database of customers and targets in SFDC. (sales force) Present at quarterly sales meetings Work closely with marketing on regional market trends, competitive threats and new testing opportunities Follows all Agendia, Inc.s health and safety policies and procedures Performs all Company business in accordance with all regulations (e.g., EEO, FDA, DEA, OSHA, PDMA, EPA, etc.) and Company policy and procedures. job.title: Account Executive
job.description: Sonic is looking for an Account Executive to sell our Internet based products. We are a Sonoma County based company, very established with an impeccable reputation. A portion of your appointments/opportunities will be set for you and some account management provided from an inside Associate Account Executive. Sonic provides a detailed training to get you started, so don’t be concerned if you are not a technology expert. The Account Executive is responsible for increasing Sonic’s customer base and promoting growth in revenue by presenting Sonic’s products and services to potential customers and closing business, in person and over the phone. A true ramp up period, no draw against commission! If you like to sell and enjoy providing products and services that almost sell on our reputation alone, then Sonic is for you! Inquiries should be sent to careers@sonic.com. All emailed resume submissions should be in plain text format, with no attachments.
