job.title: Sales Applications Engineer
job.description:
Individuals in this position will work as the primary liaison to the engineering department for the Sales team to provide technical support for customers through-out the sales process. Additionally, this position will support installation, provide sales and technical feedback to the Engineering and Operations teams related to products and services, and support installation and customer satisfaction post-sale activities, as needed.Responsibilities: Primary job responsibilities include determining customer’s specific technical requirements and product feature needs; assisting in determining customer’s project scope and definition of work; generating submittal packages (product data sheets; bill of materials; standard and customer drawings; system riser, layout and connection detail drawings; etc.); creating standard drawings for typical product applications; generating quotes; interfacing with facilities managers, contractors, distributors, architects, and other customer staff to ensure full functionality of Autani products to meet customer needs; participating in site-surveys, pre-bid and pre-construction meetings, if needed; supporting installation activities; participating in product feature development by offering insight into customer needs and industry developments; providing technical support for customer feedback to engineering, operations and customer solutions. Requirements and Qualifications: BS degree in an engineering discipline or combination of experience and education; experience performing sales application engineering for the commercial lighting industry, required (HVAC and/or automated building controls industries experience preferred); proficient ability to use AutoCAD software to create drawings; experience providing quotes; understanding of project scheduling, task definition and effort estimation; ability to take project from concept to completion; strong design evaluation and documentation writing skills.
Autani is an Equal Opportunity Employer.http://www.autani.com/2088/career-opportunities/

job.title: Human Resources Representative
job.description: Provides guidance and counsel on more complex issues to managers and employees in accordance with personnel policy and company philosophy on such topics as career counseling and employee grievances. Recommends appropriate measures for managers to take regarding employee relations issues. Conducts HR investigations to identify concerns, develop and implement mitigation strategies. Participates in the development and delivery of disciplinary action up to and including termination proceedings and outcomes. Participate in reviewing the investigation of injuries for their assigned region(s). Consults with management on issues not stated within company policies. Supports workforce changes in accordance with business needs and growth initiatives. Analyzes salary data for equity consideration and recommends appropriate salaries where appropriate. Consults with the HR Service Center on various higher level HR matters not limited to onboarding, questions and background reviews. Routine interface with regional employees and senior leadership. Provides guidance to Line and Human Resources administrators. Will provide Human Resources support to more than one region. Conducts basic Human Resources in-services and updates. May assist in the delivery of corporate training programs. Remain current on employment law and trends to ensure company's compliance with federal, state and local laws, as well as EEO/Affirmative Action obligations. May generate management reports on a regular basis, including EEO-1, Vets-100 and AAP reports. Audits reports for accuracy and consistency. Performs other related duties as directed by supervisor. Qualifications Education or experience equivalent to a four year college degree is required. At least five years related experience as a Human Resources professional is required. Strong verbal and written communication skills required. Excellent people skills. Can-do attitude and ability to multi-task in a fast paced working environment. Ability to remain calm, professional and controlled in sometimes stressful situations.

job.title: Retail Store Manager
job.description: We are a fashion head-wear and accessories specialty retailer looking for an exceptional sales manager to provide outstanding customer service while promoting our brand. Our focus is to build strong customer relationships with providing the best service, quality, and selection in our niche market.The ideal candidate would have a passion for fashion, be up to date on the current accessory trends and enjoy working one on one with customers. Candidate also must be outgoing, energetic, and demonstrate a positive attitude.This is a full time, salaried position. Must be able to work retail hours with flexibility to work high volume sales days, weekends, and holidays. We offer competitive pay, bonus, health and retirement plans as well as a generous merchandise discount. If you possess a strong will to succeed, are motivated to sell and be rewarded for meeting and exceeding sales and service goals then we look forward to you joining our team!Job Qualifications and Responsibilities:-Must have management experience. -Possess exemplary leadership qualities -Offer exceptional customer service-Meet and exceed sales goals-Perform register transactions-Demonstrate passion for product and brand-Maintain company standards -Identify and promote asset protection

job.title: driver
job.description:
Transdev, formerly Veolia Transportation, is the largest private sector operator of multiple modes of passenger transit in North America, providing bus, rail, paratransit, shuttle, sedan and taxi services. We manage over 200 transportation contracts for cities, transit authorities and airports, providing safe and sustainable mobility solutions. Our mission is to improve public transportation, to enhance quality of life and combat global warming.
The paratransit driver operates a cutaway vehicle and transports passengers with disabilities safely in accordance with Company policy and local, county, state, and federal laws through the Washington DC area. Office is based out of Hyattsville, MD at 3201 Hubbard Rd, Hyattsville. We will accept walk in candidates to interview after an application is completed online. You will need to bring a paper copy of your MVR (motor vehicle record) from the DMV with you. Local candidates only. Hourly paid position-no benefits.
Performs pre-trip and post-trip inspections of assigned vehicle; sets correct destination and route signs Operates various types of vehicles, as assigned, safely, in all types of weather and traffic conditions, according to printed passenger schedules and Operators schedules Arrives and signs in on time; works hours as scheduled; wears clean, neat uniforms Picks up and discharges passengers at scheduled locations safely; regulates heating and ventilating equipment on the bus for the comfort of passengers Collects proper cash fares, following fare collection procedures Reports all accidents, incidents, or unusual occurrences to dispatch office immediately; submits written reports on accidents, incidents or unusual occurrences as required Accurately completes all reports Follows rules and regulations of the Company Adheres to all regulations related to the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA); assists passengers as needed, to enter and exit vehicle safely; correctly operates wheelchair lift with proper safety restraints as requested by the customer Provides transit information to passengers as needed Other duties as required.
All shifts are available. Training is required. (NO CDL NEEDED). Training shifts are assigned based on business need: either 6 AM or 5 PM. Training includes training on weekends.
You will be required to work a weekend shifts duing the month.
Education, Licensing, and Certifications Required: Must be 21 years or older Must have had your full driver's license for 5 years and have your driver'ds license in good standing Driving checks are completed in VA, DC and MD-you must have a clean driving record Ability to pass a drug test Ability to arrive to work everyday on time Please complete your online application at the time you apply Education, Licensing, and Certifications Preferred: High school diploma or equivalent, such as GED, preferred Experience: Previous professional driving experience preferred Ability to pass extensive background check and ability to obtain Motor Vehicle Record demonstrating safe driving behavior from DMV (Department of Motor Vehicles) as well as pass background check and drug screen. This includes fingerprinting. Please check your email frequently as an interview may be requested via email. Unless you save @transdev and @icims to your safe contacts, email may go to your junk/spam folder. Skills and Knowledge Required: Good motor skills, good hearing, accurate color perception Ability to apply proper driving procedures Ability to learn transit routes and schedules and adapt to changes; ability to read a map Ability to read, understand, and interpret transit system operating rules, regulations, policies, phases and routes Ability to assist handicapped passengers when needed Basic math and writing skills Clear speech Local travel to operate the vehicle is required
Pre-Employment Requirements: Must submit to drug testing and an extensive criminal background check. Physical Requirements: Must be able to work shifts or flexible work schedules as needed. Primarily seated in vehicle; stress caused by passengers and traffic; must be able to get in and out of the vehicle to assist passengers; some pulling and stretching required when assisting disabled Must be able to work in all types of weather For more information please visit our website at www.transdevna.com/careers
Transdev is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and welcomes all qualified applicants. Applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration without regard to race, sex, color, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic data, or religion or other legally protected status.
Drug free workplace
If based in the United States, applicants must be eligible to work in US without restrictions for any employer at any time; be able to pass a drug screen and background check
Apply on Career Site

job.title: Regional Sales Representative
job.description:
POSITION OVERVIEW Responsible for driving and realizing sales in a technical environment, within an assigned geographic territory, vertical market and/or product group being accountable for all activity from the initial sales call through and after completion of the sales process. Key Objectives: · Increase opportunities and closed sales to meet and exceed company assigned objectives on a consistent quarterly schedule. · Proactive lead generation resulting in a highly detailed customer database that provides market intelligence on suspects (leads), prospects, qualified opportunities, customer needs and competition. · Consistent interaction with key decision makers within all BMC customer and prospect accounts before, during and after the sales cycle. · Consistent interaction with key team members within the BMC organization before, during and after the sales process to assure customer satisfaction. · Increased profit margin and growth of install base in current and new vertical markets. · Increased market share within territory and markets served by the company. · Overall customer satisfaction with BMC goods and services to assure continued excellent reputation in markets served by BMC.
Primary Responsibilities: · 14 pre-qualified appointments per month with BMC customers and prospects and the activity necessary to maintain this requirement. · Follow up with all appointments in written form to review key points of the meeting, including next steps for customer agreement and buy in. Provide documentation to management · Consistent interaction with key decision makers (“C” level and above) within all BMC customer and prospect accounts before, during and after the sales cycle.
· Consistent interaction with key team members within the BMC organization before, during and after the sales process to assure customer satisfaction. · Engage in “consultative sales “ practices to realize higher profit margins through use of strategic positioning, early entry into the sales process, controlling the process, identifying key decision makers, positioning the company favorably within the targeted customer or prospect and driving the sale to successful completion. · Engage the key decision makers within the client’s organization as well as the key team members in BMC to drive the sales process successfully to close. · Provide SWOT analysis for opportunities prior to bid process providing guidance for the creation of proposals for customers and prospects, and then present the final version to the client in a timely and professional manner. · Gather prospect / customer data, recording in the CRM, for the purpose of understanding the installation base and future needs of the prospect / customer. Targeted sales activity based on this information and establishing BMC as the front runner within the prospect / customer account. · Maintain the opportunity funnel weekly assuring accurate information to management. In addition, increasing the new revenue consistently for achievement of GPM revenue goals while moving existing opportunity revenue through the established sales process. · Performing prospect / customer demonstrations of BMC equipment and capabilities (Demo’s) on a consistent basis. ( one per quarter). · Create and maintain a BMC prospect / customer email list for the purpose of marketing efforts on behalf of the company. · Preparie the “Executive Summary” for proposals provided by BMC Estimation Department. · Lead generation, travel to prospects and customers, develop and maintain customer relationships. · Create and orchestrate annual sales plan for targeted sales assignment. · Provide weekly documented revenue movement of funnel opportunities to include monthly revenue movement equal to 1/12th the annual revenue goal. This is to be accomplished through confidence levels, demonstrations, establishing budget availability, confirming customer project timelines and other sales process activities as the opportunity calls for. · Communicate sales and engineering data to established contacts via email, telephone calls, in-person visits, mailings and other methods normal to the sales process. · Generate trip reports including meeting notes, customer process data, and design details and specifications. · Maintain good working order of company provided tools and equipment. · Follow up with customer installations to assure complete customer satisfaction.
Secondary Responsibilities:
· Increase working knowledge of customer/industry processes and technology developments. · Meet travel requirements and manage travel costs for most effective schedule and expenditures and provide expense reports in timely manner. · Participate in resolving any service problems with customer base, including credit and collection issues. · Develop 3rd party relationships that can benefit the sales process and company. · Other responsibilities as assigned.
Supervisory Responsibilities: This position does not have any supervisory responsibilities.
Essential Skills and Experience: Bachelor of Science or equivalent education and experience. Proficient in Microsoft Office applications; including Outlook, Word, and Excel. Excellent phone and communication skills. 3+ years in a consultative selling environment and experience selling to “C” level executives with the ability to drive results over an extended sales cycle. People, organizational and time management skills, ability to work within a team environment and to achieve individual goals. Ability to travel in multiday/weekly increments up to 60 % annually. Beneficial Skills and Experience: Knowledge of marketing methods, mechanical, electrical and electronic engineering principals. Knowledge of operational process specific to the customer or industry. ERP system applications, in particular ERP database 6.n and 8.n by Epicor. Professional business and technical writing skills. Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee usually is working in an office/desk environment. The employee has access to the production floor which includes moving mechanical parts and machinery used in fabrication of control room systems. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

job.title: Sort Observation for Package Handler Positions
Unix/Linux Network Security
job.description:
Unix/Linux Network Security Apply Now Requirement NumberGBAJ02 LocationFt Meade , Maryland Quotient Inc. is seeking a Network Security Engineer with a background in network application integration. The individual should have hands-on experience working within a large datacenter environment.

The individual will be able to follow change control procedures to plan/test/implement Infrastructure changes in coordination with business owners.
The individual will be able to work with documentation to acquire the necessary know-how specific to supporting this Linux environment and related deliverables.
The individual will have 5+ years of relevant Linux System Admin experience.
The individual will have proficiency and hands on Linux Operating System experience
Key Qualifications:
Proven ability to engineer network application solutions (concept development, initial design, etc.) Proven ability in troubleshooting complex systems Linux/UNIX: Experience engineering configuration for network applications, such as BIND, Linux/UNIX: Red Hat, Solaris systems administration (Intermediate to Advanced) Networking: Foundational understanding of LAN networking principals (TCP/UDP, Static routing) Scripting: automating tasks with shell, bash, & perl scripts Systems Integration: Experience configuring applications to communicate and function across a multitude of network devices with a particular emphasis on Network Routers ( BGP and anycast) .
Additional Qualifications: Systems Integration: Experience configuring applications to communicate and function across a multitude of network devices with a particular emphasis on network routing using BGP and anycast. RHCE or Linux+ preferred Problem management Project reporting Customer communication Rollout of applications and OS upgrades Build and configuration of server hardware Maintenance of the operating systems and hardware Installation of configured server into a production server environment Troubleshooting OS and hardware problems for local and remote servers. Network security Understanding of the IETF standards process System lifecycle engineering Knowledge of DISA STIGs Information assurance certification meeting DoD IA 8570 IAT-II or -III (e.g. CISSP OR Security+) All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, gender, age, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other protected class. job.title: Sort Observation for Package Handler Positions
Regional Sales Manager
job.description:
Regional Sales Manager Description: In this position you will recruit, select, train and motivate a team of sales professionals to achieve quota and corporate goals. You will provide the team with support and leadership and drive sales & growth through new and existing accounts ranging from small to Fortune 500 companies. You will market and sell our products and services to businesses within a protected account territory. Essential Functions Coordinate weekly meetings with representatives to review activity and facilitate development. Respond to daily questions and concerns regarding job-related duties. Assist representatives with creating strategic and competitive sales proposals. Attend appointments with representatives to provide guidance and information. Track and monitor sales staff performance to ensure that goals are met. Review operational records and reports to project sales and determine profitability. Recruit, select, train and evaluate personnel on a consistent basis. Conduct or arrange ongoing training in sales effectiveness, product knowledge and industry trends. Listen to and resolve customer questions and complaints regarding services, products or personnel. Strategize with representatives on various sales opportunities. Motivate representatives to attain personal and professional goals. Market office technology and attain individual quotas. Benefits Competitive base-plus-commission pay; all commissions are uncapped Protected account territory Comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, 401k, profit sharing, paid vacation and paid holidays All-expenses-paid Presidents Club trip for top performers Performance-based rewards and incentives (bonuses, gift cards, etc.) Cell phone and laptop Extensive sales and product training from industry leaders Support of a large, award-winning and aggressively growing company Opportunities for use of Ravens and Orioles tickets Company events (summer crab feast and holiday party)
This position is the direct result of the outstanding growth Centric has experienced over the past several years. Centric has become one of the largest document management dealerships across the Mid-Atlantic. This is an opportunity to work on one of the most highly successful leadership teams in the region. Requirements: As a Regional Sales Manager, you must have an exceptional work ethic and be a competitive, outgoing, and hard-working professional who is driven to succeed and enjoys coaching and mentoring others to do the same. You must also be highly organized with strong time-management, multitasking and prioritization skills. Specific qualifications for the Regional Sales Manager include: Knowledge of principles and methods for showing, promoting and selling products or services, including marketing strategy and tactics, product demonstration, sales techniques, and sales control systems. Customer and personal service including customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services and evaluation of customer satisfaction. Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Bachelors Degree. Minimum of 3 years of business to business sales experience. Industry experience a plus. Locations: Baltimore, MD Hagerstown, MD Apply Online

Perl Developer
job.description: Perl Developer Apply Now Requirement NumberRG004 LocationBethesda, MD Quotient, established in 1999, is a small business providing a range of technical expertise to include web design and development, program and project management and information technology solutions and support to government and private industry. Quotient has a solid track record based on timely completion of contract requirements and superior work quality. Since our inception, Quotient has served defense and civilian Federal Government clients, growing steadily in both the number of contracts and the scope of our business enterprise. We are currently in search of a Perl Developer to assist in the effort to automate/update/support our clients core set of in-house tools. job.title: Commercial Loan Administrator
job.description: Commercial Loan Administrator Craft3 is a non-profit Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI) with a mission to strengthen economic, ecological and family resilience in Pacific Northwest communities. We then complement these financial resources with our expertise, personal connections and other advocacy for our clients. Learn more at www.craft3.org. This position is responsible for providing on-going preparation and monitoring of commercial loan documentation, billings, payments and filing. Provide support to Management, Portfolio Administration staff and Lenders. To apply, please complete the application at: https://home.eease.adp.com/recruit/?id=12985161 To view the full job description visit our website http://www.craft3.org/About/Careers Application deadline is April 21, 2015. A hiring decision is scheduled for May 2015. Craft3 is an equal opportunity employer; women and minorities are encouraged to apply. Apply on Career Site

job.title: Software Engineer
job.description:
Position Overview As a Software Engineer at LabKey Software, you will help scientists attack some of the most challenging problems in the world. You will work with our team and customers to understand requirements, design solutions and ensure a high quality product at all points during the development process. Our ideal candidate will have significant experience in building web applications at the user interface, internal API, and client API levels, and be comfortable working with other team members to improve our development process. Our team partners directly with leading biomedical researchers working to prevent and treat a wide range of diseases (HIV, cancer, diabetes, auto-immune diseases, asthma, allergies, and others); we learn their science and develop solutions to help them make sense of their data. We are serious about developing high quality software, delivering innovative solutions, and contributing to the research community, but we're just as committed to maintaining a collaborative and flexible work environment where everyone has fun while solving hard problems. Key Responsibilities Work efficiently at all levels within a large existing code base Translate client requests into general-purpose software solutions Communicate clearly and consistently with clients on an ongoing basis Learn the science necessary to understand client data, methods, and work flows Interest in contributing to and building a great product development team Qualifications We’re a small and flexible team, and open to candidates with a wide range of experience. In addition to a strong track record of working hard, taking ownership and learning new technologies quickly, you should have: A Bachelor's degree in computer science, bioinformatics, or equivalent At least five years of professional software development experience Understanding of modern software development principles (Agile) Strong object-oriented design and coding ability, including experience with object oriented languages: Java, C++, C# Experience with web application development (Spring, Tomcat) and relational databases (SQL Server, PostgreSQL, etc.) Familiarity with web front-end technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, JSP, AJAX, jQuery, ExtJS) Experience solving bioinformatics problems (preferred) Authorization to work in the US - we are unable to sponsor work visas Availability to work in Seattle or San Diego - we are unable to sponsor interview trips or offer relocation compensation Benefits LabKey is a fantastic place to work with a cohesive team that enjoys working together. We offer a truly flexible work schedule, and you choose your own vacation and holiday schedule. Other benefits include medical, vision, life and LTD insurance, FSA, 401(k), bonus plan, and paid sick time.
About LabKey Software LabKey Software solves complex, high-throughput data management problems for leading biomedical researchers. We build solutions tailored to our clients' needs by extending the secure, scalable, open-source LabKey Server platform for collaborative research. Our work benefits from and contributes to the open-source community, building an ever-more powerful and capable platform, available to everyone. For more information on LabKey Server please visit labkey.org and labkey.com. Contact Ready for a rewarding career where your work could improve people's lives? Apply now! Principals only; we will not respond to recruiters.

job.title: Site Reliability Engineer / Linux Administrator / Operations Engineer
job.description: Overview The Synchronoss Operations Engineer is primarily responsible for maintaining a highly technical and professional relationship with corporate clients during all phases of the client life cycle. From build-out, and deployment, to ongoing client support. They will also create, and maintain, all documentation needed to assure a high level of support. Critical Skills: • At least 5 years of Linux system administration and support experience in an enterprise IT, service provider, or telco environment. • Hands on experience including, but not limited to: o Linux OS Administration, preferably RedHat Enterprise Linux (RHEL 5 and 6). o Ability to script to an advanced level in at least one of the following: Python (preferred), Shell, or Perl. o Ability to troubleshoot java server applications (Tomcat) and APIs in distributed environments. o Apache deployment, tuning, and support. o Experience with Zabbix, Nagios or similar monitoring solutions. o Oracle and MySQL Database administration from an operations standpoint. o Working with storage solutions (Netapp, Isilon, EMC) using iSCSI and NFS. • Proven ability to deliver a superior operations experience working directly with corporate clients technology teams and associated change management. • Enjoys learning and adapting to advancing technologies and procedural changes. • Proven incident and problem solving (troubleshooting) skills with an emphasis on a timely resolution. • Ability to coordinate and communicate effectively and professionally with other engineers, teams, and business partners. • Ability and desire to work in a team environment. • Excellent verbal, written and analytical skills, with the ability to tailor communication to the intended audience. • Experience working with ticketing systems. • Experience creating and maintaining technical documentation. Desired Skills: • Previous experience in an technical operations role. • Experience with Hadoop, Cassandra, or zookeeper. • Physical hardware and firmware exposure. • Experience with virtual server environments (KVM, Xen, VMWare, OpenVZ, etc.) • Loadbalancer support (Cisco ACE, F5 LTM, Citrix, etc.) • Experience diagnosing complex issues through packet capture analysis (Wireshark, tcpdump) • Familiarity with IP enabled storage solutions. • Familiarity with fiber channel switches and SANs (Brocade, IBM, Hitachi, HP) Education or Equivalent Experience: • Bachelors degree or equivalent education in related fields • Certificates of training in associated fields/equipment Position Type: • Full-Time/Regular

job.title: Senior Software Development Engineer in Test
Network Engineer II
job.description: Overview Role Summary Synchronoss Technologies requires an experienced Network Engineer to join our Operations team to design, setup, deploy and maintain a range of networks deployed for our clients. The role will be divided between the scoping, design, integration and implementation of new business. There will also be elements of ongoing maintenance and troubleshooting of a number of services which are either run as ASPs or installed on our client site. The role may include an element of being on call, to cover support for our 24×7 customers worldwide. The applicant must have in-depth knowledge debugging problems related to communications protocols and a proven track record of excellence in design and troubleshooting. Responsibilities / Essential Job Duties • Data network design and engineering; Installation, configuration, maintenance, troubleshooting to root cause, and tuning of enterprise data networking equipment • Taking full responsibility for ensuring that the problem is addressed. • Analyzing systems and suggesting work around and fixes for problems. • Collecting and communicating information to Synchronoss Engineering and/or external 3rd party suppliers. • Assisting the customer in on site acceptance testing. • Providing technical assistance to other operations staff and Business Development. • Ownership of new projects / products including input to initial proposal, scoping, system design, integration, customer and project liaison. • Provide input to professional services estimate, statement of work, project plan, design, and functional specification documents. • Review and prepare technical aspects of client/prospect RFP/RFI/RFQ documents • Facilitate interaction between Synchronoss and client technical leads, playing support role at key client meetings where appropriate • Drives creation of new technical solutions based on knowledge and insight regarding industry trends and associated implications for Synchronoss products and clients of a technical nature • Enforce policy, strategic, and operational network security guidelines and procedures. • Stay abreast of contemporary network & security technology and be familiar with various network tools and methodology with a basic amount of supervision. Requirements and Skills • Ten-plus years current experience designing, implementing and supporting networks in mission-critical, Unix/Linux centered, production datacenter environments globally. • Experience with architecting, deploying, and supporting local and wide area networks in multiple locations globally. • Minimum of 10 years of configuring and troubleshooting Cisco Router IOS and Cisco Switch OS. • Minimum of 8 years with Layer 4-7 load balancers such as Cisco Local Director/CSS, F5 BigIP, or equivalent technology. • Minimum of 10 years experience in enterprise-level networking with knowledge in TCP/IP, Routing Protocols (OSPF and BGPv4, etc), and SNMP. • Advanced experience with firewall, VPN, and proxy technology, design, deployment, and support. • Experience in VoIP • Expert knowledge of OSI layers 1-4 and associated equipment • Expert knowledge of Internet protocols and operation • Expert knowledge of Telco circuits management (pots, ISDN, T1, T3, Point to Point and Frame Relay, etc.) • Expert knowledge of Network management tools and software (e.g., sniffers, etc.). • Advanced experience with Network performance analysis troubleshooting & resolution of very complex routing problems using common network tools, protocol analyzers, etc. • Experience in architecting, implementing and supporting new technologies and understanding the associated business implications. • Provide Tier 3 & 4 support on all production and non-production networks driving problem resolution to Vendor development groups if necessary. • Ability to plan, document, and manage multiple IT projects and deadlines effectively with a minimum of supervision. • Willingness and desire to provide senior guidance and mentoring to other engineers • Ability to provide specific examples of past experience as detailed above Required Business Skills • Ability to effectively execute multiple IT projects and deadlines with supervision. • Ability to participate in a shared 24/7 on-call schedule. • Excellent written and oral communication skills • Ability to provide Tier 3 support on all production and non-production networks and develop a problem resolution with Vendor support, if necessary. • Excellent analytical and organizational skills. • Willingness and desire to provide guidance and mentoring to other engineers. • Ability to provide specific examples of past experience as detailed above. Desirable • Experience with standards such as ISO27001 or other INFOSEC frameworks • Experience with Java web applications running in Tomcat / Apache • Experience with 99.9 to 99.999% availability systems • Expert-level knowledge of internet, public & private cloud, and systems technologies Qualifications • M.S. or B.S. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or Mathematics

job.title: Fiber Design Engineer
job.description:
Purpose of Position: The Fiber Design Engineer plays a vital role in ensuring quality and timely deliveries of Wave’s fiber services along with additional services to customers. Skilled in network design and engineering with an understanding of OSP construction. This position will have project management skills, ability to work independently, knowledge of construction practices for outside plant cable placement, sufficient experience with computers and have a background in all phases of network design. The position requires telecommunications engineering experience and the ability to travel between Washington, Oregon and California. ​​​Responsibilities include:
·Planning and designing fiber routes
·Conduct equipment qualification
·Analyze OTDR traces, evaluate characteristics of fiber, and document test results.
·Work with Construction PM’s and/or field personnel to ensure quality and timely delivery of our services.
·Provide remote technical support as necessary to perform field service and additional assistance as required
·Provide technical support by telephone conference, or through visits, to installers, customers and contractors
·Provide project scope for new fibers services
·Assist in troubleshooting fiber circuits and other services
·Design and document fiber splicing and fiber patch assignments for fiber circuits
·Create and maintain appropriate technical documentation
·Analyze and recommend upgrade/expansion strategies
·Participate in the development and the enforcement of network standards and procedures.
·Work flexible hours, after hours work which would include nights and weekends
Maintain a positive attitude and strong work ethic that can provide high productivity with minimal supervision On call rotation responding and restoring services for emergency calls Participates in engineering, permit and construction processes
·Perform all work as necessary to conform to quality control guidelines (includes compliance with requirements outlined in applicable regulations such as: OSHA, FCC, NESC and NEC, etc ; as well as following procedures as outlined in the Installation, Technical, Operations, and Safety Manuals, and Employee Handbook)
·Perform other duties as requested by supervisor
Qualifications and Work Environment:
Experience with fiber optic network documentation tools (OSP Insight preferred) College degree or equivalent experience
·Advanced knowledge of the OSI Model at Layers 1-7
·Strong analytical skills – ability to translate data to strategy
Ability to think creatively and strategically Strong communication skills are absolutely essential as is a cooperative attitude toward co-workers and third party vendors Excellent organization and time management skills Visual design skills are a strong plus
Ability to interact effectively with other team members Must be able to work independently without supervision Ability to adhere to Local, Federal regulations and Company policies Valid driver's license, auto insurance, with a satisfactory driving record
Diverse Workforce / EEO:
WaveDivision Holdings (WDH) recognizes and strongly supports the benefits of a diverse workforce, and strives to provide a culture that recognizes the unique contributions of each of our employees. WDH requires a drug test, background check, employment, and education verification as conditions of employment. WDH is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all qualified candidates regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, age, marital status, veteran status, and the presence of a non-job related handicap or disability, or any other legally protected status.
​​

job.title: Market Research Analyst
job.description:
​Market Research Analyst at Infotools There’s a place where the magic of innovation is unlocked. It’s a place of open spaces, where the elements come alive. Where nature inspires incredible thinking, where ingenuity drives innovation and productivity, where big ideas are born every day. Where the impossible becomes real, and every sunrise inspires the extraordinary – welcome to the world of Infotools, welcome to New Zealand. New Zealand may be better known for the Lord of the Rings and Hobbit films, but it is also home to Infotools. At Infotools, we help out clients take charge of their research data with our market-leading suite of products and services that give our clients space to think.
We are looking for someone who is passionate about project management and motivated by a fast-paced and challenging work environment. As part of the Infotools Seattle team, your primary responsibilities will include: Manage the launching and ongoing maintenance of research projects Creation and maintenance of technical specifications for project questionnaires and study design. Liaise with fielding agency partners and other vested parties to coordinate, collaborate, set objectives, develop action plans and assign responsibilities Quality check study questionnaires & perform in-depth quality checks at every stage of the process Liaise with various levels internally and externally to ensure project alignment of resources and timelines. Perform data verification, and appropriate software functionality Prepare client analyses and presentations using Infotools proprietary software Identify and solve project issues as they arise
Ideal Candidate has the following Skills and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree 2-4 years relevant project management and/or market research experience Outstanding verbal and written communication skills Strong and proven Project Management experience and expertise Excellent problem solving, critical thinking and analytical skills Proactive, “can do” attitude High attention to detail: ability to balance overall project goal with key milestones and tasks Advanced proficiency with MS Office Suite; specifically, PowerPoint and Excel Self-starter with superior organization skills who thrives in a deadline driven environment Ability to juggle multiple projects and diplomatically respond to conflicting needs.
Infotools Unlocks the Magic of Research You don’t have to be Gandalf to work magic. At Infotools, we unlock the magic of research to help organizations everywhere better understand their world. Infotools offers a highly diverse team, a dynamic work environment, and a culture that encourages new ideas, initiative, innovation, and a “Go for it” attitude to provide better results for our clients and that develops our people and strengthens their skills. How to Apply Interested in joining an international organization committed to satisfying our clients beyond their expectations? Please submit a detailed resume that demonstrates you have the experience and abilities we are seeking by submitting an application online (button below). Those interested are encouraged to apply as soon as possible. Please, no phone calls. Infotools is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We thank all applicants; however only those short-listed for an interview will be contacted.

job.title: HR Generalist
job.description:
About OpenMarket OpenMarket, a division of Amdocs, helps enterprises use mobile to transform their business. OpenMarket provides mobile engagement solutions for organizations to optimize their operations and enhance relationships with their customers and employees. Major enterprises choose OpenMarket for our domain expertise, service flexibility, demonstrated performance and reliability, global scale, and corporate maturity. We provide smart, interactive connectivity to more than 200 countries, enabling businesses to engage with nearly every mobile user around the world. Our clients trust us to power their mobile business.
OpenMarket Culture At OpenMarket, we offer challenging projects with a collaborative and approachable environment. We understand that our success results from our diverse and dynamic workforce. It is the same people who compose our invaluable culture. Also important to our culture are the company’s core values: People Matter, Authenticity Always, Take Ownership, Get Things Done, and Teamwork. Does this sound like you?
HR Generalist Role OpenMarket has an exciting opportunity for a Human Resources Generalist who is eager to be part of the OpenMarket Human Resources Team and provide support to the employees and the division. The role is to provide best practices to the division in all areas of HR functions including Employee Relations, Compensation, Benefits, Recruiting, Employment Law, Performance Management, Employee Training and engagement.
Responsibilities: Overall and day-to-day business of assisting in planning and implementing HR plans and programs in support of the OpenMarket Division’s objectives, ensuring quality solutions and deliverables (i.e., performance management, competency development, organizational structure, succession planning, employee engagement, developing learning plans/career paths, rewards/recognition programs, compensation, etc.) Support Managers and the Division on Employee Relations Issues (i.e., Changes in T&Cs, Contractual issues, Exits, Terminations) Respond to employee day-to-day questions and requests ensuring prompt and courteous follow-up Implementation of HR related projects such as staffing, organizational charts, space planning, reports and data analysis for management, managing welfare budgets, payroll processing, events and community relation planning and recruiting. Manage the on boarding process of new hires, conduct HR portion of new hire orientations. Work with Corporate HR to assure policies and procedures that are consistent with legal and country guidelines.
Competencies/Essential Skills/Qualifications: Proficiency in Microsoft Windows, Word, Outlook, Excel and Power Point General knowledge of HR policies and practices Understanding of applicable state/federal benefits and employment laws preferable Excellent organizational skill: detailed oriented Positive, motivating and engaging approach
Strong customer facing skills (ability to work with a variety of personalities), ability to develop strong relationships, influence and motivate managers and employees. Strong business ethics and able to exhibit a high level of confidentiality. Ability to work proactively and on own initiative Able to identify areas where new approaches would be appropriate; use initiative to generate, consult and implement new ideas Ability to make sound judgments. Thinks through problems/issues thoroughly and have strong decision making skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills Comfortable working in a dynamic environment with the ability to juggle and prioritize a varied workload Relevant work experience preferably in a global/international hi-tech environment working remotely from the corporate head office.
About You: You are a smart, results-oriented team player. You are proactive rather than reactive. You take it personally when an issue is unresolved.
Education/Training Required: Bachelor's Degree and two years of HR administrative experience.
Additional Information: This role is open in Seattle, Washington. We are unable to sponsor new U.S. work visas at this time. OpenMarket benefits and standard relocation packages will apply. Employment in this position may be contingent upon successful completion of a criminal and/or credit background investigation.

job.title: Senior Product Manager
job.description: Location: San Antonio, Vancouver or Chicago Hostway is currently seeking a Senior Product Manager to join its product management team and help evolve the portfolio of Cloud Applications. The Senior Product Manager of Cloud Applications will help define and execute the short and long term product strategy for a differentiated suite of compelling SaaS applications, delivered to customers directly and through partners. The successful candidate will be responsible for the successful delivery and management of product portfolios according to best practice product roadmap and timelines. This role is responsible for the identification, execution and fiscal management of product related marketing campaigns, managing product lines, and developing and maintaining strong relationships with key internal and external contacts. The successful candidate will work extensively with customers while working cross functionally with Sales, Engineering, Marketing, and Partners. Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities Solicit and analyze potential product enhancements and new product opportunities from multiple sources, including industry and competitive research, customer and partner input, evolving trends and third party offerings. Provide vision for the growth and management of the SaaS product line. Maintain and manage an integrated product roadmap of multiple product lines. Responsible for determining the business value of development initiatives. Responsible for calculating the ROI of development initiatives and managing the product line P&L. Develop and implement product strategy and tactics related to pricing, positioning, features and service guidelines for assigned product portfolio. Analyze and anticipate competitive market, customer, and technology trends and adapt the product offering accordingly. Work with stakeholders to communicate any changes or obstacles to product development/roll out success. Work with Marketing to ensure that product marketing campaigns are executed and key success factors are achieved. Work with senior management to prioritize and communicate product features and functions to the entire organization. Collaborate with Sales, Engineering, Marketing, and Customer Service to ensure that business requirements are identified, documented, and delivered. Desired Minimum Qualifications A minimum of 7-10+ years of product management experience in a hosting, Software as a Service, or software development environment with a proven track record of success in bringing hosted products to market. Bachelors degree (engineering, marketing, business, or related field). Technical and business knowledge of enterprise data centers and cloud infrastructure operations. Experience with Agile development/Scrum methodologies. Experience creating requirements documentation and managing product roadmaps. Strong planning and project management skills. Ability to understand and write technical documentation. Experience working in a driven, dynamic environment. Strong collaborative skills and the ability to be speak openly with customers in the interest of getting direct feedback on our product suite. Please send resume and salary history to careers@hostway.com and reference code SPM112114JP. Hostway offers a competitive salary and benefits including Vacation, Extended Medical, Dental, Retirement Plan, and much more. Hostway thanks all candidates for their interest, however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

job.title: Business Solutions Consultant - Lot Management Experience
Sr. Technical Product Manager – API/SDK
job.description:
Sr. Technical Product Manager – API/SDK Developing & documenting technical requirements for Partner SDK & APIs (PM-018-15)
Dynamic Shopper Intelligence Over the past ten years DS-IQ has quietly pioneered a completely new way for marketers to connect with shoppers - contextual digital marketing. Contextual marketing goes beyond the use of purchase history and personalization by leveraging situational and environmental factors to understand and predict what influences customers in a given shopping moment. We enable retailers and brands to engage, activate and convert shoppers with the best content and offers delivered to the most receptive buyers in real time. Contextual marketing represents a breakthrough so significant The Gartner Group says, “By 2015, context will be as influential to mobile consumer services and relationships as search engines are to the Web.”
Today, DS-IQ’s One-to-Best™ Marketing System serves thousands of retail locations, across in-store, mobile, social, and web properties, leveraging the richest set of contextual factors at the largest scale in the world. We have helped power nearly $1 Trillion in retail transactions and counting… A marketing revolution is happening: the blending of digital and brick and mortar retail marketing using intelligent omni-channel communication in the moment. Come make it happen with us.
Be a part of the team that works side side-by-side with the largest retailers in the world - to conceptualize, build and implement disruptive, breakthrough shopper marketing solutions!
Role Description: This newly-created role, reporting to the V.P. of Technical Product Management, will be responsible for developing and documenting the technical requirements for our Partner SDK and APIs, and for driving the development process to full release. It will require strong personal drive, a sense of ownership, and an effective communication style in order to make our product vision a reality. You must possess a strategic understanding of business objectives and be creative enough to help define what we build. A strong technical background is required to produce concrete specifications and work closely with engineering to drive implementation. Demonstrated experience leading API development is critical. This role will be internally focused, but will also have a high degree of external interaction with customers and partners. You may also serve as an external evangelist for our product offering, working with business development and key customers. Key Responsibilities:
•Author documents relating to product life cycle including product roadmap, business requirements and functional specifications. •Drive product development across teams (primarily Engineering, Operations, Product Management, Business Development, and Marketing) through business requirements, design, implementation, and deployment. •Define use cases. •Work collaboratively with Engineering as an advocate for the needs of our customers. •Evaluate industry innovations and technology platforms. •Work with the business development, account management, operations, and engineering teams to design, plan, and implement system integrations with partners and customers. This may include work with POS systems, contextual data sources, and channel delivery partners, such as email, web, mobile, and digital signage.
Requirements: •Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field. Master’s degree preferred. •5-10+ years of demonstrated technical product management or program management experience, including defining and documenting functional specifications, system integrations, and control and data flows. •Experience in leading product development start to finish, including shipping customer-facing products. •Experience in leading and contributing to an Agile/SCRUM/Scrumban process. •Demonstrated solid judgment and effective communication skills. Ability to see the big picture, while navigating technology and partner development decisions and tradeoffs. •Experience as product owner with the ability to drive prioritization consensus across business units and serve as an effective liaison between customers and engineering. •Expertise in SOAP and REST web services, XML/XSD, JSON. Knowledge of latest trends and best practices in API development required. •Extensive knowledge inone or more of the following, plus at least a working knowledge of the remaining technologies: Windows, Microsoft .NET, Linux, C#, Java. •Outstanding written and verbal communication skills with an emphasis on communicating technical requirements and solutions to internal and external audiences. •Strong facility with the leading project management tools and methods. Location: Bellevue, WA. Local applicants preferred.
Travel: Some travel required.
Immigration: Citizens or Green Card holders are welcome to apply.

job.title: Business Development Manager
job.description: Business Development Manager – Fife Reports to the Branch Manager Location: Renton How do you deliver creative results? Are you service driven and results oriented? Are you tired of adherence to the status quo? Feel as if your sales strategy can produce quantitative and qualitative results if given the right environment? Do you want to increase an organization’s ability to generate revenue in exciting and innovative ways? SmartTalent is a premier temporary and direct placement staffing and human resource organization. We are specialists in the placement of administrative, office, customer service and call center, accounting and finance, legal, mortgage, banking, technical, production, distribution, transportation, skilled and professional personnel as well as onsite vendor management programs. SmartTalent is adding to our sales staff in Renton. The right person for this job will be able to quickly and accurately assess market needs and deliver needed results. You desire the opportunity to overcome objections and quickly build lasting rapport. You thrive in an environment that continually encourages you to grow and adapt based upon the constant industry fluctuations. If you… Thirst for the opportunity to exceed internal and external customer expectations. Driven by the challenge to grow and build new and existing relationships. Strive to have a meaningful contribution that increases efficiencies and effectiveness of business operations. Understand the impact that the right employee can make and help to provide an accurate depiction of how staffing services provide a solution to business problems. Want more challenges, involvement, excitement and rewards for your efforts. Are happy, but know that the right opportunity could make you happier. …then you might be the person we are looking for in this position. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining client relationships, generating new sources of revenue to maintain our organizational growth trajectory. You will work closely with the branch manager to develop a strategic marketing plan of action as well as with the recruiting team and executive leadership. This job is about who you will become versus who you have been. The successful candidate will be goal-oriented, passionate about their career and customers they will serve and committed to making a contribution in a team environment. Companies who partner with SmartTalent are looking for us to deliver employees that can provide results. We use cutting-edge assessment tools to evaluate, recruit and hire employees. But it is not our tools, but our people who are passionate about their success. At SmartTalent, each of us understands that the work we do is important work. It is up to each of us to make an impact on our community, set a standard of excellence for staffing performance and provide substantial results for our clients and our assignment employees. It is our job to make SmartTalent a seamless extension of an organization. It is our employees that really differentiate us from our competitors. Companies don’t do business with companies…. people do business with people! “We’re Going To Make Your Business Day Better!” is not just our motto, but our way of life. If you feel you have what it takes to meet our expectations and ideals, then send us your resume and start feeling great about what you do. Send your information to meegan@smarttalent.net.​​ ​​​ ​

job.title: Senior Sales Executive (T&D Consulting Firm)
job.description: Experienced Corporate (B2B) Senior Sales Executive needed for a local consulting firm specializing in leadership training and team building. Looking for an experienced sales person (7 years corporate sales experience required) with a strong professional presence and ability to interact well with mid-level managers and C-level executives. This is a consultative sales process where believing in the value of training is very important. This position involves both prospecting for new corporate clients, as well as maintaining and developing existing accounts (which is absolutely critical since we have over 90% repeat business). Applicants must be self-motivated, organized, and have excellent interpersonal skills. This is a hands-on small office where everyone impacts the bottom line and contributes directly to the overall success of the organization (and the success of our clients). This is a direct sales position (not a management role). Salary/commission structure based on experience. Job Responsibilities: Prospect for new corporate clients Maintain and develop new opportunities with existing corporate clients Strong consultative sales approach (developing solutions rather than selling products) Analyze corporate needs to determine appropriate and necessary solutions Assist internally with program content, materials, logistics, and staff coordination Work collaboratively with in-house and program staff to ensure seamless transitions Develop and maintain a strong understanding of our programs and services Work in a team-oriented environment providing support for all aspects of the business Maintain accurate and detailed record keeping systems and databases Job Requirements: Minimum 7 years experience selling corporate B2B services required Proven corporate sales results and an ability to close Understands and values the importance of training and development Highly professional with a strong executive presence Clear consultative sales style A team player and able to work in a small office environment Self-motivated and organized Excellent interpersonal skills Skilled problem solver Strong written and verbal communications skills Computer literacy essential -- MAC preferred Learning and development experience a plus Please respond with resume and cover letter. Resumes that do not include at least 7 years corporate sales experience will not be considered. About LTI: Learning Technologies, Inc. was established in 1990 and is a nationally respected consulting firm specializing in developing high performance work teams and effective leaders. Our customized experiential approach results in leadership development, training, and teambuilding efforts that are among the most powerful in the industry. Our training strategies are designed to fit each client's unique culture, leverage their experience, and achieve their business objectives through increased alignment and improved collaboration.

job.title: Development Director
job.description: The Gay Christian Network (GCN), an organization advocating for LGBT Christians and those who love them, is seeking a Development Director to oversee our fundraising and growth strategies. About Us Founded in 2001, The Gay Christian Network began its life as an online community/support space for gay Christians, but it has grown into something much more. Today, we’re leading the movement to transform Christian attitudes and fully embrace LGBT people across denominations and cultures. GCN hosts the world’s largest annual LGBT Christian conference; creates popular resources for LGBT Christians, their parents, pastors, and churches; and maintains an online community with nearly 30,000 registered members. GCN’s financial support comes almost entirely from individuals with passion for the work we do. We have a proven track record and a strong, devoted following. We are well respected by conservatives and liberals alike, and with the increased focus on LGBT issues in Christian communities, we are extremely well positioned to grow by leaps and bounds. We want your help to take advantage of this moment and make the best use of the resources we have to build strategic, long-term growth for the organization. What We’re Looking For We are seeking an experienced, passionate development director to help us take our fundraising and growth strategy to the next level. We want you to bring your development experience and wisdom to our team to help us build, implement, and maintain growth strategies that we can all get behind. In this job, you will: work closely with the Executive Director to set realistic budget/fundraising goals develop and oversee the organization’s long-term fundraising plans to meet those goals interact with potential major donors, both in person and by phone/email research/write grant proposals regularly evaluate and report on budget and fundraising plan effectiveness train the organization’s board, staff, and volunteers as necessary to assist in fundraising activities work with our Director of Communications to craft language for fundraising pitches and follow-ups Strong candidates for this position will: have completed at least a Bachelor’s degree have formal training in fundraising/development work have significant real-world experience successfully raising nonprofit funds, preferably in a similar role to this one, with a minimum of 3 years at a single organization demonstrate strong knowledge of fundraising best practices and ethics be an excellent communicator, both in person and in writing have strong familiarity with donor management software such as eTapestry or Raiser’s Edge Location, Hours, and Salary Our office is in Raleigh, NC, but we will also consider candidates wishing to work remotely if they demonstrate exceptional qualifications/fit for the position. Similarly, although we are posting this as a full-time position, we are willing to be flexible on scheduling requirements for the right candidate. Starting salary will be based on qualifications and experience. Please indicate your salary requirements in your cover letter. For full-time employees, we also offer full medical and dental benefits as well as a generous vacation/sick day policy. How To Apply To apply, please send an email to jobs@gaychristian.net. Include the following: A cover letter explaining why you are the right candidate for this job Your résumé, detailing your education/experience in fundraising and nonprofit work References from at least one organization for which you have raised money Your salary requirements We encourage all interested and qualified individuals to apply as soon as possible, regardless of age, race, sex, orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, disability, etc. We expect to fill this position soon, so don’t delay!

job.title: OEM Growth Manager
job.description:
HYTORC was formed in 1968. We are the worlds leader in hydraulic and pneumatic torque wrench manufacturing. Our mission is to make industrial bolting safer, simpler and more precise and thus, reliable. With over 40 years of experience focused entirely on engineering new technologies for hydraulic and pneumatic torque wrenches while creating a worldwide 24/7 service network, HYTORC has become the most trusted name in the industry. Either from the bottom of the ocean capping the oil leak in the gulf in 2010 or from the top of the world, erecting the new world trade center, we help all industry with better bolting solutions We are currently seeking an OEM Growth Manager to assist our sister division JETYD. At JETYD wehave taken a pioneering stance in the industrial world, having introduced revolutionary products to the market. We created The HYTORC Washer, which has provided safer operation, eliminated all side load and has brought us upside down operation. We are solving big problems, and have a big vision about industrial bolting. No matter what bolting operation challenge you may be faced with, the HYTORCWasher can remedy them while using your standard nuts, studs and or bolts. Basic Function: This individual must be very proactive in order to accomplish the various tasks at hand. You will help in obtaining contact with larger OEMs to introduce our innovative products. Essential Responsibilities: • Full responsibility for identifying OEM prospects and initiating contact for product demonstration and consultation. • Make planned sales calls and maintain and/or develop business and open new markets. • Develops strategic plan to show clear objectives and to meet growth targets. • Follows, analyzes and reviews industry, market and sales trends to assist in identifying emerging segment formats and/or prospective accounts. • This position requires the ability to work and influence prospects, well-developed communication skills and demonstrated ability to plan, organize and execute plans • Compile appropriate data regarding customer requirements and offerings in order to best serve OEM customers • Successful Candidate must understand and keep abreast of all trends and market requirements.
HYTORC offers competitive compensation arrangement and an outstanding benefits package, which includes 100% company-paid medical benefits for you and your family, 401K Match and generous vacation time. HYTORC has a tradition of commitment to equal employment opportunity. It is the established policy to attract and retain the best qualified people without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, disability or veteran status as provided by law Key words: Combustion Turbine, Combined Cycle, Steam, Gas, Siemens, Westinghouse, GE, MHI, Toshiba, Hitachi, Ebara, Solar, Alstom. Job Requirements Qualifications: • Previous Experience as a Salesman or Sales Manager • Technical background and ability to support a consulting sales process • Relevant experience may have been developed in industrial markets including Auto, Aerospace, Power • 75% domestic travel required • Knowledge and experience with Steam and Gas power producing turbines highly beneficial • Bachelors Degree required, preferably Mechanical Engineering Degree • Minimum of 10 years of business development experience, with recent OEM sales • Capable sales leadership, sales process, and relationship/solution selling skillset • Proven business development experience as it relates to the technical side of product and solution development • Ability to think and act both strategically and tactically
Preferred: • Significant and relevant OEM experience supplying, supporting or having worked directly for an OEM. • Specific turbine experience would be ideal. • Proximity to home offices in North Jersey desirable Job Snapshot Employment Type Full-Time Job Type Manufacturing, Business Development, Engineering Education Not Specified Experience Not Specified Manages Others Not Specified Industry Industrial, Manufacturing, Energy - Utilities - Gas - Electric Required Travel Not Specified Job ID OEM Apply Now Not ready to apply? Join our Talent Network

Claims Trainer and Technical Support
job.description:
SUMMARY This position will be responsible for the efficient functioning of operational claims training processes and projects as well as conducting operational training as needed in the areas of claims processing, data entry, auditing, and at times customer service. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following: 1. Monitor, record, and report training team functions, including tracking and reporting training classes, trainees, projects, and performance of trainees. 2. Serve as the central contact point for operational management to request and schedule claims training. 3. Participate in monthly meetings with other functional personnel and managers to ensure consistency, efficiency, and quality among the Key Family operational functions. These meetings include, but are not limited to, Quality, SWAT, and other OSS manager meetings. 4. Assess claims training needs of new and current operational claims positions based on audit results, needs of management, and concerns of claims staff. 5. Will work with Lead Trainer to coordinate all training and meet department objectives. 6. Develop and maintain claim manuals and claims training materials through internal SharePoint site, based on Trizetto/RIMs system procedures and conforming to accepted medical guidelines and the Key Family's servicing requirements. 7. Develop and conduct operational and remedial claims training classes, including pre- and post-testing, classroom work, evaluations, and management feedback process. 8. Initiate and conduct training sessions remotely with the use of Microsoft Outlook, GoToMeeting and GoToWebinar. 9. Update operational claim manuals with all Trizetto/RIMs system enhancements as they occur, communicating and training any upgrades to all affected parties in a timely manner. 10. Serve as a Trizetto/RIMs end-user resource to operational and support team personnel. 11. Ensure course content, testing, evaluations, and styles of training conform to accepted standards of instructional design. 1. 12. Monitor training schedules in all locations according to needs of management, resolving technical problems relating to classes, processing discrepancies, scheduling, and course material. 13. Conduct one-on-one coaching sessions with new and existing claims staff as needed per quality reports and directed by claims management. 14. Assist in performing and delivering claim audits as new claim administrators begin processing claims. Will provide any necessary feedback as audits are reviewed. 15. Write, distribute, and train procedures to establish operational guidelines per mutual agreement among functional management and training. 16. Provide floor and email support to claims staff, answering questions in a timely and accurate manner. 17. All training responsibilities must be performed in the office. 18. Other duties as assigned.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES Oversight of trainees for the time they are in training, evaluating and reporting their performance to management during this training. Monitor and assist with questions and side by side coaching as the new hires move to their new roles.
QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this position successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties. 1. SKILLS Ability to take initiative and control processes, people in a group, and documentation; have creative, analytical, problem solving, and training skills with ability to communicate complex issues in a simple manner; must be able to conform to deadlines while being flexible in expecting others to meet and conform to a timeframe; and excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially in technical writing and group presentations. Ability to do technical writing and make effective presentations in front of a group is required. Proficient in working independently, with the ability to self-study and research, especially within time constraints; must have strong claim and customer service skills, teamwork, and the capability to work with many different personality styles in a positive manner. 2. KNOWLEDGE Detailed knowledge of health benefits, claims processing, excess loss, customer service, Key Family account servicing, fully-insured, self-funding, and Microsoft Office. Strong knowledge of insurance needed. Strong technical knowledge required. Knowledge of other employee benefits besides medical and Trizetto/RIMs system also a plus. 3. EXPERIENCE Minimum of one year experience in operational work within healthcare required; experience as a trainer, claims processor, operational specialist or manager, and project management experience a plus. Proven track record regarding customer service and claims is essential.
Apply on Career Site

job.title: Human Resources Generalist
job.description:
INVISTA is a subsidiary of Koch Industries, Inc., one of the world's largest privately-held companies, according to Forbes. With a presence in about 60 countries, Koch companies employ more than 100,000 people worldwide, with about 60,000 of those in the United States.INVISTA is among the world's largest integrated producers of polymers and fibers, primarily for nylon, spandex and polyester applications. With a business presence in more than 20 countries, INVISTA delivers exceptional value for its customers through market insights, technology innovations and a powerful portfolio of global trademarks including LYCRA® fiber, COOLMAX® fabric, CORDURA® fabric, STAINMASTER® carpet, and ANTRON® carpet fiber. INVISTA's businesses include Apparel, Intermediates, Performance Surfaces & Materials, and Performance Technologies. You may not realize it, but INVISTA's products play a role in nearly every aspect of your life. For example, INVISTA fibers may be in your carpet, clothing or bedding--and INVISTA polymers may be in your car, food packaging or camping gear. We transform daily life through innovations that create long-term value for our customers and society. You can be a part of the difference by joining the INVISTA team.
INVISTA is seeking a Human Resources Generalist for our Camden, South Carolina manufacturing facility. This position will be responsible for providing comprehensive Human Resources support for the nylon fiber manufacturing site (non-union environment) with approximately 900 employees. The successful candidate will have the following attributes: Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and adjust to changing priorities Excellent interpersonal skills, including both written relations counseling and problem solving for managers and employees to ensure a productive work environment, consistent with company values, and in adherence to state and federal laws Help to grow and advance Market Based Management® culture with managers and employees Coordinate and participate in community based initiatives Offer recruiting and retention strategies for the plant Lead the external and internal recruitment process from requisition creation, sourcing, screening, and candidate selection across a variety of disciplines Proactively partner site leadership to understand staffing needs and identify recruiting solutions Required Experience & Skills: Bachelor’s degree or higher in Human Resources, Business Administration or a related field 3+ years Human Resource experience Must
