job.title: Deputy Editor, BBC.com - Travel
job.description:
As BBC Travel approaches its five year anniversary, we’re looking for an energetic, visually inclined, creative self-starter to join the team as BBC Travel’s deputy editor. This role requires a proven multi-tasker who can think big while also staying on top of the details; someone who can run the site every day, while also proactively strategizing about how to better reach and grow audiences in the long term. You will like this job if you: Enjoy wearing several different hats, both creative and technical. BBC Travel is a team of two editors, so daily tasks will be numerous and varied: updating the Travel homepage; analysing hourly traffic; commissioning pitches; writing headlines; editing photos … you get the idea. Think innovatively about what it means to create inspiring travel content. Beyond the written word, how best can we tell stories or connect with our audience? The written narrative is an important tool, but it’s not the only tool we should employ. Put brainstorms into action. We like big ideas, experimentation and shaking things up – if they translate to action. This position requires someone who can develop a new idea, write a thorough brief, project manage the idea from commission through to completion and efficiently evaluate its success. Have a can-do attitude and a sense of humour. Every job comes with hurdles and a little bit of monkey work, but this is a glass-half-full kind of environment. We want a problem-solver who thinks optimistically. Are seriously organized and detail-oriented. The BBC is a global organization, and the deputy editor will be working with colleagues and freelancers all across the globe. You should be quick and eager to learn the many systems, processes and google docs we use to help keep lines of communication open. Enjoy cultivating a global author and photographer network, including strengthening existing relationships and reaching out to new talent. The deputy editor is in charge of creating a club that our freelancers want to be a part of. Think analytically about what BBC Travel promotes and commissions. None of us went into journalism because we love numbers but traffic is the easiest way for our audience to tell us what they love – or hate, and we listen intently to what our audiences have to say. Other responsibilities include: Managing the Travel site’s weekly production schedule, maintaining the editorial calendar. Growing BBC Travel’s sizable social media presence to drive traffic and audience awareness. Cultivating editorial relationships with internal and external content partners. Monitoring the competition for interesting editorial strategies. Working with the Travel Editor and Client Solutions to think creatively about revenue generating programs.
This job does not include: Doing just one thing for hours at a time Being a full-time travel writer Access to a department of copy editors, or administrative staff for tasks like paying contributors Requirements: Candidate should have at least four years’ experience in journalism and digital media, with a keen eye for timely narrative storytelling and a proven ability to commission from a global perspective. Digital expertise required, including CMS’s, Photoshop, Omniture and basic HTML.
Bonus points if you: Are well established within the travel community with a social media following Have a strong, international stable of dependable and talented authors and photographers Have a solid grasp of the competitive travel landscape Have a background in social media strategy, photography or broadcast/TV/video editing Are proficient in ComScore, Chartbeat or similar Context of the role: The deputy travel editor will report to the Travel Editor. In the absence of the Editor, the deputy will assume responsibility for the site and its management. The position is a full-time, NYC-office-based position.
The deputy travel editor is required to comply with all relevant BBCW safety rules, procedures and guidelines and be aware of responsibilities under the BBCW safety policy. The deputy is also required to comply with BBCW’s policies on Diversity and apply the principles of the policy when carrying out the role.

job.title: House Cleaner
job.description: Lovly House Cleaner Location: New York (Manhattan) Rate: Flat rates per unit Position: Full time General Hours: 8AM - 10PM Company Description: Lovly is a start-up residential cleaning service for peer-to-peer home rentals throughout the NYC boroughs such as Airbnb, Roomorama, Wimdu, etc. We specialize in the management and cleaning process associated with hosts who utilize these sites. We’re looking for a few great cleaning assets to add to our growing company. Job Descriptions: While your main job will be cleaning units, there are a few other tasks that come along with servicing the peer-to-peer home rental market such as communicating with and checking guests in (only for their arrival and key exchange); running small errands to restock units, keeping track of inventory and short daily reports. So you’ll be part cleaner, part guest service. Due to the nature of our niche, cleaning is generally performed at a faster pace and is expected to be done within a certain time period (got to add a little adrenaline to your day). You don’t need to have special powers, just a willingness to work and pride in what you do regardless of the size of the job. Your position ensures all guests have a clean and comfortable environment for a Lovly stay and hopefully a pleasant return. Basic cleaning supplies are on-site for you, so outside of heading to a local store to restock toiletries, you mainly need to carry a great attitude and work ethic. Due to varying booking and check out times and the schedule being based off that, the schedule can vary also week to week. Examples of duties: Cleaning bathrooms: fixtures, showers, tubs, toilets, etc Cleaning kitchens, dishes, cleaning out fridge, countertops, etc Vacuuming carpets & hard floor surfaces, mopping Dusting & polishing Laundry (sheets and linens when pick up and drop off is not available) Checking and replenishing supplies and cleaning tools Other cleaning-related activities such as straightening and creating a tidy appearance Notifying management of occurring deficiencies or needs for repairs Checking-in guests Each place will need to be cleaned within a certain time as guests generally check in soon after cleanings in places with higher guest frequency. You must be good at communication as things can happen last minute, and must be coordinated very quickly to assure a smooth transition from one guest to the next. Mandatory Timeliness Ability to follow directions High Communication (responsive) Must speak & write English A smartphone with camera and internet access Must pass a background check Ability to work independently Not so mandatory but very important Move with a sense of urgency (this does not mean rush) Plays well with others. You’ll likely tag-team units with others Adopt to change and work under pressure (last minute changes are regular) Puts you ahead of others Previous housekeeping experience Experience cleaning homes and handling laundry Availability Good references from prior employer Would be great High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or at least six months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Pride in your work Standard items Must be diligent, hardworking, and responsible Honesty & integrity Attention to detail (all about the little things) Physical ability to clean 2 - 4 places per day Lift 30 pounds, reach, bend, stoop, kneel Stand for extended periods of time, climb stairs repeatedly Compensation Paid per unit Paid Bi-Weekly Contracting position Benefits and Incentives* Paid travel *Apply after passing probation period

job.title: Executive Assistant
job.description:
About the Role New Classrooms is seeking an Executive Assistant to support the work of our Executive Team and contribute to the successful operation of our office. The Executive Assistant provides seamless administrative support and takes on special projects for the Executive Team. We are seeking someone willing and able to execute the requirements of this entry level position, but with ability and ambition to accept more responsibility over time. A strong candidate will have experience handling multiple administrative duties, have extreme attention to detail, be self-driven, be a strong written and oral communicator, and be incredibly organized.
What You Would Do General administration in support of New Classrooms’ Chief Executive Officer and Chief Program Officer: Maintain calendars and manage schedule conflicts Prepare for meetings, including research, materials, and presentations Coordinate travel logistics Process expenses Assist with mailings and other outreach Other administrative support duties as needed Assist CEO with preparing select New Classrooms’ documents and presentation Assist with board relations and board meeting planning and preparation Support planning, preparation, and execution of events and other office activities Support office management and upkeep including answering main phone lines Ad hoc projects and administrative support as needed by staff
What We Are Looking For Ability to stay focused under pressure Keen attention to detail and strong organizational skills Excellent written and oral communication skills Strong multi-tasking ability Natural tendency toward innovative and creative problem solving Comfort working in a highly collaborative start-up/entrepreneurial work environment Professional flexibility and resiliency Team player with a willingness and eagerness to help Self-starter with an ability to work independently and under direction Experience as an executive assistant preferred MS Office (including Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) To ApplySubmit a resume and cover letter via the linke provided. Incomplete applications (i.e. without cover letters) will not be considered. Apply on Career Site

job.title: Head of Business Development
job.description:
Do you dream about working at a company whose mantra is doing good while doing well? CarrotNewYork, a leading educational marketing firm for 35 years, is seeking a passionate Business Development Professional to join our team. The ideal candidate has a proven track record in identifying, prospecting and winning new business in both the corporate and nonprofit sectors; if you have government experience, that’s a bonus. Most importantly, you are generally committed to the concept of education as a means to furthering corporate social responsibility.
CarrotNewYork creates education marketing programs for a wide-range of clients who believe in cause-related, social responsibility programs. Our innovative programs have gotten results in the classroom, at home, and in the community. You will be joining an incredible team of educators, marketers and creatives dedicated to writing the next chapter of our success; your primary responsibility will be targeting and bringing in the next generation of clients.
Here’s what motivates us: when our programs promote positive change in millions of children and families around the world; when a young person tries a new, healthy food for the first time; when we connect, on behalf of our client’s passion for CSR, with high school students and make a real difference in their lives; when communities come together, rallying around an idea; or, when a senior learns a new skill, retaining their independence and confidence. These are just a few of the proud moments you’ll experience because you have sold our skills to new clients.
Job Qualifications Consistently managed and exceeded quota Use consultative selling approach to understand client problems and develop solutions Experienced selling services for consulting, advertising, digital or marketing communications agency Disciplined pipeline management and forecasting skills A strong established network in health and wellness and/or financial industries with CSR focus
Job Responsibilities Drives profitable revenue (prospecting, presenting, and closing) in target verticals, including corporate, not-for-profit, NYC and NY state Manage proposal and RFP process, including vetting RFP for fit and communicating client expectations to CarrotNewYork team to ensure proposal delivers against those expectations Collaborate with CarrotNewYork leadership team to identify new market opportunities and develop sales plan to pursue those opportunities Actively manage status of leads and provide pipeline and forecast reports to senior team on a weekly basis Manage DC-based government rep to weekly meetings metrics and revenue targets Represent CarrotNewYork at conferences, events and workshop to network and mine new leads If you would like to be considered, then: Contact us at hr@carrotnewyork.com Write “Business Development” in the subject line Include a resume and cover letter outlining your skills and interest in joining CarrotNewYork.

job.title: DESKTOP SUPPORT TECHNICIAN
job.description: DESKTOP SUPPORT TECHNICIAN(COMPUTER AIDE, L-1)NYC Administration for Children’s Services (ACS) is a premier children’s services agency dedicated to ensuring the safety of NYC’s 1.8 million children and strengthening its families. ACS is seeking a dynamic person to serve as the Network Engineer I LAN/WAN. The Desktop Support Technician is responsible to provide technical support to all ACS users for software, hardware, and network problems. The candidate specific duties will include: •Identify, diagnose, and resolve Tier II IT problems related to personal computer hardware, software applications, and mobile devices at assigned site(s)•Deliver, setup, and configure end-user desktop & laptop computer hardware, software, Printers, BlackBerries, Cell Phones, iPads, and peripherals•Escalate problems (when required) to the appropriately experienced technician•Learn appropriate software and hardware used and supported by the organization•Assist in maintaining an inventory of IT hardware and software assets•Assist in evaluating new technology •Conduct end user technical training as needed•Assist other members of the Technical Operations team with hardware/software/network technical assistance as needed•Coordinate timely repair of PC computer equipment covered by the third-party vendor maintenance agreements•Handle the moves which requires uninstall/install, lift and pack/unpack Desktop Computer equipment with peripherals•Handle the disposal of the end of life equipment by following ACS’ standard procedures •Field support calls and the emails related to IT support•Use remote access software to troubleshoot technical problems •Use Service Desk software to manage and prioritize assigned workload and update the problem tickets with detailed resolution •Setup projectors and video conferencing equipment for user trainings and meetings as needed•Required to work rotating shifts at any ACS location within the five boroughs of NYC to support 24x7 operationsPREFERRED SKILLS:The preferred candidate will exhibit working knowledge to install, configure & troubleshoot: Microsoft Windows 7, Office 2010, Outlook/Exchange, Project, Visio, IE, Printers, desktop/laptop hardware components; Experience configuring and troubleshooting iPads, Smart phones etc.; Knowledge of remote desktop access software preferably Bomgar to troubleshoot issues remotely; Working knowledge of Local and Wide Area Networking; Experience and knowledge of Microsoft Windows Server; Knowledge of approaches, tools and techniques for recognizing and resolving technical (hardware, software, application) problems; Certified in either A+, MCP or MCSE; Strong interpersonal skills, problem solving skills, customer service and interpersonal skills; Ability to multitask and perform in a high-paced/high-pressure environment; Ability to work independently or within a group to resolve an issue; Ability to communicate with different levels of the organization; Strong team player with service-oriented attitude and customer focus; Ability to provide effective and efficient real-time support for a variety of desktop computer users; Proven experience with solving computer related issues via the phone or remote desktop.BENEFITS:Excellent benefits related to medical, dental, annual leave and training and professional development.Salary range is $36,143 - $46,785. To learn more, CITY EMPLOYEES: Apply through Employee Self Serve (ESS). www.nyc.gov/ess. Search for Job ID #:187754.ALL OTHER APPLICANTS: Go to www.nyc.gov/careers/search. Search for Job ID#:187754. Apply on Career Site

job.title: Recruiting and Marketing Coordinator
job.description: HR Works is seeking a dynamic, unique individual to handle a variety of tasks for a small office in East Syracuse, NY. The successful candidate will serve in a specialized role dedicated to both sales/marketing support and recruitment of HR consultants for our growing team. This dual role supports the Vice President, Business Development with day-to-day sales activities for the growing Central NY region, and works with our recruiting team to source professional human resource talent. HR Works is a 24-year old human resource consulting firm supporting a national client base which includes Fortune 500 corporations. For several years, we have been included on the list of Best Places to Work in New York State and on INC Magazine’s list of Fastest Growing Private Companies in America.Responsibilities Include:• Assisting with proposal writing and client agreements.• Updating client/prospect information in Salesforce.com.• Generating sales reports.• Researching potential clients.• Prioritizing tasks and being able to meet targets and deadlines in a timely manner.• Sourcing passive candidates using resume search databases; social media (i.e., LinkedIn), and networking.• Creating and posting HR job opportunities to free and paid job boards.• Screening resumes, conducting phone and face to face interviews.• Maintaining applicant tracking system.• Conducting background and reference checks.• Representing HR Works at human resource association events in Central New York.• Answering calls, keeping the office organized, and handling general administrative duties.Experience and Education:• Minimum of two (2) years in a recruiting role with a Bachelor’s degree required.• Excellent writing, proof reading and communications skills are required.• Intermediate to advanced knowledge in MS Office Products such as Word, Excel and PowerPoint.• Experience with Salesforce.com a plus.• Demonstrated skills in administrative functions. Strong follow-up skills.Special Requirements:• Must be goal oriented and a self-starter.• Display maturity, competitiveness, good business sense and work ethics.• Ability to prioritize and manage multiple responsibilities.• Strong attention to detail.WHEN APPLYING, PLEASE SUBMIT YOUR RESUME AND COVER LETTER.HR Works, Inc. is committed to equal opportunity for all, without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic. HR Works, Inc. will make reasonable accommodations for known physical or mental limitations of otherwise qualified employees and applicants with disabilities unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business. Apply on Career Site

job.title: Digital Web Designer
job.description:
Publishers Clearing House (PCH), located in Port Washington, NY, is a leading interactive media, specialty retail and entertainment company offering a broad range of products, digital entertainment and services to consumers and advertisers. Our success is based on PCH's unique, free-to-play, chance-to-win value proposition, the trusted first party relationship we maintain with millions of consumers and the excitement of the Publishers Clearing House brand.
PCH is looking for Digital Web Designers to help sell our winning experiences! All levels from junior to senior/lead are welcomed to apply. Our designers plan, design and execute mobile, web and app based material, interactive experiences and more as well as maintain existing daily ongoing promotions.
Adobe Creative Suite and basic HTML coding proficiencies are a necessity in order to execute mobile & web based material, as well as emails. The ideal candidate should have an understanding of user experience, be passionate about design and have a vision for how these can be best applied to a mobile and app medium. You will interact closely with online creative teams, marketing personnel and various other departments to develop, schedule, and produce projects through completion.
Required Skills/Experience:
Bachelors Degree in Art or Design (or comparable experience) Must have at least 2 years of professional experience in design, advertising, corporate branding, app, web and mobile design Ability to build emails that render properly across all major email clients and browsers a plus (responsive email build knowledge an even bigger plus!). Ability to quickly familiarize with brand goals, integrate style into design, and deliver projects on time Strong communication and problem solving skills Confident and capable of juggling multiples projects simultaneously, with the ability to deliver results on a tight deadline Sweepstakes experience a plus Proven track record designing usable, cutting-edge mobile and web interfaces Understanding of information architecture and its application in UI design Working knowledge of how to translate wireframes into design May require travel to the New York City Office
What makes working for Publishers Clearing House so satisfying? Creative is King! PCH has been in business for over 60 years and we all know what got us here and what’s keeping us around – our creative. And what’s more, as a sophisticated direct marketer, we get great, real-time feedback so we know what our creative brings to the bottom line.
All candidates must have an online portfolio displaying user-centered design in advertising & corporate branding
This is a New York based position. Freelance/Remote candidates will NOT be considered.
PCH is an Equal Opportunity Employer

job.title: Client Service Representative
job.description: Our company is currently seeking individuals to join our client services team. Who We Are Our company is a renowned international publication and professional society. Members of our organization are primarily business people, including many C-Level executives as well professionals from other disciplines including doctors, lawyers, professors and many more. Our vast membership base includes professionals from all imaginable industries in most major geographic areas such as North America, Europe, South & Central America, South Africa, Oceania, & South East Asia. We provide a myriad of services to our members including online and physical publishing services, in person and online professional networking, personal branding, media distribution, helping foster business opportunities, and career advancement services. Our aim to provide a superior level of service to ALL of our current member and clients, as well as applicants who are seeking to join our organization. This is where we need top notch Client Services Representatives to act as a liaison between the company and our prospective members... About The Role: Over the last year we've been rapidly growing our membership base both here in the United States, as well as internationally. We've seen an influx of inbound applications and in order to keep up to date and provide the highest level of service, we're actively growing the department that handles speaking to new applicants. Every day the Client Services Representative will speak to and manage a diverse pool of English speaking applicants residing in many different countries. It will be your job to appropriately manage the candidate contact cycle so that you are able to review and speak to candidates in a time efficient manner. Furthermore, the Client Services Representative will partake in many different duties, but their primary responsibilities will be: • Providing a consistent and high level of service to new applicants • Contacting new applicants and prospective members • Speaking to candidates in order to review the information they provided as part of their application • Conducting a qualifying interview that delves into their professional background and accomplishments in order to make sure they are eligible for our organization • Cultivating a relationship with candidates by building rapport and trust • Presenting membership options to newly accepted members as well as extending (and explaining) product and service offering • Managing client relationships by continually following up with members to learn more about recent activities and achievements Who We're Looking For/Requirements: We're seeking motivated and well spoken individuals to join our team. Since some of our members and applicants speak English as a second language, having patience and the ability to communicate clearly are two vital traits necessary for success in this role. If you're well educated and have the ability to speak intelligently on a large variety of subjects, or consider yourself "worldly", that's a big plus. We find that individuals from a large variety of previous professional backgrounds are able to achieve success in this role, which makes this job a great opportunity for someone who is looking to switch fields, and still have the potential to earn an income of $100,000k/yr+. Our training staff is world class and will ensure that the candidates with the right mentality and skills are able to succeed in this job, so we encourage applicants from all background to apply! Ultimately, we find that the best candidates for the job are those that meet the requirements below and display the traits mentioned above. Furthermore, those who are highly motivated, willing to learn, are patient, and are able to properly follow directions given by our training staff and management make the ideal candidates. Candidates qualifications: • Minimum 3 years of professional experience o Candidates that have a background in the following industries or job functions are preferred: Legal, Real Estate, Retail, Marketing, Customer Service, Business Development, Client Relations, Administration, Insurance, & Sales • Must be fluent in English • Exhibit superior communication skills, especially over the phone and via email • Must be able to use and navigate a CRM system to help manage client relations (we will train you on this) o Previous use of any CRM software is a huge plus • Desire to work hard and succeed • Be outgoing and engaging as to build rapport and a solid relationship with applicants • Basic technological skills - must be able to use the Internet for basic job functions o Basic proficiency in MS word is expected as well o Being able to type efficiently is an important preferred skill • A Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution* (not required, but preferred) • A good sense of humor and being a "people person" is a plus Why Work For Us? / Compensation & Benefits We're a rapidly growing company with a great atmosphere and vibe. We exhibit a very open corporate culture, and take pride in being a great place to work. Our staff is energetic and friendly, and really enjoy working for us. Since we're a growing company there is room to advance. Furthermore, as a Client Services Representative you'll be afforded the opportunity to interact and connect with some of the most distinguished professionals in the world on a daily basis. Each day brings something new, and a wealth of interesting conversations. As for compensation and benefits: • A competitive base salary - this is commensurate with your skill set and previous experience • Lucrative daily, weekly, & monthly bonuses, commissions, and incentives for hitting certain targets • Most CSR's earn between $65,000 - $80,000/yr, with the top earners making $100,000/yr+ • Top tier medical benefits that are paid 100% by us (enrollment after 90 days) • Personal paid time off; vacation days, sick days • Office is closed for all major national holidays • 8:30am - 5:30pm* working hours with a one hour lunch o We do offer flexible working hours for well qualified candidates • Transportation reimbursement (for qualified candidates) • Paid training with our world class staff • Unlimited ongoing support and mentorship * Since we deal with clients all over the world, we do offer flexible working hours, along with different working shifts. If you apply and are contacted for an interview, feel free to inquire about more information. If you think you're a good fit for this position, we encourage you to apply right away. Please attach a copy of your resume so that we may review your information and contact you for an interview.

job.title: Vice President, Branch Manager - Long Island, NY (Lake Grove and Huntington)
SAP Solution Architect – Manager / Sr. Manager
Frontend Software Engineer
job.description:
Title: Frontend Software Engineer Date: Immediate Location: New York, NY Type: FTE (Full Time Employee)
JOB DESCRIPTION Symphony is seeking front end engineers with expert Javascript knowledge who have experience developing rich, high-performance, browser-based Javascript applications. You'll design and implement a rich, javascript-based, enterprise-class messaging application, including client-based end to end encryption and related security in the browser. We use backbone.js extensively and chrome wrapper / webkit for native integration.
Why you are needed now: A sophisticated and modern javascript UI is our #1 need for a few reasons: - huge customer and test base response for more features and the implementation of clean modern designs - each one of these features needs to integrate to be maintainable and secure - we have a great server side team, but our frontend developers are shaping the look and feel of our core product and we need more help now.
The problems you will be solving: - provide cutting edge features (search, notifications, resilience connections, rich presence / MPOP) but with a complete focus on not only end to end encryption, but also compliance and regulatory integration. The UI is a first class citizen in our model, and our business is built on providing features and security consideration never before combined.
RESPONSIBILITIES • Work with Product Designers to design and implement the next generation of Symphonys products • Build efficient and reusable front-end abstractions and systems • Identify and address performance bottlenecks • Participate in design and code reviews • Interact with other team members to incorporate their innovations and vice versa • Identify and communicate best practices for front-end engineering
REQUIREMENTS • 3+ years experience developing rich applications with HTML/CSS/JS • Ability to write high-performance, reusable code for UI components • Aware of but not reliant on Object Oriented JavaScript Frameworks (Prototype JS, MooTools, Dojo, etc.) • Experience with backbone.js, angular.js, node.js and similar technologies desired but not required • Passion for performance debugging and benchmarking • BS or MS degree in Computer Science or a related technical field
ABOUT SYMPHONY'S TECHNOLOGY STACK We selected Apache Kafka, Apache Solr, MongoDB and HBase due to their superior distributed nature, performance, reliability, and ability to scale to the volume of data generated by the expected workload. We built out the ReSTFUL web services layer in a stateless manner using Apache Tomcat, meaning capacity could be added linearly, by simply adding more boxes behind the load balancer. The client front end was conceived as a web client that could be delivered on any device, any operating system, anywhere in the world. To build it, we chose HTML5/CSS3, with JQuery, Backbone and Handlebars doing the bulk of the heavy lifting. Symphony's front-end web application uses the modular pattern made popular in CommonJS, which builds each component as a loosely coupled anonymous closure. The core of the JavaScript app handles request transport details, new message notifications and updates, configuration of the UI layout, and much more. These functions are abstracted behind a public sandbox and selectively bundled into modules when the components are loaded. This architecture helps Symphony add new components quickly and seamlessly because they are isolated from each other, and lets developers control exactly how much of the app needs to loadan architecture specifically designed for integration and customization.
ABOUT SYMPHONY Designed for the exchange of high-value content, Symphony is a secure communication and workflow platform that improves workplace productivity and connects users to their professional and personal community. Symphony has attracted the worlds top financial institutions with a $66 million investment to develop a scalable, cloud-based and highly secure collaboration and communication platform that will address the enterprise and compliance requirements for the financial services industry. The Symphony platform is intended to be used by some of the most time-conscious firms on the planet who are regularly corresponding high-value informationwhere a delay of a few seconds can have significant cost implications. Symphonys secure communication platform will be available to all financial institutions and professionals world-wide in mid-2015. Now were looking for top-notch engineers, programmers and marketers (etc.) to join our team in Palo Alto, CA and New York to help us change the way the world communicates. If you have the skills and savvy to work with a world-class team, and an appetite for game-changing disruption, we definitely want to hear from you.
SYMPHONY BENEFITS • Competitive salary based on experience, skills, and qualifications • Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage • 401(K) Plan • Life and AD&D coverage • Short Term and Long Term Disability coverage • Employee Assistance Program • Flexible Spending Account benefits • Uncapped vacation and sick time • Fully stocked kitchen and catered lunches • Discounted gym memberships • Many other fun and exciting benefits and activities!
COMPENSATION • Competitive Base Salary and Incentive (Stock Option) plan / Health/Dental/Vision/401k • (We accept existing H1B Visa applicants)
Symphony reserves the right of ownership for all unsolicited resumes submitted for this requisition and is not responsible for any fees associated with unsolicited resumes. Symphony appreciates your interest in our company. Symphony is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

job.title: Systems Engineer
job.description: Systems Engineer The Systems Engineer is responsible for supporting the definition of software and hardware products and interfaces and coordinating system development and integration tasks to include design integration and formal testing. We are looking for someone with 5+ years systems engineering experience with some hardware design experience. Clever Devices is an Equal Opportunity Employer

job.title: Associate Trial Attorney - New York, NY
Clinical Director
job.description:
The Westchester Wraparound Program is a community based Therapeutic Foster Boarding Home program, designed for youth who have been traditionally treated in residential settings. Youth are placed in specialized therapeutic foster homes, supported by a team comprised of clinicians and case managers working in partnership with foster parents, birth families and involved community members to support the youth in striving to reach his/her full potential.
The Clinical Director ensures the delivery of quality clinical treatment services to youth/adolescents within the context of structured programming, including clinical intake, discharge, counseling, service/discharge plans, record keeping, training and supervision of clinical staff, oversight of internship program, and supervision for therapists seeking licensure for Wraparound Program with therapeutic foster care component in Westchester County, New York.
Responsible for the implementation and on-going development of the clinical component of Westchester Wraparound Therapeutic Foster Care program. Provides supervision to lead clinicians, facilitates weekly clinical team meetings and provides supervision for therapists seeking licensure. Works with Home Finding department in providing clinical assessment of referred youth. Oversight and facilitation of internship program including screening and selection, orientation, assignment, supervision and performance management of interns, region- wide. Provides coverage in clinical areas as needed to ensure quality care, acts as licensed back-up individual to provide adequate treatment services to clients and to cover when the lead clinician is not available, provides clinical back-up to all clinical programs in crisis situations, participates in on-call rotation schedule. Facilitates clinical training activities. Monitors assessment tools for family and youth admissions procedures and ensures client records and documentation is maintained as necessary, including review of progress notes. Maintains knowledge of best practices when working with youth population with complex challenges, staying up to date regarding trainings, conferences, research and policy. Advocates for youth population with complex challenges, as well as foster care and biological families whenever possible.
Must posses a current LCSW or LicSW in the State of New York with at least 3 years’ experience directing and overseeing a clinical department/setting. Experience in community-based programs, preferably working with youths and families.

job.title: Locum Tenens Family Medicine Job in New York (Physician)
Associate PhD
job.description: ​​​​​​Who We Are Cornerstone Research is a leading economic and financial consulting firm with more than 500 staff members across eight offices. Together with an extensive network of internationally prominent faculty, we conduct rigorous, objective research applying the highest standards from academia to address complex financial, economic, accounting, and marketing issues that arise in litigation and regulatory investigation. Cornerstone Research is involved in a broad variety of high-profile legal cases and disputes. Current matters focus on such topics as capital markets, business and securities valuation, M&A and corporate events, risk management, market competition, the impact of marketing on consumers, and patent infringement. For example, we address issues affecting the ongoing development of financial markets, such as applying the intersection of finance and industrial organization economics to evaluate price setting in derivative markets. Beyond the financial markets, we address financial economics issues arising in a range of sectors, from such innovation-driven industries as life sciences and high technology to energy, telecommunications, and industrial markets. We address economic issues when evaluating potential mergers, claims of anticompetitive conduct, and the impact of intellectual property infringement. We also address marketing and economic issues arising in cases with allegations of misleading marketing or false claims. More detail can be found on our website at www.cornerstone.com. Associates at Cornerstone Research Cornerstone Research provides an interesting and rewarding work environment. Those joining our firm enjoy long-term career opportunities supported substantially by our investments in their professional development and an escalating compensation structure. Associates work at the core of our client project teams and in the development of our practice, assuming increasing levels of responsibility. The firm has grown steadily over more than twenty-five years and we maintain a firm culture that is collegial, supportive, friendly, and collaborative. We benefit from close collaboration with renowned leading academics in finance and economics. Associates help devise and apply innovative analytical approaches meeting the highest academic standards to address challenging issues arising in our work. We invest heavily in leading edge information resources and computing capabilities, and often have access to proprietary data to inform our analysis. Associates help guide teams supported by our outstanding research analysts. Career development includes staying attuned to – and contributing to the development of – the latest academic research. Associates continue to hone their own research skills while building communications and managerial abilities. The firm supports the development of those interested in becoming testifying experts in some or all of their work, and of those not choosing that path. Either approach provides opportunities for career advancement. Candidate Profile Cornerstone Research provides exceptional career opportunities for those who have pursued doctoral studies in finance, economics, accounting, or marketing. Casework at Cornerstone Research challenges Ph.D. candidates to apply the entire breadth of theoretical and empirical skills gained through their doctoral training. Candidates must have the ability to apply academic research to real-world issues and present concise explanations of complex analyses. The ideal candidate has demonstrated strong analytical, communication, and teamwork skills. We offer an industry-competitive compensation and benefits package. We are currently hiring in our Boston, Chicago, Los Angeles, Menlo Park (CA), New York, San Francisco, and Washington, DC offices. We will be interviewing at the ASSA/AEA annual meetings in January 2015. job.title: Sr. IRM Threat & Vulnerability Engineer
job.description: Overview General Description and Responsibilities The Information Risk Management [IRM] Specialist Vulnerability & Threat will play a critical role in data security. It will encompass a broad range of information security controls to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of enterprise data stored on a variety of vendor database solutions. The job is composed of tactical, operational and strategic functions and responsibilities. Responsibilities Include: • Conduct Information Security assessments / penetration tests, as an individual, self-managed tester, or in small project teams. • Search for security vulnerabilities in web applications and assess the secure configuration of operating systems and network devices. • Apply industry best practices for vulnerability and threat management. • Document findings for management and technical staff and recommend mitigating actions. • Work with internal customers to determine their need for security assessments, present and explain the employed methodology, and support them with feedback and verification during mitigation. • Develop training on secure coding techniques and security awareness for technical staff (e.g., software developers). Position Requirements • Bachelors Degree in Information Technology, Computer Security, Computer Science or related field required. • 1 -2 years of penetration testing/vulnerability management • Ability to maintain composure in a dynamic environment • Individual must be proactive, self-motivated, detail-oriented, creative, inquisitive and persistent • Strong leadership skills, including ability to execute and prioritize a number of tasks simultaneously • Ability to organize, plan and implement work assignments, prioritize competing demands and work under pressure of frequent and tight deadlines • Demonstrates high level of productivity and sense of urgency • Experience in conducting and facilitating discussions with employees across all levels & departments • Ability to approach problems systematically, researching all alternatives and making appropriate recommendations • Excellent presentation, verbal and written communication skills • Excellent up-to-date technical and hands-on knowledge and experience in current attack methods, penetration testing methods, and hacking tools, especially for web applications required. o Tools: NMap, Nessus, Burp suite, Metasploit, AppScan Standard, AppScan Source, McAfee Vulnerability Manager, Core Impact o Common vulnerabilities and how to find and verify them: authentication (e.g., secure transmission, weak login mechanisms, backend authentication, weak SSL configuration), authorization (e.g., session handling, replay, fixation), client-side attacks (e.g., XSS, CSRF), information disclosure (e.g., error handling, debug information), code injection (e.g., SQL, OS commands, buffer overflow, format strings), logic attacks (e.g., lockout, flooding, insufficient anti-automation, spoofing), review of secure configuration of OS and network devices o Knowledge of the J2EE technology stack a must but proficiency in .Net stack a plus o Knowledge of mobile application penetration testing frameworks and techniques a plus • Knowledge of IT-Security Threat & Risk Assessments, Secure Coding, conducting workshops on IT-Security topics, and Secure Development Lifecycle is a plus • Strong hands-on and can-do attitude, excellent interpersonal and intercultural skills, ability to work in teams of technical and non-technical experts • Excellent communication skills (written & verbal) in English a must to be able to present complex technical topics in a clear and structured way, ability to moderate discussions, meetings, and projects. Being able to assume role as a trusted topic matter expert. • Ability to work methodically and independently and prioritize work • Other duties as assigned.

At Hennion & Walsh, an Account Executive is the first step to a rewarding career in the financial services industry. The Account Executive position at Hennion & Walsh is ideal for someone that already has their Series 7 and Series 63 licenses and is looking to advance their career as a Financial Advisor, a Registered Service Advisor or one of the other critical roles at Hennion & Walsh. Hennion & Walsh provides ongoing training and support to all of our Account Executives. We have a proven success model that enables you to build a long-term career. We are looking for performance-driven personalities and entrepreneurs in spirit who are looking to build a career helping the individual investor achieve their financial goals and dreams. Submit your resume today.
Overview Hennion & Walsh is an advocate for the individual investor. We believe in putting the client first. At Hennion & Walsh, we know individual investors want a personal relationship with their advisor, and we believe in guiding our clients to achieve their financial goals and dreams through conservative income and growth strategies. We are searching for highly talented and motivated individuals of all educational backgrounds to join our dynamic work force as Account Executives. Our ideal candidates will have the Series 7 and Series 63 licenses, 1-2 years of relevant experience, thrive in a fast-paced environment, are goal-oriented, possess a great attitude, and communicate extremely well. We have immediate openings!
Opportunity Work for a successful investment firm dedicated to performance, integrity, service, and innovation Gain business expertise and market knowledge through our comprehensive training and mentoring program Perform in an energetic, open environment Succeed in an achievement-based culture Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education/experience Series 7 and Series 63 licenses Personal or professional track record of achievement Highly professional work ethic Ability to handle multiple responsibilities and take initiative Excellent organizational and time management skills Benefits Competitive compensation Open and supportive team-based environment Full medical and dental benefits 401(k) plan with company match

job.title: Sr. Java Developer
job.description:
Position: Sr. Java DeveloperLocation: New York City & Iselin, NJ About Vitech Vitech Systems Group is one of the world's leading providers of administration software to pension, investment, insurance and health plan administrators. The V3 System serves many of the world’s premier investment organizations with a combined $1 trillion in assets under management, and benefits clients servicing over 13,000,000 members. Our mission is to help organizations improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their operations while increasing service levels and broadening service offerings. We do this via the V3 System, our enterprise software platform that addresses a broad array of administration requirements and includes native workflow, imaging, CRM and self-service capabilities. Our clients are seeking out a competitive edge through technology and solutions, and they rely on our team of industry domain and technical experts to design and deliver it. Here’s your chance to join a dynamic, global team of technology and domain subject matter experts, developers, quality assurance experts and business analysts who are helping shape the future of technology. Vitech currently has over 750 employees with offices and clients throughout the world. We are proud to share that Vitech has been in continuous, profitable operations for over 20 years. We offer a competitive compensation package and a comprehensive benefits program to ensure employees' health, well-being and financial security. Vitech Systems Group is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and strongly supports diversity in the workforce. Visit us on the web at: www.vitechinc.com
Overview Be a part of building smart solutions for complex problems, and join Vitech’s elite engineering team! Vitech is looking for talented, motivated and passionate Software Engineers who thrive on developing smart solutions for complex technology problems. We are in the midst of building an elite team of software engineers to keep Vitech’s business and technology at the forefront of innovation. This role will allow you to work on product strategy, development and interface with senior leadership in creating our next generation, Agile driven V3 Software platform. Our product team pushes the boundary on feature development, resulting in a varied and interesting assortment of tech challenges to solve. The roles are based at our world headquarters in the heart of Manhattan or in our state-of-the-art Iselin, NJ office.
Requirements • Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering or similar. • Minimum of 5 year of experience with Java J2EE programming/Java Development • Experience with one or more web technologies such as GWT (Google Web Toolkit), HTML, CSS, Ajax, etc. • Familiarity with one or more application servers such as Tomcat, Oracle 10gAS, WebSphere, WebLogic, etc. • Web Services, AJAX, REST, XML, JQuery • Strong written and verbal communication skills • Self-motivated and able to work in a team environment Other Desired Skills and Experience • Experience with an IOC container such as Spring a plus • Experience with an ORM tool such as Hibernate a plus • Knowledge of Oracle PL/SQL is a plus or any other relational database is a plus • Master's degree preferred

job.title: Liquidations Manager
job.description: Company Description Since 1925, Haband's wide selection of high-quality, value-oriented products ranging from the latest fashion styles for men & women to home furnishings to gifts & gadgets, and the newest lifestyle convenience products, continues to delight customers with a homespun feel and extraordinary value. Haband is part of the Orchard Brands family. ORCHARD BRANDS is a family of catalog and web brands that offers endless options from fashion, footwear and accessories, to home and travel, beauty and grooming, gifting and more all for mature adults, active retirees, boomers and senior alike. Whether you are looking for style, value or amazing selection, you are likely to find what you are looking for with one of our brands. Although we are 15 distinct brands, we all have a simple and common core purpose: to give you world-class service and total satisfaction. For more information on Orchard Brands and our affiliated brands, please visit http://orchardbrands.com/ Job Description Haband is seeking a Liquidations Manager who will be responsible to manage the efficient liquidation of overstock inventory through web, promotional paper media, and outside agents for sale to retailers, including maximizing the use of excess inventory while maintaining the best dollar recovery and managing several conduits for the liquidation of excess inventory, following established policies, procedures, practices, requirements, and standards. Essential Position Responsibilities:Print Media Vehicles:• Identify overstock for catalogs and direct mail pieces (flyers); coordinate the production of seasonal sale books, monthly package inserts, and Blow-ins, including pricing strategy, demand forecasts, circulation adjustments, page count recommendations, and annual schedules.• Responsible for the merchandising, pricing, financial recovery, and the accuracy of all sales vehicles. Upsells• Select product for weekly telephone upsells to maximize product cost recovery. Vendors/ Jobbers:• Responsible to source, select, and negotiate product, and negotiate product with external liquidation vendors to sell off both first and second quality goods, for dollar recovery, and for meeting forecast demand. Web site:• Oversee all budgetary and functional perspectives of the liquidation portion of web sites including the development of marketing strategies and procedures targeted to maximize inventory turn and recovery, and product selection, marketing, and pricing inclusive of clearance countdown promotions in coordination with the web team. Liquidation:• Identify liquidation items based on review of return rates, significant overstocks, and discontinued colors and items, including managing the movement of these items to sales agents, and sourcing additional profitable liquidation channels. Additional Position Responsibilities:• Manage excess, obsolete and discontinued inventory. Supervisory Responsibility:Responsible to hire staff and personnel, participate in and recommend employee and personnel development measures and disciplinary actions, to evaluate personnel performance, and to recommend or terminate personnel following established organizational policies, procedures, and practices. Qualifications Essential Experience:• Requires a minimum of three (3) to five (5) years of merchandising/inventory control or liquidation experience in a catalog or retail environment. Essential Knowledge and Skills:• Requires a Bachelor degree or equivalent business experience. Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

job.title: Senior Accountant/Financial Analyst
job.description: Coyne is looking for an experienced Senior Accountant/Financial Analyst to join our team in NJ! The Senior Accountant/ Financial Analyst will support the organizations accounting and finance requirements, developing and delivering accurate reporting and improving accounting processes, as well as assisting in special projects and analysis. The candidate should be a self-starter, highly motivated, detailed- oriented, an excellent multi-tasker and comfortable working in a fast-paced open working environment. Responsibilities: Participate in month end close and annual audits Prepare journal entries as part of the month end and year close processes Analyze general ledger activity and prepare account reconciliations for Balance Sheet and Income Statement accounts as assigned Prepare and complete monthly and yearly close process to ensure timely reporting financial results Maintain and review Fixed Assets schedule and run monthly depreciation Support P&L Reporting Develop monthly and quarterly forecasts, and annual budgets Conduct analysis and develop insights that improve the quality of decision making within the division management team Work closely with managers to understand and analyze business results Develop and analyze internal pricing strategies Develop formal and ad hoc reports Desired Skills and Experience: Bachelors Degree in Accounting or Finance 5-7 years of experience in accounting & finance Experience working in an advertising agency or PR agency preferred MBA preferred CPA highly preferred Strong computer skills, including Advanced Excel Ability to think conceptually and analytically about key impacts of operations on financial results Strong verbal communications skills Ability to lead others while maintaining effective business relationships with associates throughout the organization

job.title: Senior Product and Business Development Manager
job.description: Position Summary: The Product and Business Development Manager will have the responsibility of developing product and business opportunities for the Marine and Domestic segments. This role is responsible for analyzing market trends and identifying opportunities within the chassis-related transportation and the greater intermodal industry. The Product and Business Development Manager will manage all aspects of Product Marketing including research & development, targeting, placement for these business opportunities. The Product and Business Development Manager will collaborate with Sales Account Managers, Pool and Depot Operations, Technology and Finance to deliver best in class chassis solutions to the transportation marketplace. Responsibilities: The Product and Business Development Manager will take a strategic view and develop a clear product strategy for the first and last mile of the supply chain with a focus on chassis solutions. Responsible for launching new product concepts and strategies such as premium products and products aimed at new markets. Map and drive execution within the organization focusing the resources required to deliver aggressive volume and revenue targets. Build a business case to support adoption of new services or processes. This will include clearly stated customer need, scope and scale, Product Pricing recommendations, quantified revenue opportunities and the creation of a strategic roadmap. Placement Strategy: identify locations key to the supply chain such as marine and rail terminals, depots and CYs and drive TRAC product distribution thru these channels. The Product Manager will manage the development of terms and conditions enabling TRAC to execute customer requirements Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Required: Bachelors degree required, advanced degree such as MBA preferred Minimum five (5) years experience in product development and marketing Experience in logistics or transportation preferred Successful track record of new product development and execution Must be able to multi-task and work independently as well as contribute to the overall success of the team Flexibility to quickly adapt to change Must be able to competently handle competing, multiple tasks simultaneously Ability to prioritize, meet deadlines and excel in a fast paced and dynamic work environment Competent at preparing and evaluating business performance Complex and detailed project management experience required Superior financial acumen (P & L, Forecasting, Budgets) Superior problem solving and decision making skills Self-driven and results-oriented professional with exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, including effective writing and public speaking skills Motivated self-starter, persistent in a marketing environment, able to work with limited supervision Advanced computer skills (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) and ability to learn proprietary in-house systems

job.title: Strategic Account Manager
job.description:
Department: Sales Location: Woodbridge, NJ Description: Sell the industry's most innovative solutions Join the pioneer of cloud-based services. Broadview Networks ranks 28th on the Information Week 500 list of top technology innovators and is the 65th largest privately held company in New York. We lead the industry in helping companies leverage various technologies, including our patented cloud-based platforms, to ensure business continuity. Broadview Networks is a network-based communications and cloud services provider serving business customers nationwide. It provides the total solution for business communications, including local and long distance voice communications, premises-based and patented hosted VoIP systems, data services encompassing VPN- and MPLS-enabled applications, traditional telephone hardware, high-speed Internet services, a full suite of managed services, and a range of professional services. Broadview customers benefit from award-winning customer service, including a web-based account management tool and a primary point-of-contact for real-time, personal customer care. Broadview ranks in the top 10 providers of business VoIP services, with over 100,000 business people relying on our OfficeSuite phone system every day. We consistently win awards for our innovative services, including recently being named Small and Medium Sized Business Service of the Year by an independent panel of judges from top-tier news outlets including ABC, Businessweek, Computerworld, eWeek, Financial Times, Forbes, FOX News, Network World, PC Magazine, and USA Today. Plus, we back up every customer and every service with award-winning customer service and support that is available 24X7X365. Unlike other providers, OfficeSuite and our cloud computing services are incredibly easy to use for both employees and administrators. We provide full enterprise-grade services and unique features to companies nationwide. Our cloud services are incredibly flexible and can scale quickly as organizations change. We are looking for sales professionals to join our organization. Responsibilities: Developing new business relationships with targeted leads provided by company Prospecting targeted leads to set appointments to present Broadview Networks products & services with a strong emphasis on Hosted/Cloud based products Obtaining signed service contracts from new customers in effort to meet and/or exceed all quotas Managing and maintaining CRM database for all prospect information to 100% accuracy Providing customer satisfaction and retention support as needed to maintain existing client relationships sold by Account Executive Providing management with accurate forecast, funnel and all additional required activity/sales metrics Up-selling existing customer base with new products and/or technologies Attending weekly meetings, trainings and coaching sessions with Sales Directors and/or Regional Directors
Requirements: Minimum five (5) years of outside, face to face sales experience preferably in hosted IP or Cloud Based industry or a minimum of five (5) years experience selling applications / solutions Territory Management background Minimum two (2) years experience using CRM system (Sales Force, Etc.) Strong relationship building, presentation & closing skills Proven track record of meeting and exceeding quota Broadview provides on the job training and a proven sales methodology to make sure you have the skills and tools necessary for peak performance. We will work with you to develop and hone your skill sets and knowledge while you work with a broad range of companies. We offer a comprehensive compensation structure that does not limit your earning potential. We also offer a competitive benefits package consisting of medical, dental, vision, 401(k), life insurance and paid time off. Broadview Networks is an Affirmative Action / Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/H/V

Configuration Engineer - Windows
job.description: The Configuration Engineer will be responsible for configuration management, execution, tracking, risk assessment, and documentation delivery to ensure that configuration management process meet or exceed the expectations of delivery and product teams across the organization. A key part of the role is to partner with delivery teams to proactively ensure better quality by rapidly building, testing, & deploying deliverables via reliable and repeatable processes with traceability and evidence. This position requires a familiarity with agile methodologies, continuous integration, with a drive towards continuous improvement along with a demonstrated ability to coordinate with multiple teams and projects. Responsibilities: Owns, designs, develops and implements complete configuration management policies and processes to support multiple product lines and services. Provides source code management expertise to ensure no code is lost, know what code is deployed when and where, and assist in branching and merging implementations. Implements environment configuration patterns and practices to allow for consistent single binary code deployment to each environment in an isolated rollback capable fashion. Integrates Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) tools from concept through implementation with the code to deploy delivery process. Works with development team to establish code versioning guidelines that provide prompt feedback to allow for timely adjustment and revalidation. Strives to reduce complexity and assists development, QA and engineering with utilizing automation, Source Control and CM tool sets to decrease their time to value & warranty support work. Automates to reduce manual error-prone steps and builds out repeatable Continuous Integration (CI), Continuous Testing (CT) and Continuous Delivery (CD). Functions as the technical “Tool Smith” and liaison with release management planning, Change Control Board (CCB) communications and oversight for best of breed build and delivery practices. Provide support for the existing applications and databases as required. Investigate new technologies and approaches to address business needs and improve existing systems. Using and recommending best practices for application development support. Ensure that software products meet all prerequisites (ex: code review) before releasing software to various environments (Dev, QA, Staging, or Production). Collaborates with Infrastructure Engineers, Application Development, Users and Management to coordinate changes. job.title: Financial Advisor
job.description:
Series 7 and Series 63 licenses required. Please do not move forward if you do not have these certifications. At Hennion & Walsh, an Account Executive is the first step to a rewarding career in the financial services industry. The Account Executive position at Hennion & Walsh is ideal for someone that already has their Series 7 and Series 63 licenses and is looking to advance their career as a Financial Advisor, a Registered Service Advisor or one of the other critical roles at Hennion & Walsh. Hennion & Walsh provides ongoing training and support to all of our Account Executives. We have a proven success model that enables you to build a long-term career. If you are of highly motivated character and looking to join a vibrant growing company, Hennion & Walsh, Inc. may be the right choice for you. We are looking for performance-driven personalities and entrepreneurs in spirit who are looking to build a career helping the individual investor achieve their financial goals and dreams. Submit your resume today.
Overview Hennion & Walsh is an advocate for the individual investor. We believe in putting the client first. At Hennion & Walsh, we know individual investors want a personal relationship with their advisor, and we believe in guiding our clients to achieve their financial goals and dreams through conservative income and growth strategies. We are searching for highly talented and motivated individuals of all educational backgrounds to join our dynamic work force as Account Executives. Our ideal candidates will have the Series 7 and Series 63 licenses, 1-2 years of relevant experience, thrive in a fast-paced environment, are goal-oriented, possess a great attitude, and communicate extremely well. We have immediate openings!
Opportunity Work for a successful investment firm dedicated to performance, integrity, service, and innovation Gain business expertise and market knowledge through our comprehensive training and mentoring program Perform in an energetic, open environment Succeed in an achievement-based culture
Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of education/experience Series 7 and Series 63 licenses Personal or professional track record of achievement Highly professional work ethic Ability to handle multiple responsibilities and take initiative Excellent organizational and time management skills
Benefits Competitive compensation Open and supportive team-based environment Full medical and dental benefits 401(k) plan with company match

job.description: SR. MANAGER, FRANCHISE PROJECT MANAGER-4985150108DescriptionJohnson & Johnson Consumer Products Company Division of Johnson & Johnson Consumer Companies, Inc. is searching for a Manager, Franchise Project Management for our Skillman, NJ location. The Pay Grade for this role is: 31.Johnson & Johnson Consumer Products Company Division of Johnson & Johnson Consumer Companies, Inc. is searching for a Manager of Franchise Project Management. Johnson & Johnson Consumer Products Company Division of Johnson & Johnson Consumer Companies, Inc. develops and markets baby care, wound care and skin care products that address the needs of consumers and health care professionals and incorporate the latest innovations. The portfolio includes heritage brands such as BAND-AID®, LISTERINE® and, JOHNSON'S® Baby, as well as leading skin care brands such as NEUTTOGENA®, AVEENO® and CLEAN & CLEAR®.The Manager, Franchise Project Management will lead, coach and develop a team of new product project managers who oversee regional New Product projects for the Skincare business. The scope of New Product projects is from charter through to measuring marketplace performance and lessons learned. The goal is the on-time launch of new products that deliver on consumer insights, while meeting financial, quality, customer service, inventory, and cost goals.The Manager, Franchise Project Management will serve as the primary New Product Project Management contact and liaison for business partners including but not limited to, the General Manager, VP of Sales, VP of Marketing, Franchise RD&E Leader, Global Design Leader and CFO for the business supported, providing strong partnering and keeping the organization appropriately informed of new product risk and developments. This role also provides overall project management leadership for new product governance and decision making forums and participates in franchise level strategy setting teams as required.The Manager, Franchise Project Management will lead large scale new product commercialization programs for the Skincare business. They will also be responsible for portfolio management, measuring marketplace performance and incorporating lessons learned through process improvement initiatives. This position will report into the Franchise Project Management Director for Baby/Beauty.QualificationsThe qualified candidate will have a minimum of a Bachelor’s degree. An advanced degree (MA, MS, MBA) is a plus. A minimum of 10 years combined experience in two or more of the following functional areas is required: Engineering, Research and Development, Sales, Planning, Finance, Marketing and/or Operational function. A demonstrated history of managing complexity is required. An individual with strong understanding of the commercial landscape and consumer product industry experience in a fast paced environment is preferred. A minimum of three years experience demonstrating and utilizing Project Management and Product Lifecycle Management practices is essential to this role. Experience managing a portfolio of projects using Microsoft Project is highly desired. It is preferred that this candidate have experience with Six Sigma/Process Excellence Tools, Training and/or Certification. Project Management Training and/or Project Management Professional (PMP) Certified experience is preferred.This candidate will have solid business knowledge, sound judgment, strong technical, communication, leadership, influencing, and change management skills.This candidate may be required to travel up to 15% of the time, domestically and internationally. The role is located in Skillman, NJ.J2W LI NAPrimary Location:North America-United States-New Jersey-SkillmanOrganization: Johnson & Johnson Consumer Inc. job.description: R&D QA Specialist (Auditor)-3123150409DescriptionJanssen Research and Development, LLC, a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for an R&D QA Specialist (Auditor) to be located in Raritan, NJ, Titusville, NJ or Spring House, PA.Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C. develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. Research and development areas encompass novel targets in neurologic disorders, gastroenterology, oncology, infectious disease, diabetes, hematology, metabolic disorders, immunologic disorders, and reproductive medicine. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.The R&D QA Specialist (Auditor) independently plans, conducts and reports routine and supports non-routine R&D QA audits/assessments/inspections of the J&J Pharmaceutical sector worldwide, including J&J Operating Companies (including Consumer for pharmacovigilance), partners and service providers. These audits/assessments/inspections provide an independent quality assessment to ensure compliance with appropriate regulations, SOPs, processes, etc. as they pertain to company-sponsored R&D and pharmacovigilance activities, to maintain quality within region (Americas, Europe, Middle East & Africa (EMEA), Asia Pacific). Also contributes to other compliance and quality activities, as assigned.Responsibilities include: Leads the planning, conduct and reporting of R&D QA routine audits and supports non-routine audits of activities, data, internal facilities and processes in GxP/non-regulated areas to assure adherence to corporate policies, internal standards/requirements and compliance with applicable regulatory requirements. Non-routine audits include Due Diligence, for cause audits, cross-functional, complex/sensitive system/service provider audits as defined by the scope. Ensures the relevant standard procedures, diagnostic tools, and audit plans are fully understood and applied in audit activities. Supports regulatory inspections in various supporting roles. Completes assigned training requirements in a timely manner to ensure inspection readiness at all times. May assist in the preparation of training material if requested. Participates in projects or serves on teams, as assigned by supervisor. Meets priorities, checkpoints and timelines for all aspects of work and projects to achieve adequate progress. Provides consultation to business partners on routine tasks with occasional supervision. Cooperates with business partners when contacted for compliance inquiries and seeks advice on non-routine and more complex issues to ensure a departmental unified position.QualificationsA minimum of a bachelor’s degree is required; A minimum of 4 years experience in a Pharmaceutical, R&D, or Healthcare environment is required; Auditing experience in pre-clinical, non-clinical or pharmacovigilance preferred; Understanding of the drug development process required; Knowledge in one or more specific compliance disciplines (non-regulated, GLP, GCP, PV or computerized systems) required; Knowledge of procedural and records management requirements in a regulated industry required; Prior pharmaceutical and quality/compliance related experience preferred; This position will require up to 40% overnight domestic and international travel.BE VITAL in your career; be seen for the talent you bring to your work.
