Every day we are creating products for those who love fitness as much as we do; products that allow you to get every ounce out of your work-out, run, walk, yoga, step or dance class.We believe fitness is a way of life… that as humans we were made to move. Movement not only makes your body stronger, it makes you the best possible you…body, mind and spirit.At Reebok, our employees embrace this mission and are encouraged to reach for their fitness goals – as well as their career and personal goals. It’s part of the fabric of who we are and what we stand for.SALES ASSOCIATEPURPOSE:As a Reebok Sales Associate, you are responsible for providingcustomers with an impactful and positive shopping experience. In this role, it is important to convert “lookers” into “buyers” by utilizingelements of the customer service model as well as product knowledge that is provided. Sales Associates create an exciting and fun store environment while also being a key component to the team.KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:You sell by prioritizing between customer service and store operations for maximum retail impact.You serve by identifying shopping behaviors accurately and responding appropriately.You use Brand and product knowledge to sell by showing a passion for the products and positively demonstrating the Brand Values.You perform store operations by being detail-oriented in receiving, displaying, merchandising and replenishing product, as well as in maintaining a clean and organized store environment.You are a team player by understanding the beneﬁts of teamwork and are able to work as part of a team.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES:• Ability to build an emotional connection with customers by being a passionate and enthusiastic Brand ambassador• Awareness of individual and store goals while assisting customers• Ability to educate customers on special features and benefits of the product offer on the sales floor• Ability to help build a strong customer base by inspiring confidence and loyalty to the brand• Dynamically communicates a desire to learn and is open to receiving feedback to drive personal developmentQUALIFICATIONS:• Must be a minimum of 16 years of age• Effective verbal and written communication skills• Physical requirements include ability to lift and/or move up to 75 pounds, as well as stand for extended periods of timeAt Reebok, we’re not defined by a sport or a season, but by a way of life. From early morning runs to lunchtime workouts to biking and hiking, fitness is what wakes us up in the morning, what we think about all day and what drives us toward tomorrow.So is Reebok a fit for you? Apply for this role to find out.SUBMISSION DETAILS:At Reebok, our employees are encouraged to reach their career, fitness and personal goals. In an effort to gain a better understanding of who you are and how we can help you succeed, we require that you complete a pre-hire assessment as part of our application process. The assessment takes roughly 30 minutes to complete and you are able to start and finish at your convenience. Please note the assessment must be complete before we can consider your application.Posting Notes: Paramus || New Jersey || United States || 664 || Reebok || Americas || No Selection Apply on Career Site

job.title: Director, NA Analytics
job.description: Director, NA Analytics-9767150311DescriptionJohnson and Johnson Inc. is recruiting for a Director, NA Analytics. This position will be located in Skillman, NJ to start; however, it will move to New Brunswick, NJ later this year. Travel up to 10% required.Johnson and Johnson Inc. is a member of the Johnson and Johnson Family of Companies, the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices and diagnostics. Johnson and Johnson Inc. markets innovative consumer products focusing on skin and hair care, baby care, wound care, oral health and women's health as well as a broad range of well-known and trusted over-the-counter products through our McNeil Consumer Healthcare division.At Johnson and Johnson Inc. our purpose is to "Bring Science to the Art of Healthy Living" by providing consumers with some of the most world's most widely used and trusted brands including; JOHNSON'S ® Baby, NEUTROGENA®, AVEENO® LISTERINE®, BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages, TYLENOL®, REACTINE® , BENYLIN® , NICORETTE®, NICODERM® and many more.Johnson and Johnson Inc. aspires to accelerating game-changing analytics as a core capability that fuels our competitive edge through differentiated insights and better, faster decisions, enabling our purpose and driving sustainable growth.The Director, NA Analytics reports to the Vice-President – Global Analytics as part of the Global Analytics COE, and will sit on Global Analytics Leadership Team. This senior executive is responsible for building and adapting transformational analytics capabilities for the region – making current insights and analytics more efficient and effective while also adding new capabilities and setting the foundation for smarter insights that fuels our competitive edge through better and faster decisions.The Director, NA Analytics defines and owns the North America analytics strategy, manages supplier/syndicated relationships/contracts, leverages and adapts globally defined priority analytics capability, enforces regional governance and outcome measurement, deploys regional organization and talent strategies and fosters an ‘analytics first’ culture as a champion of change in ensuring J&J embraces discipline and fact-based state-of-the-art analytic solutions to drive consumer and shopper engagement and help drive sales and profitability.This executive manages a team of data and information management leaders, technical professionals, and other specialists, and promotes the organization’s use of advanced analytical technologies and capabilities to optimize investments and predict market actions.The incumbent must build strong collaborative partnerships with senior business leaders across Regional Marketing Services (GSI, digital, professional, MX), Regional Marketing Operations (RMO), and business leaders across both regional customer and marketing teams.Major responsibilities include: Oversee analytics strategy, coordinating and aligning the delivery and support of analytics for the region and markets, ensuring adoption of globally defined standards across all key stakeholder groups while engraining analytics in key decisions to drive outcomes. Clearly and continuously communicate analytic vision, ensuring on-going regional stakeholder sponsorship and alignment. Serve as NA analytics thought leader and change agent within and outside the company; Makes decisions and recommendations that are clearly linked to the organization's strategy and financial goals and drives performance improvement; Oversee analytic and data supplier and sourcing strategy with guidelines and disciplined processes to manage, gather, and integrate data from internal, external, syndicated, unstructured/structured, video/voice/text sources.The Director will ensure overall analytic capabilities are increasing at a rate commensurate with the volume, velocity and variety of data available to the organization, regionalizing and localizing globally defined advanced capabilities that ensure consistent use of modeling, simulation, forecasting and discovery methods to drive decision-making across all marketing and customer teams: Adapt and deploy globally standardized processes, predictive and real-time models with advanced simulation tools that drive spend and performance optimization opportunities in the region for priority brands and markets; Drive sustainable revenue growth through the delivery and on-going support of advanced and automated advertising, digital, pricing, promotion, assortment simulation models and insight decision making; Leverage and deploy globally developed consistent processes, predictive sales forecasting and business planning methods including demand sensing, causal factors and risk volatility; Leverage market structures to derive differentiated consumer/shopper insights that enhance understanding of our consumers and the marketplace, leading to larger product launches, executional excellence and innovation. Focus on consumer and shopper segmentation, market/purchase structure, brand offer optimization, test and learn analysis, and other improved performance program.Additional responsibilities include: Enable market performance tracking in partnership with the RMO – deploying standardized, automated consistent and globally aligned management reports, dashboards, key performance indicators and data for self-serve; Mobilize integrated analytics organization providing consistent and trusted analytic expertise, inspiration, insights and decision support to the RMO, marketing and customer teams. Attract, develop and retain pipeline of highly engaged, superior internal and externally sourced analytics talent. Advance overall analytics IQ by building analytics learning into regional marketing (MX) and customer (CX) talent strategies, engraining ‘lead with data’ philosophy; Activate agile regional analytics portfolio management and governance framework that optimizes and scales investments, and measures outcomes – aligned and connected to global standards and processes; Establish and maintain global aligned, regional data strategy enabling standard use of data through managed suppliers, sourcing strategies, ingestion processes and storage schemas for high quality, authoritative data sets. Define and enforce global data governance policies for data stewardship and quality at the regional level; In partnership with IT, enable advanced analysis, knowledge exchange and self-service through the regionalization of a globally enabled flexible and adaptable future-state analytics technology platform that enables advanced and predictive insight generation, driving better business decisions and enabling growth.QualificationsMaster’s or MBA in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or other related fields with emphasis in quantitative methods is required. A minimum of 12 years of managing technical teams; strong leadership, communication and interpersonal skills; effective manager of people and strong team-building skills is required. Experience in information-intensive industries or digitally advanced enterprises are preferred. Working knowledge of the CPG business (both client and supplier), the information that drives it, and the analytical approaches that are appropriate is preferred. Strong domain expertise with experiences in multivariate statistical analysis including regression, regression tree, logistic regression, cluster analysis, behavioral market structure etc. is required. Knowledge of data structure; information systems/tools, and related software and data management; enterprise content management, and record-keeping policies and practices are required. Demonstrated strength in examining issues, shaping strategy and influencing effectively across the organization, driving people, process and technology change is required. Demonstrated ability to improve organizational performance through the application of original thinking to existing and emerging methods, processes, products and services is required. Employs sound judgment in determining how innovations will be deployed to produce a value outcome is required. Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (oral and written), including the ability to explain digital concepts and technologies to business leaders, as well as business concepts to technologists is required. Demonstrated strength in partnering with internal/external contacts globally to generate mutually beneficial, long-term opportunities and negotiating win-win outcomes is required. Demonstrated ability to manage large team across business and technical areas is required. Ability to succeed in a matrixed environment and influence adoption of new thinking is required. Experience leading multiple high profile projects with demanding deadlines, changing requirements, and working with limited resources is required. Ability to estimate required effort for project objectives and prioritize work items appropriately is required. Able to demonstrate a pattern of success in using advanced quantitative analytic methods to solve business problems to drive business results is required.BE VITAL in your Career; be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.J2W:LI NAJ2W:DICEPrimary Location:North America-United States-New Jersey-SkillmanOther Locations:North America-United States-New Jersey-New BrunswickOrganization: Johnson & Johnson Consumer Inc. (6071)Job Function: Market ResearchCertain sites within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies participate in E-Verify as appropriate in accordance with Company guidelines and federal or state law. To learn more about the government sponsored program and to see a list of the sites that are currently enrolled, please click here.Johnson and Johnson Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO is the Law EEO is the Law GINA Supplement Apply on Career Site

job.title: Sr Actuarial Associate (Pension Risk Transfer Pricing)
Maintenance & Repair Supervisor
job.description: Position Responsibilities, not limited to: Supervise M&R Vendors Perform pre- and post-repair inspections in field, authorize repairs. Perform timely audits per month or as needed; evaluate and control quality of repair vendors work. Use hand held technology as required by TRAC. Make decisions on behalf of Trac Lease, pursuing the lowest total-cost options; assessing whether or not repairs are necessary and appropriate repairs are prescribed. Determine if repairs are due to damage vs. wear-and-tear items; ensure vendor accountability upon instances of damage missed on gate inspection or caused by yard handling; communicate with vendor/facility ensuring accurate gate inspection notations and yard handling procedures. Make certain AAR rules are being employed and followed at rail facilities. Require and inspect accurate repairs prescribed and performed upon instances of missed or yard damage. Compliance to all safety standards is absolutely required. Review take off tire inventories, ensure accuracy of vendor marking and coding, track tire usage, inspect tires for cause of failure, identify and submit failures for pursuance of warranty credit. Invoice Processing Functions Review vendor repair invoices for accuracy; ensure all invoices are submitted and received parallel to terms in M&R Vendor Agreement; re-send to vendor for revision when inaccuracies are found and communicate with vendor steps needed to take for correction; decline when situation is warranted and is justifiable; approve accurate invoices for payment; assist with vendors inquiries regarding outstanding invoices. Manage 3rd party billing process to assist the Vendor Compliance group. Review field estimates and EDI invoices to identify repairs due to abusive handling by trucker; compile work order, TIR, and tire material sheet when needed to begin 3rd party process; communicate with Vendor Compliance group when 3rd party invoice disputes occur. Provide expert opinion to resolve disputes between truckers and receiving facility regarding inbound TIR notations. Timely review and accurately code manual invoices Support M&R Management program Periodically assemble statistics for management, including but not exclusive to audits performed, expenses related to a particular vendor or repair category, operational efficiencies, perform physical inventory reconciliations and report findings, etc. Logistics Support Perform daily count of available and damaged chassis by chassis size as needed. Review rail terminal operator information to determine grounded or mismatched member line containers and outbound equipment forecasts and delays Complete chassis reconciliation between marine, rail, and CY locations and Seacastle / Trac Lease system. Assist with road calls when received as follows: Follow Seacastles OTR procedures that are in place, identify if problem is related to W&T or damage, locate mobile repair vendor, and recommend most cost efficient and safe method of repair. Depot Support Understand each phase of the chassis progression for term lease terminations COHNA, AU, Approved for repair, AV and each function related to each status. Be able to technically discuss and prescribe correct repairs according to IICL standards. Perform joint and independent COHNA surveys maximize revenue of customer approvals from lease terminations; review, identify, inspect, revise and prescribe correct repairs of chassis to be repaired or scrapped; recognize and apply warranties and assign modifications where needed; coordinate bookings, surveyor inspections, and customer acceptance; QC / post inspect chassis booked for lease. Requirements: Must have a valid drivers license, pass a background check, meet Rail Terminal facility security requirements, and have or be able to obtain a TWIC card. Must be able to perform walk-around inspection of chassis, as well as using a crawler to check brakes and axles. Must be able to lift and move truck tires. Must be able to multi-task, and work independently as well as contribute to the overall success of the team. Must have a command of MS-Office package, Outlook, Word, and Excel. Must be able to receive and communicate repair instructions verbally and in writing in a professional manner Understand and comply with all safety precautions. Have M&R experience and operational knowledge of rail, marine and port, CY, and depot facilities. Candidate must be free of potential conflicts of interest IICL Chassis certification / wheel end / brake / tire / electrical training a plus. Ability to travel a plus. Bi-lingual (English and Spanish) a plus.

job.title: Trade Support - Rates
job.description:
. PURPOSE: To assist trading desk in all functions of fixed income trading, specifically mortgage generic/structured products and US treasuries
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES Responsible for intraday timely trade confirm Responsible for timely resolution of all breaks between front office systems and back office systems. Act as a liaison between FO and BO on any trade related and settlements issue. Liaise with the repo desk as/when required for funding issues Track and report daily trace activity from FO when needed Back up the TBA-Margin group as and when required Assist CMO desk with new issues and REMIC deals Create and maintain analytical reports for trading desk Participate in Winfits/Webfits/ICI and other system testing Assist with US Treasury Auctions and Buyback operations Assist Controllers with PnL discrepancies Monitor MBSCC and GSCC real-time Resolve inter-company breaks
Requirements: Minimum 3 years of trade support or equivalent operations experience Solid understanding of Mortgage Backed Securities and US Treasuries Familiar with UST Auction and Buyback process (TAAPS, FedTrade) Series 7, 63, 99 preferred JOB SPECIFICATION Knowledge of fixed income settlements including FED, DTCC, NSCC Strong experience with ICI, Bloomberg, Winfits, Webfits Team player with strong problem solving and communication skills Able to work in fast paced trading floor environment Excellent Excel Skills Detail oriented *L1-AT1

We are pleased to consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veterans status or any other legally-protected factors.

job.title: COOK, PREP
job.description:
We have an opening for a full-time COOK, PREP position. Location: 2500 Kennedy Blvd., Union City, NJ 07087. Note: online applications accepted only. Schedule: Monday - Friday 7:00 AM - 3:30 PM. Requirement: Cook experience preferred.
If you have a positive attitude and a love for learning, you may be interested in joining our team.
Want to influence a generation? How about working in a place where you know you make a difference. Try one of our 4000 public and private school locations managed by Chartwells School Dining Services. That’s about 2.6 million young students we provide meals and food service for each day. Eat. Learn. Live exemplifies Chartwells’ promise and philosophy that nourishing students is not only our business; it’s our commitment to the communities in which we serve.
Full time associates at Chartwells K-12 are offered many fantastic benefits such as: Medical Dental Vision Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs) Commuter Benefits Wellness Program Employee Assistance Program Life Insurance for Associates and Eligible Dependents Short Term Disability (STD) and Long Term Disability (LTD) Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance Discount Marketplace And other voluntary benefits
Summary: Prepares food and serves customers in accordance with applicable federal, state and local standards, guidelines and regulations.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Obtains daily production schedule and preparation requirements from the Chef. Prepares items on production sheets following established quantities and recipes. Completes and follows daily production worksheets and waste log sheets. Tastes completed meals to ensure quality. Operates and cleans equipment per department procedures after each use. Stores, labels and dates all food items according to policy. Follows HACCP guidelines. Completes all required documentation, reports, logs as required. Complies with federal, state and local health and sanitation regulations and department sanitation procedures. Takes orders from customer and prepare items requiring short preparation time. Serves customers in an efficient and friendly manner. Completes orders from steam tables and grill and serves customers at multiple stations. Uses approved food recipes and production standards to ensure proper quality, serving temperatures and standard portion control. Operates and cleans equipment per department procedures after each use. Stores, labels and dates all food items according to policy. Follows HACCP guidelines to ensure quality and safety of food supply. Resolves customer concerns. Performs other duties as assigned.
About Compass Group: Achieving leadership in the foodservice industry Compass Group North America is a diversity growth-oriented organization. Our goal is to improve the quality of work life by using fair and consistent treatment and providing equal growth opportunities for ALL associates. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers applicants without regard to race, sex, religion, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Qualified candidates must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. Disclaimer: this job post is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all essential responsibilities, skills, tasks, or requirements associated with this position. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, the Company reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity. Req ID: 13042 Apply on Career Site

job.title: Sprint Retail Sales
job.description: Req# 171041BR Position Title Sprint Retail Sales Position Summary A Sprint Retail Sales opportunity connects you to a job that matters. Your work adds value by the joy of connecting people to the things that matter most to them.As a Sprint Retail Consultant, you are a mobility expert who is responsible for connecting customers to the things that matter most in their lives. You are strengthening Sprint's Brand by delivering an unparalleled customer experience and outcome that transcends beyond the store visit. You stay current with the latest technologies and industry trends that enable you to provide a total sales solution to the customer. You are responsible for delivering key performance results in sales and customer satisfaction that are most important to Sprint's overall strategy and growth. You are driven to achieve by the happiness of each customer's experience, the success of your store team and the satisfaction that you are changing lives by connecting people to what they enjoy.Absent a reasonable accommodation or military obligation, employees must be available to work a retail schedule that includes evenings, weekends, and holidays.A Sprint Retail Consultant Provides a total sales solution to the customer regarding their wireless/mobility needs that includes: selling the value for Sprint's devices, accessories and service plans, maximizing customer connections, saving the customer money, personalizing the customer experience, protecting their investment Delivers an outstanding store experience that improves customer loyalty and strengthens the Sprint Brand Meets or exceed key performance objectives that include sales and customer satisfaction goals Makes certain accurate customer account set-up so they are ready to use when leaving the store Identifies the right solutions to customer billing, technical and or account issues Completes all courses in your curriculum path with the required times frames Complies with all operational policies and procedures including the Sprint Code of Conduct Basic Qualifications High School diploma or equivalent Six months retail sales or related experience Be the ConnectionThe Retail Sales team is the heart and soul of Sprint, connecting people with what matters every day. job.title: COOK, PREP
job.description:
We have an opening for a full-time COOK, PREP position. Location: 2500 Kennedy Blvd., Union City, NJ 07087. Note: online applications accepted only. Schedule: Monday - Friday 7:00 AM - 3:30 PM. Requirement: Cook experience preferred.
If you have a positive attitude and a love for learning, you may be interested in joining our team.
Want to influence a generation? How about working in a place where you know you make a difference. Try one of our 4000 public and private school locations managed by Chartwells School Dining Services. That’s about 2.6 million young students we provide meals and food service for each day. Eat. Learn. Live exemplifies Chartwells’ promise and philosophy that nourishing students is not only our business; it’s our commitment to the communities in which we serve.
Full time associates at Chartwells K-12 are offered many fantastic benefits such as: Medical Dental Vision Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs) Commuter Benefits Wellness Program Employee Assistance Program Life Insurance for Associates and Eligible Dependents Short Term Disability (STD) and Long Term Disability (LTD) Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance Discount Marketplace And other voluntary benefits
Summary: Prepares food and serves customers in accordance with applicable federal, state and local standards, guidelines and regulations.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Obtains daily production schedule and preparation requirements from the Chef. Prepares items on production sheets following established quantities and recipes. Completes and follows daily production worksheets and waste log sheets. Tastes completed meals to ensure quality. Operates and cleans equipment per department procedures after each use. Stores, labels and dates all food items according to policy. Follows HACCP guidelines. Completes all required documentation, reports, logs as required. Complies with federal, state and local health and sanitation regulations and department sanitation procedures. Takes orders from customer and prepare items requiring short preparation time. Serves customers in an efficient and friendly manner. Completes orders from steam tables and grill and serves customers at multiple stations. Uses approved food recipes and production standards to ensure proper quality, serving temperatures and standard portion control. Operates and cleans equipment per department procedures after each use. Stores, labels and dates all food items according to policy. Follows HACCP guidelines to ensure quality and safety of food supply. Resolves customer concerns. Performs other duties as assigned.
About Compass Group: Achieving leadership in the foodservice industry Compass Group North America is a diversity growth-oriented organization. Our goal is to improve the quality of work life by using fair and consistent treatment and providing equal growth opportunities for ALL associates. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers applicants without regard to race, sex, religion, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Qualified candidates must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. Disclaimer: this job post is not necessarily an exhaustive list of all essential responsibilities, skills, tasks, or requirements associated with this position. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, the Company reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity. Req ID: 13042 Apply on Career Site

job.title: Manager Operations Statistics (Sales), Home Solar
job.description: Returning Candidate?Log back in!Manager Operations Statistics (Sales), Home SolarReq ID: 2015-14767Location Name: NRG Home SolarCategory: Accounting/FinanceState/City: US-NJ-WallType: Full-Time Salary# Openings: 1Details About this Career Opportunity:Overview:NRG is leading a customer-driven change in the U.S. energy industry by delivering cleaner and smarter energy choices, while building on the strength of the nation’s largest and most diverse competitive power portfolio. A Fortune 250 company, we create value through reliable and efficient conventional generation while driving innovation in solar and renewable power, electric vehicle ecosystems, carbon capture technology and customer-centric energy solutions. Our retail electricity providers serve almost 3 million residential and commercial customers throughout the country. More information is available at www.nrgenergy.com. Connect with NRG Energy on Facebook and follow us on Twitter @nrgenergyResponsibilities:Purpose: Primary contact for the Customer Acquisition organization ensuring that monthly forecasts have the latest sales projections and pricing assumptionsResponsibilities:The Manager Operational Stats (Sales), Home Solar will work closely with the Customer Acquisition organization including both Sales and Marketing. The position will closely monitor sales activity by channel, state and marketing campaign and will be positioned to discuss the success of the sales organization or recommend corrective measures if needed. In addition, this position will work closely with the marketing organization, including the parent company marketing group, to ensure accurate marketing budgets/forecasts as well as to understand advertising campaigns at the state level.Specific duties will include:Track competitive and market retail electricity rates: Understanding current competitive and market prices is a critical step in ensuring that Home Solar is best positioned to capture increasing market share. This includes:­ Tracking competitive residential solar offerings on a state by state level- Maintain a detailed analysis of competitive offerings including both lease offerings and loan products­ Tracking retail residential rates and understanding grid parity projection for those states not yet at grid parity- Recommend new target states that Home Solar should be looking to penetrateMaintain Volume and Pricing forecast: Working with the multiple sales channels this position will update the sales forecast at a detailed level. This includes:­ Monthly, identify the specific build of the overall sales projections while also understanding the historical sales and how the forecast may change as a result­ Work closely with the pricing team to understand and update pricing assumptions as needed to ensure forecasts are consistent with both approved and actual contracted rates- On a monthly basis compare actual contract rates to forecasted rates and provide variance explanationsAd Hoc analysis requests: Will serve as the point person for any and all requests for analysis related to customer acquisition, pricing and market penetration. This may include­ Pricing analysis:- Current and potential market penetration rates based on pricing scenarios- Impact pricing changes may have on return requirements­ Sales & Marketing analysis:- Analyze and provide summaries of the effectiveness of different sales channels- Provide regular summaries of the effectiveness of marketing campaigns- Run analysis on the impact of new sales campaigns may have on customer acquisition costs and the overall profitability of the company­ Cross Selling analysis, NRG offers many products and services and as such tracking the cross selling of these services to track the overall profitability of a system sale is an important measureQualifications:- Minimum five years of finance or financial analysis, budgeting, planning and internal and external financial reporting experience is required- Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or Accounting is required- Understanding of solar in general and residential solar, project finance, tax equity structures, solar incentive structures, programs, rebates, tax credits in addition to their impact on accounting issues if any would be highly valued- Salesforce.com experience highly desirable- Advanced or Expert knowledge and working experience with MS Excel required- Strong analytical and organization skills- Be able to work in a fast paced work environment, manage multiple tasks concurrently- Superior PowerPoint skills- Strong MS Word and database tools- Experience with Hyperion is preferredNRG Energy is committed to a drug and alcohol free workplace. To the extent permitted by law and any applicable collective bargaining agreement, employees are subject to periodic random drug testing, and post-accident and reasonable suspicion drug and alcohol testing.EOE AA M/F/Protected Veteran Status/DisabilityLevel, Title and/or Salary may be adjusted based on the applicant’s experience or skills.Official description on file with Human ResourcesInterested in this opportunity?- Apply online now!Apply for this job onlineRefer a friend to this jobGo back to the welcome pageApplication FAQsSoftware Powered by iCIMSwww.icims.com Apply on Career Site

job.title: Associate Store Manager
job.description: Requisition Number: WS-6104Area of Interest: RetailDivision: Retail Williams-SonomaPosition Type: Full TimeJOB DESCRIPTIONJob Purpose: In partnership with the General Manager, promote a sales culture to build productivity. Develop associates for future growth through hiring and developing great people. Provide leadership to achieve or exceed budgeted sales, payroll and controllable expense goals. Effectively manage store operations, maintain appropriate inventory levels and visual merchandising standards. Ensure all internal and external customers receive exemplary customer service and receive a positive store/brand experience. Ensure sales associates build relationships with customers.Responsibilities include but are not limited to:* In partnership with the General Manger, ensure store meets or exceeds sales and contest goals. Meet payroll goals based on current trends.* Prioritize, plan and adjust schedules and daily agendas to meet business goals. Hold team accountable to achieving goals.* In partnership with the General Manager, recruit, interview, and select qualified candidates to build a talent pipeline to achieve current and future business goals.* Train and motivate all associates through on-going programs in sales, customer service and product knowledge.* Develop associates to assume increased levels of responsibility.* Assess performance and provide on-going feedback; Complete and deliver performance appraisals and development plans.* Ensure team provides an exceptional customer experience in the store to achieve World Class Service standards.* Maintain presence through effective floor management and ensure staff coverage in all areas of the store.* Maintain a safe work environment and ensure ongoing safety training and awareness.* In partnership with the General Manager, manage store-operating procedures i.e., inventory levels and cash control to minimize store losses.* Responsible for ensuring the store meets company guidelines in opening and closing.* In partnership with the General Manager, monitor company assets through accurate inventory procedures.* Ensure store standards are met and maintained, i.e., visuals, cleanliness, signage, safety, etc.* Exemplify and ensure associates comply with all Company policies and procedures.* Create and maintain an environment where all associates are treated fairly and with dignity and respect, in accordance with our People First Philosophy.* Monitor assets through accurate inventory management procedures.REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS* 2-3 years management experience. Specialty retail preferred.* Ability to manage staff to meet and exceed sales and payroll goals.* Ability to identify top talent and train/develop/retain great people.* Ability to think through complex issues and allocate time to execute multiple tasks and changing priorities.* Effective communication, organization and leadership skills.* Ability to motivate and influence others through actions and examples.* Ability to achieve results both independently and through others by fostering a spirit of teamwork and cooperation.* Ability to be mobile on the sales floor for extended periods of time.* Availability to work closing shift a minimum of three times per week, minimum of three Saturdays per month and two Sundays per month, annual inventory and entire holiday season (November and December).* Ability to lift and mobilize medium to large items, up to 75 lb., while utilizing appropriate equipment and safety techniques.Founded in 1956, Williams-Sonoma, Inc. is the premier specialty retailer of home furnishings in the United States, Canada and Australia. Our brands are among the best known and most respected in the industry. We successfully market them through all three major channels - retail stores, catalogs, and the Internet.Williams-Sonoma Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.This position is not eligible for visa sponsorship or relocation. Apply on Career Site

job.title: Marketing & Sales Associate
job.description:
​Marketing & Sales Associate: This position will require the ideal candidate to have great people-, time management- and communication skills. They will need to be hard workers and great team players. The Marketing Associate will work hand in hand with Database Manager, Marketing/PR Coordinator as well as the SVP of Marketing. Strong verbal and written communication skills, the ability to provide good customer service, and attention to detail are essential.
Daily responsibilities will include: Monitor inbound client emails Manage and input inbound internet responses Execute all in-house mail fulfillment Work with 3rd party service providers Data Entry Collaborate with Financial Advisors to prepare marketing packets Deliver great customer service Team with Database Manager to ensure database accuracy Update and review database Communicate with operations Assist in creating materials used for proposals, correspondence, reports, and presentations Support marketing day-to-day operations including media campaigns and promotions Arrange and coordinate special events and projects Manage and help prepare large mailings
Desired Skills and Experience Required General Skills: Bachelors Degree Minimum 2 years relevant work experience Excellent time management skills Outstanding interpersonal skills Hard-working mentality Be a true team player
Desired Working Knowledge: Image editing MS Office (Outlook/Excel/Access/Word/Powerpoint) ExactTarget Microsoft Dynamics CRM Adobe Photoshop/InDesign Hennion & Walsh is an advocate for the individual investor. We believe in putting the client first. At Hennion & Walsh, we know the individual investors want a personal relationship with their advisor, and we believe in guiding our clients to achieve their financial goals and dreams through conservative income and growth strategies. We have locations in Parsippany, NJ and Delray Beach, FL,employ over 150 professionals assisting more than 15,000 accounts with their more than $2 billion in assets.​​

job.title: Manager, Operational Risk Management -Cross Functional Risk Management Core Team
IT Lead– SAP Portal / Mobility
job.description: IT Lead– SAP Portal / Mobility-1597150327DescriptionJohnson & Johnson is actively recruiting for an IT Lead– SAP Portal/Mobility. This position will be part of a global organization in charge of deploying and supporting SAP Portal & Mobile solutions globally. This position may be based in Bridgewater NJ or Piscataway NJ. Business travel (domestic and International) is required for about 30% of the time.Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.With $71.3 billion in 2013 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices and diagnostics markets. The more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employ approximately 127,000 people in 60 countries throughout the world.With $71.3 billion in 2013 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices and diagnostics markets. The more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employ approximately 127,000 people in 60 countries throughout the world.Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.Within the global organization, this position has responsibilities for the implementation of SAP Portal for a number of SAP project initiatives globally. The position is also the key interface with functional IT Application Services process teams across several platforms, which is intended to help drive the collection of business requirements and translate that into portal/mobility solutions. This position is also a key interface across IT Quality and Compliance (Q&C) groups, Basis and engineering within IT shared services organization. In addition, the position is also respond to incidents reported by end users by providing root cause analysis, recommended repairs and estimates for the work. Implement system changes that are approved by the change control group. Coordinate repairs with offshore or secondary support team. Support the basis team on any portal build or post build activity. Document repairs according to the platform-specific change control guidelines. Document all portal configuration and common issues / solutions. Convert Functional Requirements into technical designs documents for onshore or offshore development. Provide recommendation and coordinate portal upgrades including support and testing activitiesThe individual must maintain superior knowledge in all areas of SAP Portal, Mobile application development, Portal Security, etc. This individual must drive and deliver solutions to the business, while pursuing to optimize existing services, promote resource utilization and leverage of enterprise SAP architecture, methodology, and tools.RESPONSIBILITIES/PRINCIPAL DUTIES (Essential Functions): Responsible for ensuring good quality and compliance of all solutions deployed for the SAP platform, as it pertains to assuring delivery to defined standards within the security and authorizations space. Provide subject matter expertise in areas of strategy and design for SAP Portal with specialization in one or more functional business process areas across the entire project initiative or business roll out. Coach, oversee and ensure quality of deliverables of on-shore and off-shore contractors.Individual will be responsible for all aspects of Portal design, development and association with portal applications (SAPUI5, JAVA Webdynpro, J2EE, Portal applications) and all aspects of portal monitoring, fine tuning.Accountable for all metrics as it pertains to SAP Portal (Projects & Base business support). Accountable for L2 escalations for the SAP platforms. Responsible for creating an environment where knowledge and ideas are shared among team members and other J&J organizations. Ensure that security is considered and emphasized in all IM designs and development.QualificationsA minimum of a Bachelor’s degree is required and a Masters degree is preferred. SAP portal certification is preferred. A minimum of 7 years of IT experience is required. A minimum of 5 years of experience with SAP Portal is required. Hands-on experience of portals role build, portal application development, mobile application development (SAPUI5, Fiori, JQuery Mobile), trouble shooting, remediation analysis and technical support and being able to provide technical coaching and guidance to others are required. Experience providing work effort estimates as well as conducting project planning activities for new potential projects involving portal deliverables is required. Experience leading multiple projects or rollouts simultaneously is required.Strong analytical skills to proactively recommend system improvements are required. Excellent communication skills both verbally and written is required. Proven ability to influence/collaborate to get results is required. Good interpersonal and negotiating skills are preferred. Must be a change agent with a high tolerance for ambiguity is required. Awareness of GxP and SOX regulatory frameworks is strongly preferred. Proven ability to assess functional requirements and translating into technical solutions is required.Additionally, extensive experience in creating Abstract Portal Component & Dynpage Component is required. Strong knowledge in creating servlets in portal for custom solutions is required. At least 2 full Implementation done in SAP Enterprise Portal 7.3X is required. At least 2 full application development knowledge using SAPUI5, REST, OData, JSON , Netwever Gateway is required. Expertise in Enterprise Portals Design, Development, Configuration, Testing, Troubleshooting, Administration and Performance tuning is required. Extensive experience with Java web toolkits and frameworks such as MVC are required. Solid web development skills with HTML/HTML5, CSS3,css-mixins , JQuery, SAPUI5 (Strong), jade-lang preprocessing, JSP, etc. are required. Expert level knowledge in JavaScript, JSON, and AJAX, XML Processing and a deep knowledge of JavaScript frameworks such as JQuery & NodeJS are required. Expert level knowledge in OData, REST & SOAP Webservices are required.Expert level knowledge in building mobile applications using HTML5, QUERY Mobile, CSS3, Responsive Web design and related mobile technologies are required. PhoneGAP experience is preferred. Experience in building custom applications using UWL, UME, PCD, UCD API’s is required. Experience in integrating portal with SAP back end systems (ECC, APO, BW, CRM, MDG, GTS, SOLMAN, GRC FSCM, BOBJ etc..) are required. Experience of delivering mobile applications leveraging SAPUI5 and FIORI are required. Knowledge in using SAP mobile application platform technologies, including Sybase Unwired Platform (SUP), SAP Mobile Platform (SMP), Hybrid Web Container are preferred. Solid knowledge in browsers (Chrome, Webkit based) and mobile devices (IOS, Andorid, Blackberry) are required. Experience in Mobile Application browser testing using automated tools such as Selenium etc. is preferred. Experience in using Adobe Photoshop and other graphic design tools to create the necessary app icons etc. is preferred. Experience in using MAMP Code kit, Grunt, NWDS and NWDI is required. Experience in ABAP is preferred. Previous experience leading people is required. The ability to work independently with no or minimal supervision demonstrating sound judgment and prudent risk-taking is required. Big picture orientation with attention to details is required. The ability to work in two worlds simultaneously – team growth and cost control is required.BE VITAL in your Career; be seen for the talent you bring to your work. job.description: Country: United States Job Function: Retail (Store)State / Province: New Jersey Position Type: Part timeCity / Location: Atlantic City Brand: ReebokRelocation: No SelectionReebok is the original fitness brand. Fitness is who we are.We pioneered a fitness movement and we are still pioneering today. Every day we are creating products for those who love fitness as much as we do; products that allow you to get every ounce out of your work-out, run, walk, yoga, step or dance class.We believe fitness is a way of life… that as humans we were made to move. Movement not only makes your body stronger, it makes you the best possible you…body, mind and spirit.At Reebok, our employees embrace this mission and are encouraged to reach for their fitness goals – as well as their career and personal goals. It’s part of the fabric of who we are and what we stand for.Purpose:Contributes to store profitability by ensuring KPIs for a defined area within the store are met or exceeded. The core expectations include coordinating team members to provide the best possible balance of service and operations, resulting in a leading shopping experience.Key Accountabilities:• Allocates resources and organizes processes within assigned area of responsibility to drive efficiency and productivity in a variety of situations.• Create an appealing, easy-to-shop environment for customers by coordinating his/her team to consistently execute visual merchandising and housekeeping standards in assigned area of responsibility.• Ensures the product offer available to customers is maximized in assigned area of responsibility by coordinating product replenishment from the stockroom to the sales floor.• Supervises sales transactions to ensure quick and accurate processing while adhering to cash protection procedures.• Minimizes loss by implementing, monitoring and tracking all loss prevention activities.• Maintains a safe shopping and working environment by ensuring company policy and procedures are adhered to within assigned area of responsibility.• Applies knowledge of Retail KPIs to make commercial decisions that drive achievement of established sales targets.• Tracks performance data for assigned area (e.g. best sellers, space allocation, etc.) and makes necessary adjustments to drive productivity and efficiency.• Coaches, motivates and inspires individuals within area of responsibility to maximize and drive a performance culture.• Is a role model for customer service and boosts sales and Brand experience by using advanced sales techniques and appropriate elements of the adidas customer service model.• Guides and trains team members on basic core and seasonal product knowledge.• Uses advanced category expertise and enthusiasm for the Brand to drive sales and customer loyalty.• Understand customer expectations and coaches team to meet or exceed them at all times.• Actively supervises and coordinates team to ensure all customers receive the highest level of service.• Actively collaborates and shares best practices to drive store team performance.• Supports the recruitment, onboarding, training and development of the store team.• Communicates a desire to learn and seizes all available opportunities to drive own development and increase performance.Knowledge, Capabilities and Experience:• Must possess and consistently exhibit the competencies relative to the position.• Skilled in operating personal computers, POS systems, and various software packages including MS office.• Ability to learn and adapt quickly in a fast paced environment.• Strong interpersonal and communication skills including the ability to lead discussions in diverse groups of varying size.• Ability to operate independently and with discretion, and work effectively under pressure.• Demonstrates an inspirational attitude that contributes to a positive team environment.• Ability to build and maintain effective working relationships with team members along with willingness to set and maintain high standards of performance.• Well developed ability to speak, read, comprehend, and write English• Ability to maintain reliable and consistent attendance and punctuality.• While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally exposed to outside weather conditions. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.Physical Requirements:• While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, crawl, and operate a Brannock device.• The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.• Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, and ability to adjust focus.• Must be 18 years or older.Qualifications:• High school diploma or general education degree (GED)• Minimum 12 months experience working in a sports/fashion customer & commercial focused retail environment.• Advanced selling experience and comprehensive product, retail and industry understanding as well as supervisory experience.Posting Notes: Atlantic City || New Jersey || United States || 08401 || Reebok || Americas || No Selection Apply on Career Site

job.description: Req ID: 43382Founded in 1856, Burberry today remains quintessentially British, with outerwear at its core. Digital luxury positioning and intensive focus on design innovation, quality and heritage icons ensure continued brand purity and relevance globally across genders and generations. Burberry believes that in order to be a great brand it must also be a great company and constantly leverages the energy of its compassionate and creative thinking culture to continually innovate and drive the brand forward. Headquartered in London, Burberry is a design, marketing and retail led business with a global reputation for innovative product design, digital marketing initiatives and dynamic retail strategies. The Operations Supervisor role is to oversee all aspects of building operations in order to maintain a clean, efficient and cost-effective store. Problem-solve to identify needs and manage support team and systems to provide sales staff and management with back of house support and tools needed. RESPONSIBILITIES Ensure fully functioning registers and enforce back of house standards for cash and media maintenance and accuracy Oversee all construction and overnight maintenance. Supervisor performance of contractors and ensure quality meets our standards Consistently look for ways to cut costs while improving the work environment of staff Develop shipping/receiving department to ensure goods are received and placed on floor quickly and accurately Serve as a senior manager in the store overseeing and aspects of store management Control all inventory movement, to minimize shrinkage, and to ensure the safeguarding of all company assets Responsible for all aspects of bi-annual store inventory Responsible for accountability of store keys Assist with opening and closing store on daily basis Assist in securing doors, windows, merchandise and successful alarming of store Maintain presence on selling floor to ensure sales associates are supported as needed Partner with Visual Management to ensure visual needs are met while complying with fire safety laws and space needs. Possess a thorough understanding of company policies and procedures & consistently follow and enforce company guidelines on operations Serve as contact person with regard to all operations policies as stated in the Burberry Operations Manual PERSONAL PROFILE: Must possess superb interpersonal skills in order to effectively communicate with staff, management and employees in the store. Must be able to effectively organize staff to ensure back of house functions as a strong team supporting the sales process. Excellent interpersonal skills required to ensure clear communication with all management and staff. Consistently show a positive attitude & take responsibility for own actions Advanced knowledge of POS System and basic computer skills (MS Word, Excel, Outlook) Burberry is an Equal Opportunities Employer and as such, treats all applications equally and recruits purely on the basis of skills and experience. job.title: Director, Quality Systems Excellence & Innovation
job.description: Director, Quality Systems Excellence & Innovation-9667150306DescriptionJohnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Director, Quality Systems Excellence & Innovation located in any NJ or PA J&J location.Caring for the world, one person at a time, has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science, bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.With $71.3 billion in 2013 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices and diagnostics markets. The more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employ approximately 127,000 people in 60 countries throughout the world.The Director, Quality Systems Excellence & Innovation reports to Sr. Director, Q&C Strategy, Insights & Innovation. They will lead the Quality Systems strategic programs to apply appropriate process excellence tools and techniques to assure the resulting global processes are benchmarked with an external view and are as lean and efficient as possible, while meeting all regulatory requirements for that Quality System area.They will partner with Global Process Development leaders on all strategic programs to ensure the resulting processes can be measured according to the Q&C metric and scorecard requirements. They will lead the design and development of J&J’s websites/technology that will be used to meet the requirements of the Q&C scorecard and will partner with the Director, Q&C Insights & Analytics and SC, R&D and Medical Affairs and Business Quality to deliver the appropriate integrated analytic technologies to drive proactive quality through strategic insights and analytics.They will partner with IT, SC and Sourcing to explore new technology opportunities that will further innovate our Quality Systems driving to a “One Quality System” for our business partners. They will partner with Sourcing to establish common practices for managing and monitoring all strategic software vendors, vendors of new mobility, cloud technologies and suppliers of services used for our Strategic Programs and Shared Services. They will ensure all strategic partners have a Service Level Agreement in place to include Quality and Compliance requirements. They will partner with the vendor to ensure all remediation activities as a result of audits and inspections are addressed in a timely manner and identify impacts to any projects underway. Partner with IT and Quality GSDO and Innovations Centers to investigate, design and deliver enabling technologies: cloud, mobility, enhanced user interface across all QS technologies. In partnership with IT, they will establish data analytics and knowledge management capabilities and integrate those requirements into the JJSC and QS roadmaps to enable innovation in the Design Centers & GSDO.They will partner with IT to expedite design & deployment process (agile development) through enhanced SDLC, CSV, VOC and Requirements capabilities. They will provide advanced expertise for strategic programs in various areas: Value Proposition, Transactional Lean, DMADVV, Six Sigma. They work closely with various internal and external customers and key stakeholders, and will interface with senior management on a daily basis. For example: JJ Q&C LT; Segment / Op Co Quality; Segment Quality Strategy leads, IT, LOCs, Global Medical Safety; Enterprise and Segment Plan, Source, Make, Deliver; Enterprise SC process and segment leads; multiple outsourcing partners; etcRequirements:They will lead the Quality Systems strategic programs to apply appropriate process excellence (i.e. transactional lean, DMADVV, etc) tools and techniques to assure the resulting global processes are benchmarked with an external view and are as lean and efficient as possible, while meeting all regulatory requirements for that Quality System area. They will partner with Global Process Development leaders on all strategic programs to ensure the resulting processes can be measured according to the Q&C metric and scorecard requirements. They will lead the design and development of J&J’s websites/technology that will be used to meet the requirements of the Q&C scorecard and will partner with the Director, Q&C Insights & Analytics and SC, R&D and Medical Affairs and Business Quality to deliver the appropriate integrated analytic technologies to drive proactive quality through strategic insights and analytics.They will lead the design and development of J&J websites and technologies to support Q&C Shared Services, OCM and PPM to ensure technology savvy needs are delivered for our business partners (i.e Source) if not delivered through our Strategic Platform initiatives. They will partner with IT, SC and Sourcing to explore new technology opportunities that will further innovate our Quality Systems driving to a “One Quality System” for our business partners. They will research innovation trends and bring analysis back to our internal customer and strategic program teams to ensure we are evaluating all strategic and innovative opportunities in our sizeable investments.They will partner with IT and key business partners to investigate, design and deliver enabling technologies: cloud, mobility, enhanced user interface across all QS technologies. In partnership with IT, they will establish data analytics and knowledge management capabilities and integrate those requirements into the JJSC and QS roadmaps to enable innovation in the Design Centers & GSDO.They will partner with IT to expedite design & deployment process (agile development) through enhanced SDLC, CSV, VOC and Requirements capabilities. They will provide advanced expertise for strategic programs in various areas: Value Proposition, Transactional Lean, DMADVV, Six Sigma, etc. Partner with IT to manage and monitor all strategic software vendors, vendors of new technologies (i.e. mobility, cloud) and suppliers of services used for our Strategic Programs and Shared Services. They will ensure all strategic partners have a Service Level Agreement in place to include Quality and Compliance requirements. They will partner with the vendor to ensure all remediation activities as a result of audits and inspections are addressed in a timely manner and identify impacts to any projects underway. They will partner with vendor to assure they are inspection ready and available. Partner with IT to evaluate external environment to design and deliver enabling technologies: cloud, mobility, enhanced user interface across all QS technologies. In partnership with IT, they will establish data analytics and knowledge management capabilities and integrate those requirements into the JJSC and QS roadmaps to enable innovation in the Design Centers & GSDO.They will partner with IT to expedite design & deployment process (agile development) through enhanced SDLC, CSV, VOC and Requirements capabilities. They will provide advanced expertise for strategic programs in various areas: Value Proposition, Transactional Lean, DMADVV, Six Sigma. Establish data analytics and knowledge management capabilities to enable Patient-Centered Design and Knowledge Sharing. Provide Quality oversight to GSCO and Innovation Centers. Determine content of knowledge management system and linkages to existing quality systems (tru, CAPA, Field Actions, etc). Partner with SC, R&D, Design Engineers, Design quality, Medical safety, and clinical design to design knowledge sharing approach and support systems & technology. Define processes for audience outreach and repository usage (email alerts, community moderation, scanning for news and lessons to publish, submission process for lessons). Partner with Medical Safety to evaluate internal and external data sources to drive product improvements & innovationQualificationsQualifications:A Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree is required. An advanced degree with a focus in Science, Business, Engineering, or Organization Management is preferred. A minimum of 10 years of business experience in a regulated environment is required. A minimum 6 years in managing many aspects of Quality Management Systems in an international, global context, in a regulated healthcare environment and in partnership with Information Technology is required. Specific, significant experience in Quality Systems processes and platforms, and functional knowledge of / experience in Quality and Compliance is required.Previous experience at a management level with demonstrated track record of successful results is required. Cross Sector experience is preferred. Specific experience in designing and developing strategic technology solutions that address customer requirements now and in the future is preferred. Experience in influencing or at minimum, partnering with regulatory authorities to introduce advanced technology solutions in a healthcare environment, while adhering to the prevailing regulations or influencing their evolution in a health care industry is preferred.Experience developing a high performing team with the ability to lead, even in a matrixed environment is required. Creating a direct and indirect organization with a culture of global customer focus and the ability to deliver. Ability to shape, creating a future vision and gaining support and alignment to that vision. Attracting and developing superior talent. Building interdependent partnerships, and internal and external relationships, acting as the mediator between organizations while optimizing the value proposition. Analytical skills and experience leading risk-based oversight programs. Organizational change management experience. Project management experience. Executive presentation skills. Collaborative approach and ability to connect. Ability to managing complexity and ambiguity. Bifocal approach - ability to zoom-in/zoom-out for strategic and tactical, high-level and detailed, etc. Ability to lead in the context of Our Credo.Primary Location:North America-United States-New Jersey-New BrunswickOther Locations:North America-United States-New Jersey-Bridgewater, North America-United States-New Jersey-Raritan, North America-United States-Pennsylvania-Horsham, North America-United States-Pennsylvania-Malvern, North America-United States-Pennsylvania-Fort Washington, North America-United States-New Jersey-Skillman, North America-United States-New Jersey-Titusville, North America-United States-New Jersey-Morris PlainsOrganization: Johnson & Johnson Consumer Inc. job.title: Business/Systems Analysts
job.description: We have immediate needs for Senior Business Systems Analysts with over 5 years of experience and a strong background in both business and technical environments. The ideal candidate must have experience in the Financial Services industry. Responsibilities may also include, but are not limited to, gathering requirements; writing functional specifications, establishing project documentation; functional design and business quality standards. The successful candidate will also be skilled at working with key users to continually improve business processes; managing projects throughout the entire systems development life cycle; and developing and executing test plans. As part of a professional services firm, duties can vary from project to project, providing the excitement and variety. Qualifications: Experience with business analysis, business process re-engineering, and requirements gathering methods and tools Excellent written, oral communication, facilitation and presentation skills required Attention to detail Strong relationship management skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a matrixed environment Ability to constructively adapt to rapidly changing priorities Knowledge of systems architecture, application development life cycle, and data modeling a plus Financial Services Experience is a plus If you meet the criteria listed above and are interested in helping other extremely talented professionals solve complex business problems for our clients, please send your resume to recruiting.

Regional Security Manager
job.description: Req# 172279BR Position Title Regional Security Manager Position Summary Plans, organizes and conducts extremely difficult investigations of alleged or suspected violations of laws and regulations concerning criminal and general investigations, fraud, computer crimes and provides technical investigative services. Develops investigative strategy, interviews personnel and vendors, interviews suspects for admissions, documents investigations with evidence so criminal and/or civil procedures are facilitated. Maintains a liaison with the legal department as well as local, state and federal law enforcement agencies in order to achieve maximum results that support business efforts. Investigates suspected highly complex sophisticated criminal activities, which have significant impact on health, safety, operational mission, or fiscal/ethical integrity. Conducts extremely sensitive investigations that require significant understanding of depth and scope of potential impact that results may have on the organization. Analyzes and evaluates investigative progress to reassess priorities, leads and direction. The successful candidate will support compliance activity governed by the Federal Government, which limits access privileges to United States citizens (without dual citizenship). Candidate must meet United States government security requirements in accordance with government contract. Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree and four years related work experience or eight years related work U.S. Citizenship (without dual citizenship) Current or ability to obtain a U.S. Government Security Clearance (required) Two years security experience Two years project management experience Preferred Qualifications Certified Fraud Examiner (CFE) certification ASIS - Professional Certified Investigator [PCI] At Sprint, we're more than just talk. We've changed the way people communicate, how they work and how they stay connected on the go. Sprint is widely recognized for developing, engineering and deploying innovative technologies, including the first wireless 4G service from a national carrier in the United States; offering industry-leading mobile data services, leading prepaid brands including Virgin Mobile USA, Boost Mobile, and Assurance Wireless; instant national and international push-to-talk capabilities; and a global Tier 1 Internet backbone. Behind every decision we make, there is a passion and drive to develop technologies to enhance and simplify our customers' lives.Are you ready for the big time?Sprint is a background screening, drug screening, and E-Verify participating employer and considers qualified candidates regardless of previous criminal history. EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled. Job Category Corporate Security Address 201 Route 17 N 3Rd Fl Work City Rutherford Work State NJ Country US Apply on Career Site

job.description: Job Requisition Number: 95042Category: Marketing - GraphicPrimary Location: Picatinny Arsenal, NJ, USSecurity Clearance: SecretClearance Status: Must be CurrentSchedule: Full TimeType of Travel: Outside Continental USPercent of Travel Required: Up to 10%Description:Seeking Graphic Artist/Illustrators with an active Secret clearance to support the PEO Soldier SETA work at Picatinny Arsenal.Duties and Responsibilities:- Creates and edits graphics, designs layouts, and multimedia presentations.- Utilizes the full suite of media products and uses video and digital photography to develop electronic and graphic briefing materials.- Utilizes Microsoft and/or Macintosh operating systems and a wide variety of graphics applications, to include: vector art applications (e.g. CorelDraw, Adobe Illustrator, and Macromedia Feehand), bitmap art applications (e.g. Adobe Photoshop, Corel Photo-Paint), 3D applications (e.g. Strata StudioPro, Bryce 3D, Corel Dream 3D), and multimedia development applications (e.g. Macromedia Director).- Utilizes current clipart and file formats.- Performs HTML design and maintenance, and document scanning and archiving.- Creates and edits graphics and design layouts by conceptualizing ideas and requirements into reality, via artwork suitable for a variety of media.- Reviews operating systems or network configurations; evaluates software applications or system components, such as web applications and database systems; troubleshoots network problems and outages.- Installs computer hardware/software.Required Qualifications:Must have an active Secret security clearance.Associates with 12 years experienceBachelors in non Directly Related Field with 10 years experienceMasters in non Directly Related Field with 5 years experienceEDUCATION & EXPERIENCETypically requires Bachelor's Degree or equivalent, and two to four years of related experience.This position is in support of future opportunities. As we get closer to filling this position, we will be contacting qualified candidates. If you are selected to interview, you will be contacted directly by a recruiter.Company Description:CACI employs a diverse range of talent to create an environment that fuels innovation and fosters continuous improvement and success. Join CACI, where you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian clients. A member of the Fortune 1000 Largest Companies and the Russell 2000 Index, CACI provides dynamic careers for approximately 15,000 employees working in over 120 offices worldwide.CACI is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Females/Minorities/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.
