job.title: Geek Squad Consultation Agent
job.description:
Job Title: Geek Squad Consultation Agent Auto req ID: 270067BR Brand: Geek Squad Employment Category: Part Time Job Level: Entry Level City: Bridgewater State: NJ About Us: About Geek SquadIt all began with a few oddly dressed heroes fixing computers. Today, we’re an army of Agents more than 18,000 strong, on a singular mission to rid the world of rogue technology. We’re still oddly dressed, but we’re now oddly dressed and saving the day across the globe. If you’re techno-exceptional, good with people and great at having fun while doing top-quality work, we invite you to join our illustrious ranks. Best Buy Company and its Family of BrandsBest Buy is the world’s largest multi-channel consumer electronics retailer with stores in the United States, Canada, China, and Mexico. We are the 11th largest online retailer in the U.S. and Canada, we have the number one customer loyalty program of its kind and more than 1.6 billion visitors to our websites and stores each year. Our more than 165,000 employees are committed to helping deliver the technology solutions that provide value, enabling access to people, knowledge, ideas and fun – whether online, via mobile device or in our stores. Posting Job Description: What does a Geek Squad Consultation Agent do? Do all things technology fire you up? Can you swap a motherboard or hook up a home theater system blindfolded? Does the thought of installing an LCD in an SUV, and getting paid for it, make you salivate? If you answered yes to any of these questions, congratulations, your dream career might be waiting for you at Geek Squad. We invite you to join our illustrious ranks. A Geek Squad Consultation Agent is a brand ambassador for both the Geek Squad and Best Buy brands. As the solutions expert, the Consultation Agent manages the Geek Squad check-in and check-out experience for customers and helps them find the complete solution that works for them. They coach the sales team, building trust and explaining services and technology to help meet all customer needs. Their knowledge of services, technology and business group strategies in partnership with the sales team ensures no customer is ever left unserved or underserved. 70% of your time you will: Engage customers using selling skills to provide solutions aligning with their “definition of fix.”
30% of your time you will: Work with the sales team, explaining services and technology to help them achieve business goals. Perform other duties as assigned.
What are the Professional Requirements of a Geek Squad Consultation Agent?Basic Requirements: 3-6 months working experience
Preferred Requirements: High School diploma or equivalent Associate degree in general electronics or computer repair 1+ years retail or customer service experience 1+ years experience diagnosing or repairing PCs or consumer electronics
Location Number: 000544-Bridgewater-Store Additional Job Information: What are my rewards and benefits?Discover your career here! At Geek Squad and Best Buy we offer much more than a paycheck. Surrounded by the latest and greatest technology, a team of amazing coworkers and a work environment where anything is possible, you’ll find it easy to be your best when you work with us. We provide an exciting work environment with a community of techno learners where you can be yourself while investing in your career. Empowered with knowledge you will discover endless opportunities to grow. From deep employee discounts to tuition reimbursement, to health, wealth and wellness benefits, to learning and development programs, we believe the success of our company depends on the passion of employees for learning, technology and people. Apply on Career Site

job.title: C++/Python WebCrawler Engineer
job.description: Job Requisition Number:42364The Role:Data Acquisition R&D in our Princeton, NJ office is seeking a motivated Senior Software Engineer to assist in further development of our web crawling system. Bloomberg's web crawling technologies are some of the most advanced web scraping capabilities in the world. Candidate must have extensive experience with C/C++ and Python.Qualifications:Master's or PHD degree in computer science or equivalent (strong foundation in data structures and algorithms).Candidates with some, but not all, of the following requirements will still be considered.-5+ years of experience developing large scale distributed software systems-Strong object-oriented analysis and design skills.-Strong experience developing multi-threaded applications and lock-free algorithms-Strong experience with C/C++ and Python-Experience with Natural Language Processing and Machine Learning is a plus-HTML and the parsing of HTML (such as is done by browsers)-Experience with Big Data storage is a plus (Hadoop, etc)-Javascript a plus-Extensive knowledge of design patters, especially the ones related to GUIs-Experience with Webkit is a plus-Knowledge of Browser/Web Server interaction is a plus (cookies, post requests, forms)The Company:Bloomberg, the global business and financial information and news leader, gives influential decision makers a critical edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas. The company's strength - delivering data, news and analytics through innovative technology, quickly and accurately - is at the core of the Bloomberg Professional service, which provides real time financial information to more than 315,000 subscribers globally. Bloomberg's enterprise solutions build on the company's core strength, leveraging technology to allow customers to access, integrate, distribute and manage data and information across organizations more efficiently and effectively. Through Bloomberg Law, Bloomberg Government, Bloomberg New Energy Finance and Bloomberg BNA, the company provides data, news and analytics to decision makers in industries beyond finance. And Bloomberg News, delivered through the Bloomberg Professional service, television, radio, mobile, the Internet and three magazines, Bloomberg Businessweek, Bloomberg Markets and Bloomberg Pursuits, covers the world with more than 2,400 news and multimedia professionals at more than 150 bureaus in 73 countries. Headquartered in New York, Bloomberg employs more than 15,000 people in 192 locations around the world. Apply on Career Site

job.title: Director, Global Data Science & Analytics Practice
job.description: Director, Global Data Science & Analytics Practice-0475150311DescriptionJohnson and Johnson Inc. is recruiting for a Director, Global Data Science & Analytics Practice. This position will be located in Skillman, NJ to start; however, it will move to New Brunswick, NJ later this year. Travel up to 10% required.Johnson and Johnson Inc. is a member of the Johnson and Johnson Family of Companies, the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices and diagnostics. Johnson and Johnson Inc. markets innovative consumer products focusing on skin and hair care, baby care, wound care, oral health and women's health as well as a broad range of well-known and trusted over-the-counter products through our McNeil Consumer Healthcare division.At Johnson and Johnson Inc. our purpose is to "Bring Science to the Art of Healthy Living" by providing consumers with some of the most world's most widely used and trusted brands including; JOHNSON'S ® Baby, NEUTROGENA®, AVEENO® LISTERINE®, BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages, TYLENOL®, REACTINE® , BENYLIN® , NICORETTE®, NICODERM® and many more.Johnson and Johnson Inc. aspires to accelerating game-changing analytics as a core capability that fuels our competitive edge through differentiated insights and better, faster decisions, enabling our purpose and driving sustainable growthThe Director, Global Data Science & Analytics Practice reports to the Vice-President – Global Analytics as part of the Global Analytics COE, and will sit on Global Analytics Leadership Team. This role will oversee the sourcing, development, deployment, evolution and on-going operation of globally consistent and standardized analytics capabilities, models and methods for statistical analysis, forecasting, simulation, and optimization tools. This role will manage a team of internal and external data scientists and statistical modelers, and oversees strategic global suppliers and managed services – partnering closely with global and regional analytics directors and key business stakeholders to provide advanced analytics services.Responsibilities include: Develop and implement analytics policies and methods to ensure consistent application and use of competitive analytics that reflect industry best practices; Monitor emerging analytical trends. Recommend, source, develop and/or implements optimal research management tools, techniques and technologies for data discovery to sustain our competitive advantage; Attract, develop and retain pipeline of highly engaged, superior internal and externally sourced analytics talent. Advance overall analytics IQ by building analytics learning plan for the analytics COE, marketing (MX) and customer (CX) talent strategies, engraining ‘lead with data’ philosophy; Manage engaged network of high-performing, insourced and outsourced suppliers, data scientists and statistical modelers through proactive leadership, coaching and development; Establish and maintain global data strategy enabling standard use of data through managed suppliers, sourcing, ingestion and storage of high quality, authoritative data sets. Define and enforce global data governance policies for data stewardship and quality; In partnership with IT, enable advanced analysis, knowledge exchange and self-service through a flexible, adaptable future-state technology platform, advanced and predictive insight generation.Additional responsibilities include: Ensure overall analytic capabilities of the organization are increasing at a rate commensurate with the volume, velocity and variety of data available to the organization, buying and building advanced capabilities (as appropriate) and ensuring the consistent use of modeling, simulation, forecasting and discovery methods to drive decision-making across all marketing and customer teams: Deploy standardized processes, predictive and real-time methodologies with advanced simulation tools that drive spend and performance optimization opportunities; Drive sustainable revenue growth through the delivery and on-going support of advanced and automated advertising, digital, pricing, promotion, assortment simulation models and insight decision making; Oversee development and institutionalization of consistent processes, predictive and competitive sales forecasting and business planning methods including demand sensing, casual factors and risk volatility; Leverage market structures to derive differentiated consumer/shopper insight that enhance understanding of our consumers and the marketplace, leading to larger product launches, executional excellence and innovation. Focus on consumer and shopper segmentation, market/purchase structure, brand offer optimization, test and learn analysis, and other improved performance program.QualificationsMaster’s Degree or PhD in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or other related fields with emphasis in quantitative methods is required. A minimum of 12 years of experience in advanced analytics, model building, and optimization is required. Experience in information-intensive industries or digitally advanced enterprises are preferred. Working knowledge of the CPG business is preferred. Experience with data manipulation and analysis such as SQL, noSQL, Java, C, SAS EGuide, MapReduce, PIG, HIVE, Python, SAS, SAS HPA, SAS Visual Analytics, SAS EMiner, Salford TreeNet, R, and machine learning approaches such as Mahout, is required. Experience working with big data and real time/near real time analytics and big data platforms such as Hadoop is required. Strong theoretical and practical knowledge of some of the following analytic techniques is required: segmentation creation, mix and time series modeling, response modeling, lift modeling, experimental design, neural networks, data mining, optimization techniques, clustering, vector analysis, classification, factoring and/or algorithms. Background and experience developing and implementing behavioral structures and simulations is required. Knowledge of data structure; information systems/tools, and related software and data management; enterprise content management, and record-keeping policies and practices are required. Experience integrating complex, cross-corporate processes and data models is preferred. Experience leading multiple high profile projects with demanding deadlines, changing requirements, and working with limited resources is required. Ability to estimate required effort for project objectives and prioritize work items appropriately is required.Additional requirements include: Demonstrated strength in examining issues, shaping strategy and influencing effectively across the organization, driving people, process and technology changes; Demonstrated ability to improve organizational performance through the application of original thinking to existing and emerging methods, processes, products and services. Employs sound judgment in determining how innovations will be deployed to produce a value outcome; Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (oral and written), including the ability to explain digital concepts and technologies to business leaders, as well as business concepts to technologists. Demonstrated strength in partnering with internal/external contacts globally to generate mutually beneficial, long-term opportunities and negotiating win-win outcomes; Demonstrated ability to manage large team across business and technical areas. Ability to succeed in a matrixed environment and influence adoption of new thinking.BE VITAL in your Career; be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.J2W:LI NAJ2W:DICEPrimary Location:North America-United States-New Jersey-SkillmanOther Locations:North America-United States-New Jersey-New BrunswickOrganization: Johnson & Johnson Consumer Inc. (6071)Job Function: Market ResearchCertain sites within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies participate in E-Verify as appropriate in accordance with Company guidelines and federal or state law. To learn more about the government sponsored program and to see a list of the sites that are currently enrolled, please click here.Johnson and Johnson Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. job.title: Manager, API Commercial Technical Services- Small Molecule
Software Support Engineer - Network Systems
job.description: Our client, a dynamic network management and security software firm supporting global companies in banking, technology, pharmaceuticals and retail, as well as the public sector, seeks an experienced Technical Support Engineer for a full time direct hire opening for the engineering team.This company is on the cutting edge of a number of technologies, both on premise as well as Cloud / SaaS platforms. The selected candidate will need to be a creative problem solver, resourceful in getting things done, and productive working independently or collaboratively.Responsibilities for this position will include technical support to customers and systems engineers for complex Network Analytics and Discovery software solutions. This individual will troubleshoot isses dealing with SQL, Unix, perl or shell, and network debugging. A good working knowledge of networking protocols like TCP/IP, ICMP, DHCP, DNS, SNMP, OSPF, BGP/etc. is required. This position involves phone/Internet support as well as interaction with Development, QA, Sales, and Marketing organizations. This position requires the ability to work without close supervision. This position supports a product and a customer base that is growing rapidly. This is both a highly technical position and a position where customer service skills are very important.Primary responsibilities for this position include: Respond to customer support requests in a timely and professional manner Diagnose problems Recreate problems locally using varying combinations of hardware and software Create and document workarounds Work with Development, QA, and others within the company to resolve product issues Accurately document problem descriptions and resolutions Support Customer Service Engineers The following qualifications are required for this position: Solid networking knowledge Solid Unix background Familiarity with shell scripting and perl Virtual machine experience (e.g. VMware/Hyper-V/AWS) Strong communications skills (verbal and written) A demonstrated ability to learn and a strong willingness to work at varied tasks The following would be helpful for this position: Database experience (SQL, Postgres) Programming/scripting background (C, Java, perl) Security experience Experience with CentOS Firewall, router, and switch management experience Packet-level debugging Technical support experience ** Please note, This position requires a US citizen able to to get security clearance ** Apply on Partner Site

job.title: Supervisor - Service Desk (Mason, Ohio - Hours 7:00 am - 3:00 pm)
Lead, Clinical Research Medical Advisor Neuroscience
job.description: Responsible for leadership, strategic direction, and resource allocation of US CRMAs for multiple therapeutic areas. Primary medical contact responsible for a portion of global Development Clinical Trials which includes protocol feasibility, physician to physician contact, protocol training, medical issue/question management, safety communication review and local regulatory interaction. Provides strategic medical input for therapeutic areas into protocol design at a global level. Directly collaborates with US and Global Medical Affairs colleagues to identify/involve investigators and medical experts in order to maximize the value of the assigned project(s) in the context of the investigational product(s). Engage in discussions with medical experts regarding compounds in early development. Major Accountabilities: • Lead assigned CRMAs, including recruiting, on-boarding, development, coaching, and performance management of associates. • Collaborate with MU Head/ICRO to insure appropriate CRMA resource allocation to support priority trials. • Provide medical expertise specific to US for medical unit(s). • Lead and/or perform protocol, country and site feasibility. • Provide consolidated feasibility and site selection input to global and US teams. • Provide protocol, risk management plan & disease training as appropriate at Investigator’s Meetings, scientific venues or internally. • Perform local adverse event (AE) review and provide medical support for safety issues • Provide medical expertise support to US pharmacovigilance activities. • Respond to medical questions regarding the conduct of the trial to protect patient safety, including Pharmacovigilance and SAE information. • Follow-up with the Investigator for additional information or clarifications as needed. • Collaboration with internal stakeholders who support clinical trials e.g., CRAs, CRMAs, MSLs, etc. Details of Technical Competency: • Protocol Execution: Demonstrates knowledge of how to adequately review and read a protocol to understand specifics of study design and answer questions regarding the trial. • Applies a detailed understanding of the drugs within the therapeutic areas to provide medical context as it relates to disease processes, populations, and standards of care. • Ability to assess the feasibility of implementing the protocol based on regional medical practice. • Demonstrates a high level of understanding of the protocol to train others on the protocol including site personnel where applicable. • Demonstrates understanding of the protocol to evaluate investigator / site patient protocol compliance and patient safety. • Regulatory & Compliance: Demonstrates an understanding of regulatory requirements and internal policies, procedures, and guidelines pertaining to clinical trials. • Applies knowledge of regulatory / industry rules to work in a local regulated environment. • Demonstrates current knowledge of relevant local regulations and compliance requirements and communicates to global teams as required. • Demonstrates knowledge of applicable SOPs, policies, procedures, and guidance documents. • Expertise to represent company as safety expert for clinical trials to external regulatory and compliance bodies such as regulatory agencies, boards of health, and ethics committees. • Safety: Provides medical or scientific expertise to facilitate the safe use of product(s) in clinical trials. • Demonstrates knowledge of drugs and their safety profiles. • Applies safety expertise to answer local safety questions and provide required information to Headquarters where appropriate. • Applies medical expertise to provide prompt review and follow-up on all SAEs. Additional responsibilities: • When necessary, provide medical expertise to Clinical Operations activities for safety amendments, investigator notifications (INs), etc. • Review and resolve local medical issues / questions that arise during the entire course of the study • Assist in writing country or site specific Informed Consent Forms (ICF). • Provide strategic medical input into protocol design at a global level, as requested. • Support Regulatory Affairs, Health Economics, Drug safety and epidemiology and Medical Information with medical input as appropriate as this relates to clinical trials. • Support ICRO/Global teams in interaction with regional regulatory agencies. • Provide assistance to ICRO and site for IEC/IRB Interactions. • Support planning, implementation and follow-up of regulatory agency inspections and internal audits. • Provide training to CRAs and Field Medical MSLs, as needed https://sjobs.brassring.com/tgwebhost/jobdetails.aspx?partnerid=13617&siteid=5260&jobid=2350109 The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. Job Requirements Position will be filled commensurate with experience. Education: A Medical Degree is required Experience in medical practice and fully trained in all aspects of drug development including clinical research, GCP, local regulatory requirements and data privacy laws Experience/Professional requirement: -5+ years pharmaceutical experience or clinical trial management -7+ years managing a study from the medical perspective -Demonstrated experience in problem solving and mediation of complex medical/operational issues within the regional and therapeutic area context -Excellent leadership & influencing skills for both direct reports and matrixed relationships. -Ability to courageously provide constructive feedback, coach, mentor and develop direct and indirect reports. -Excellent interpersonal communication, presentation and project management skills, strong personal integrity, teamwork abilities, and customer focus are necessary. -Demonstrated ability to manage complex and large projects and to effectively coach, train, and mentor scientific/clinical persons at all skill and knowledge levels. -Proven track record of leading and influencing in a complex, highly matrixed environment and influencing internal partners and stakeholders to achieve desired business outcomes -Must possess a thorough understanding of the FDA, OIG, HIPAA and other guidelines relevant to the pharmaceutical industry and to ensure compliance with these external as well as Novartis internal guidelines and standard operating procedures (e.g., Ethics & Compliance guidelines). -Field or East Hanover, NJ based role with ability to travel (domestic) approximately 20-40 % Preferred Experience: -3+ years managing, leading and developing people highly preferred -Subspecialty training Apply on Career Site

Eurest is recognized worldwide for standards of service and excellence within the foodservice industry. Embracing an ownership mindset, Eurest leverages global resources, promotes a local presence and enriches the communities we serve. The Eurest Promise, “connect with people, inspire through food, create solutions, and live our promise,” is exemplified throughout our organization. Eurest is proud to serve the world’s most respected successful corporations, including many of the Fortune 500.
Full time associates at Eurest are offered many fantastic benefits such as: Medical Dental Vision Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs) Commuter Benefits Wellness Program Employee Assistance Program Life Insurance for Associates and Eligible Dependents Short Term Disability (STD) and Long Term Disability (LTD) Accidental Death & Dismemberment (AD&D) Insurance Discount Marketplace And other voluntary benefits
Summary:Makes and serves coffee/espresso drinks and related food and beverage items. Handles food according to HACCP guidelines and standards for quality food-service operations. Interacts with customers and other employees in a friendly, courteous manner. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Prepares espresso orders for customers and catering using standard measures and recipes. Enters orders accurately into POS device; accepts cash and charge payments. Replenishes condiments, beverages and general supplies while maintaining cleanliness of service area. Ensures proper presentation, portion control and maintenance of proper serving temperatures; follows HACCP standards. Maintains sanitation and orderliness of all equipment, supplies and utensils. Ensures proper food preparation by using approved recipes and following prescribed production standards. Keeps display equipment clean and free of debris during meal service. Cleans equipment and workstation thoroughly before leaving the area for other assignments. Greets customers courteously and interacts in a manner to ensure customer satisfaction. Relays relevant concerns from customers to supervisors. Serves customers quickly and efficiently, and prevents delays in serving lines. Demonstrates a complete understanding of daily menu items and accurately explains them to customers. Serves as an advocate of selling techniques to the customer by establishing good communication and assisting in the buying decision-making process. Ensures all display foods are merchandised attractively per standards. Serves food neatly and attractively per standard. Performs other duties as assigned. About Compass Group: Achieving leadership in the foodservice industry Compass Group North America is a diversity growth-oriented organization. Our goal is to improve the quality of work life by using fair and consistent treatment and providing equal growth opportunities for ALL associates. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer that considers applicants without regard to race, sex, religion, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. Qualified candidates must be able to perform the essential functions of this position satisfactorily with or without a reasonable accommodation. While this is intended to be an accurate reflection of the position posted, the Company reserves the right to modify or change the essential functions of the job based on business necessity. job.title: Director, Quality Engineering
job.description: Director, Quality Engineering-00000XHQDescriptionJohnson & Johnson is recruiting for a Director, Quality Engineering, to be located in New Brunswick, NJ or a Johnson & Johnson site in North America, Latin America or Europe.Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for 125 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.The Director, Quality Engineering will accelerate proactive quality business outcomes on new and existing products by leading and delivering cross-segment/sector improvement initiatives and driving collaboration of best practices across sites and sectors.Primary responsibilities of this role will include but are not limited to: Identify shared opportunities to improve process and product quality centrally using Quality Engineering principles and practices across all J&J Supply Chain segments. Lead, manage and support the development and execution of key strategic QE initiatives in collaboration with Supply Chain partners focusing on risk reduction, capability improvements, increased value/reduced cost of quality and/or enhanced regulatory compliance in alignment with the J & J Production System (JJPS). Leverage unique skills, share proven and adaptable practices across sites, and drive standardization where it provides value. Provide Subject Matter Expertise in Quality Engineering practices and principles. (Manufacturing/Lab equipment software compliance, statistical methods, and other Enterprise-led Product Supply related standardization efforts and COEs, such as Packaging, Platforms, and Execution Systems). Research, identify, and recommend new technologies to support QE strategies and improve product quality. Collaborate with key stakeholders in Manufacturing Engineering, Product Supply, NPI, Quality Operations, Supplier Quality, and Compliance.QualificationsBachelor’s degree required; A discipline in Engineering is preferred; Post-Graduate degree preferred; A minimum of 10 years of broad-based technical/engineering experience required; Experience in quality, development, manufacturing or operations preferred; Six Sigma/Lean/Process Excellence certification preferred; Project Management/FPx certification preferred; Knowledge of GMP, ISO and/or other international regulations and standards required; Strong project management and influencing skills required; Strong two-way communication, negotiation and executive presentation skills required; Ability to take initiative in innovative approaches to Quality Management solutions and applications in a fast paced changing business environment required; Ability to drive timely decisions with sometimes minimal data required; Quality management, supervisory and people development skills preferred; Strong problem solving skills required; Knowledge of fundamental quality engineering principles such as Process Validation, Design of Experiments, and Process Control & Capability required; Ability to lead in matrix management environment and able to work collaboratively cross-functionally as well as across business units and segments/sectors required; Capable of assuming technical hands-on leadership required; Ability to shape, create a future vision and gain support and alignment to that vision required; Ability to coach talent on Quality Engineering principles and practices required; Analytical skills and experience leading risk-based oversight programs required; Organizational change management experience required; Bifocal approach - ability to zoom-in/zoom-out for strategic and tactical, high-level and detailed, etc. required; Fluent in English (both verbal and written) required; This role requires up to 40% domestic and international travel.BE VITAL in your Career; be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.J2W:LI NAPrimary Location:North America-United States-New Jersey-New BrunswickOther Locations:Europe/Middle East/Africa, North America, Latin AmericaOrganization: Johnson & Johnson Services Inc. (6090)Job Function: Quality (Eng)Certain sites within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies participate in E-Verify as appropriate in accordance with Company guidelines and federal or state law. job.title: Compliance Senior Associate
job.description:
New York Life Insurance Company (“New York Life”) is the largest mutual life insurance company in the United States*. Founded in 1845, New York Life is headquartered in New York City, and is one of the most financially strong and highly capitalized insurers in the business. At year end 2013 New York Life had a total surplus of $21.141 billion and holds the highest possible financial strength ratings currently awarded to any life insurer from all four of the major ratings agencies: A.M. Best, A++; Fitch AAA; Moody’s Aaa ; Standard & Poor’s AA+. (Source: Individual Third Party Ratings Report as of 6/18/14)
Financial strength, integrity and humanity—the values upon which New York Life was founded—have guided the company’s decisions and actions for nearly 170 years.
Compliance Senior Associate (PF4) – New Jersey
New York has an opportunity for you to join our Corporate Compliance team supporting our investments business. The primary responsibilities of the position include, Code of Ethics and Personal Trade Monitoring.
Primary Job Responsibilities: Monitor and enforce employee personal trading policies including preclearance, monitoring, recording and reporting. Data entry of trade confirmations and filing of confirms and monthly account statements. Assist with the maintenance of the ITrade Personal Trading System including liasoning with technology staff to maintain the system, implement upgrades, and resolve issues. Prepare personal trading violation and other memorandums. Address personal trading and Code of Ethics related inquiries from employees. Review front running and other trading reports and address issues if any. Conduct new employee training and assist with the development and implementation of on-going employee training. Special projects when assigned.
Skills and Qualifications
Bachelors degree General knowledge of the mutual fund or investment advisory business. Sound professional judgment, analytical skills and practicality. This includes the ability to gather information and synthesize it to identify problems, trends, and opportunities. Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to interface with personnel in a broad range of areas of expertise and at various levels within the organization. Knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel. Excellent organizational and writing skills. The ability to learn quickly and work well with others.

job.title: Legal Research Analyst - Citator
job.description: Job Requisition Number:44440The Role:Bloomberg L.P., a leading worldwide provider of electronic information, is looking for qualified people to join the Legal Content Operations group of the Global Data division. Legal Content Operations is a dynamic group that produces and maintains various legal data collections and products that form the backbone of bloomberglaw.com and legal content on the Bloomberg Professional.The Citator team acquires, maintains, updates, and analyzes primary and secondary source materials, as well as manages the case law, legislative and regulatory databases where all of the legal opinions, statutes, and rules are stored. Content Operations also supports the industry-leading Bloomberg News, financial data and company and market information by providing value-added legal analysis. Our main clients include attorneys, law firms, government, law librarians, paralegals, judges and law students. This team which is responsible for building and managing our data products consists of attorneys, both seasoned and recent graduates, as well as data analysts who have a background in the legal industry or relevant data experience. Creative and energetic individuals who are able to solve problems on a large scale while still maintaining attention to detail thrive on our team.Responsibilities:The successful candidate will contribute to developing, maintaining and marketing BLAW, working within the group responsible for building and maintaining Citator, the legal research tool associated with the Bloomberg Law Product. Citator allows for review of composite analysis and to see how the case is discussed in court opinions and other legal documents that reference cases by citation. The role involves focused research, requiring analysis of court cases, statutes and rules.Qualifications:- Juris Doctor degree from an accredited law school.- Bar Admission required.- 0-3 years of experience working in the legal field.- Journal, clerkship, and project management experience a plus.- Working knowledge of state and federal court structure, citation formats, and strong analytical skills.- Willingness to commit to lengthy research queries as a part of daily responsibilities.- Excellent legal research and analytical skills.- Familiarity with online legal research tools.- "Outside the box" thinker, comfortable sharing new ideas.- Ability to work in a fast paced, detail-oriented environment.- Organized and flexible approach.- Effective written and verbal communication skills.- Willingness to travel.About Bloomberg:Bloomberg, the global business and financial information and news leader, gives influential decision makers a critical edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas. The company's strength - delivering data, news and analytics through innovative technology, quickly and accurately - is at the core of the Bloomberg Professional service, which provides real time financial information to more than 315,000 subscribers globally. Bloomberg's enterprise solutions build on the company's core strength, leveraging technology to allow customers to access, integrate, distribute and manage data and information across organizations more efficiently and effectively. Through Bloomberg Law, Bloomberg Government, Bloomberg New Energy Finance and Bloomberg BNA, the company provides data, news and analytics to decision makers in industries beyond finance. And Bloomberg News, delivered through the Bloomberg Professional service, television, radio, mobile, the Internet and three magazines, Bloomberg Businessweek, Bloomberg Markets and Bloomberg Pursuits, covers the world with more than 2,400 news and multimedia professionals at more than 150 bureaus in 73 countries. Headquartered in New York, Bloomberg employs more than 15,000 people in 192 locations around the world. Apply on Career Site

job.title: Merchandising Specialist
job.description: Job Title: Merchandising Specialist Auto req ID: 278611BR Brand: Best Buy Employment Category: Part Time Job Level: Entry Level City: Manahawkin State: NJ About Us: Best Buy Company and its Family of BrandsBest Buy is the world’s largest multi-channel consumer electronics retailer with stores in the United States, Canada, China, and Mexico. We are the 11th largest online retailer in the U.S. and Canada, we have the number one customer loyalty program of its kind and more than 1.6 billion visitors to our websites and stores each year. Our more than 165,000 employees are committed to helping deliver the technology solutions that provide value, enabling access to people, knowledge, ideas and fun – whether online, via mobile device or in our stores. Posting Job Description: What does a Best Buy Merchandising Specialist do?At Best Buy our mission is to leverage the unique talents and passions of our employees to inspire, delight, and enrich the lives of our customers through technology and all its possibilities. If you have a passion and curiosity for what is possible and enjoy people, we invite you to join us on this mission. This position is responsible to implement assigned responsibilities from Merchandising Senior in merchandising designated areas, upstocks merchandise to ensure department is continually stocked and replenished, and confirms the accuracy and timeliness of implementing special program guidelines. You will also assist customers in locating product. 45% of your time you will: Following weekly merchandising packet instructions, merchandises designated areas: Checks in drop shipments, truck shipments, and GEO shuttles. Confirms products are put on sales floor properly and in a timely manner. Arranges product according to planogram specifications. Performs ad set, price change, clean & bright, functionality and farming duties. Insure check-out lanes are set with proper product in each line. 25% of your time you will: Monitors floor merchandise: Upstocks overstock product when necessary. Downstocks product when necessary. Moves all product off of the sales floor prior to opening. 20% of your time you will: Ensures program guidelines are followed: Confirms Raincheck Follow up is completed. Confirms functionality checks are complete and problems reported to the manager. Brings "lock-up" product to front checkout lanes for customer purchases. Confirms closeout and open item program guidelines are followed. 10% of your time you will: Greets customer and assists with locating productWhat are the professional requirements of an Merchandising Specialist? Basic Qualifications: Lift or maneuver 50 pounds, and team lift up to 100 pounds Preferred Qualifications: High school diploma or equivalent 3+ months of retail experience Location Number: 001177-Manahawkin-Store Additional Job Information: What are my rewards and benefits?Surrounded by the latest and greatest technology, a team of amazing coworkers and a work environment where anything is possible, you’ll find it easy to be your best when you work at Best Buy. While you’re making technology work for our customers, we’re making sure Best Buy works for you with our pay for performance philosophy. At Best Buy we offer top salaries for management, including both short and long term incentive plans based upon business results, as well as endless opportunities to grow in a dynamic work environment that’s part of an industry that never sleeps. From tuition reimbursement to deep employee discounts, to health, wealth and wellness benefits, we believe the success of our company depends on the passion of employees for learning, technology and people. job.title: Manager, Workday Design - Compensation
job.description: Manager, Workday Design - Compensation-9401150302DescriptionJohnson & Johnson is currently recruiting for a Manager, Workday Design – Compensation, to be based in New Brunswick, NJ.Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 125 years. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. Employees of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies work with partners in health care to touch the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world.With $71.3 billion in 2013 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices and diagnostics markets. The more than 250 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employ approximately 127,000 people in 60 countries throughout the world.Johnson & Johnson (J&J) is implementing Workday, a Human Capital Management (HCM) solution. The implementation of Workday will enable the Johnson & Johnson enterprise talent agenda and provide greater visibility and alignment of J&J's workforce as well as drive standardization of global Human Resources (HR) processes. We are looking for a Manager, Workday Design – Compensation, to assist in the design, implementation and support of Workday Global Vital HR Capabilities (Compensation, Talent, Performance and Development), with a focus on Year End Compensation.Under the direction of the Director, Workday Vital Capabilities the Manager will: Collaborate closely with HR stakeholders, global process owners, HR Operations, Information Technology and Workday to ensure that the desired Vitals (Performance, Talent and Compensation) functionality meets the needs of the organization; Review Workday release notes to analyze future functionality and weekly Workday upgrades/bug fixes to determine impact; Document test scenarios, manage system testing and user acceptance testing, and help ensure configuration documentation and traceability matrix are up-to-date; Train and support Workday Operations with Workday questions/issues during Performance, Talent and Compensation events; Coordinate with the Change, Communications and Capability team to act as Subject Matter Expert in providing help text, HR Services call scripts, and FAQs for Vital capabilities; Launch and audit Workday Vitals events.QualificationsA minimum of a Bachelor’s degree is required. A minimum of 5 years of experience in a Human Resources or HRIS role is required. Experience in Year-end Compensation and/or Talent is highly desired. Experience with HR systems as an end-user minimally is required; Workday experience is preferred. Project Management experience is required.Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks is required. Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with strong attention to detail are required. Outstanding organizational, and collaboration skills with the ability to partner across functions and regions is required. Ability to bridge communications with both IT and HR audiences is required. Global experience is preferred.The global nature of this role will require flexibility to accommodate global time zones. This position will be based in New Brunswick NJ.BE VITAL in your Career; be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.J2W:NA LIPrimary Location:North America-United States-New Jersey-New BrunswickOrganization: Johnson & Johnson Services Inc. (6090)Job Function: HR OperationsCertain sites within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies participate in E-Verify as appropriate in accordance with Company guidelines and federal or state law. To learn more about the government sponsored program and to see a list of the sites that are currently enrolled, please click here.Johnson and Johnson Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. job.description: R&D QA Specialist (Auditor)-3123150409DescriptionJanssen Research and Development, LLC, a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for an R&D QA Specialist (Auditor) to be located in Raritan, NJ, Titusville, NJ or Spring House, PA.Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C. develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. Research and development areas encompass novel targets in neurologic disorders, gastroenterology, oncology, infectious disease, diabetes, hematology, metabolic disorders, immunologic disorders, and reproductive medicine. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.The R&D QA Specialist (Auditor) independently plans, conducts and reports routine and supports non-routine R&D QA audits/assessments/inspections of the J&J Pharmaceutical sector worldwide, including J&J Operating Companies (including Consumer for pharmacovigilance), partners and service providers. These audits/assessments/inspections provide an independent quality assessment to ensure compliance with appropriate regulations, SOPs, processes, etc. as they pertain to company-sponsored R&D and pharmacovigilance activities, to maintain quality within region (Americas, Europe, Middle East & Africa (EMEA), Asia Pacific). Also contributes to other compliance and quality activities, as assigned.Responsibilities include: Leads the planning, conduct and reporting of R&D QA routine audits and supports non-routine audits of activities, data, internal facilities and processes in GxP/non-regulated areas to assure adherence to corporate policies, internal standards/requirements and compliance with applicable regulatory requirements. Non-routine audits include Due Diligence, for cause audits, cross-functional, complex/sensitive system/service provider audits as defined by the scope. Ensures the relevant standard procedures, diagnostic tools, and audit plans are fully understood and applied in audit activities. Supports regulatory inspections in various supporting roles. Completes assigned training requirements in a timely manner to ensure inspection readiness at all times. May assist in the preparation of training material if requested. Participates in projects or serves on teams, as assigned by supervisor. Meets priorities, checkpoints and timelines for all aspects of work and projects to achieve adequate progress. Provides consultation to business partners on routine tasks with occasional supervision. Cooperates with business partners when contacted for compliance inquiries and seeks advice on non-routine and more complex issues to ensure a departmental unified position.QualificationsA minimum of a bachelor’s degree is required; A minimum of 4 years experience in a Pharmaceutical, R&D, or Healthcare environment is required; Auditing experience in pre-clinical, non-clinical or pharmacovigilance preferred; Understanding of the drug development process required; Knowledge in one or more specific compliance disciplines (non-regulated, GLP, GCP, PV or computerized systems) required; Knowledge of procedural and records management requirements in a regulated industry required; Prior pharmaceutical and quality/compliance related experience preferred; This position will require up to 40% overnight domestic and international travel.BE VITAL in your career; be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.J2W:LI NAPrimary Location:North America-United States-New Jersey-RaritanOther Locations:North America-United States-New Jersey-Titusville, North America-United States-Pennsylvania-Spring HouseOrganization: Janssen Research & Development, LLC. job.description:
Job Title: GEEK SQUAD AUTOTECH-BASIC MECP Auto req ID: 278525BR Brand: Geek Squad Employment Category: Full Time Job Level: Entry Level City: Vineland State: NJ About Us: About Geek SquadIt all began with a few oddly dressed heroes fixing computers. We’re still oddly dressed, but we’re now oddly dressed and saving the day across the globe. If you’re techno-exceptional, good with people and great at having fun while doing top-quality work, we invite you to join our illustrious ranks. Best Buy Company and its Family of BrandsBest Buy is the world’s largest multi-channel consumer electronics retailer with stores in the United States, Canada, China, and Mexico. We are the 11th largest online retailer in the U.S. and Canada, we have the number one customer loyalty program of its kind and more than 1.6 billion visitors to our websites and stores each year. Our more than 165,000 employees are committed to helping deliver the technology solutions that provide value, enabling access to people, knowledge, ideas and fun – whether online, via mobile device or in our stores. Posting Job Description: What does a Geek Squad Autotech Car Installer, Basic MECP Certification do?Do all things technology fire you up? Can you swap a motherboard or hook up a home theater system blindfolded? Does the thought of installing an LCD in an SUV, and getting paid for it, make you salivate? If you answered yes to any of these questions, congratulations, your dream career might be waiting for you at Geek Squad. We invite you to join our illustrious ranks. A Geek Squad Autotech Car Installer follows established schedules and procedures for installing mobile electronics, including but not limited to: car stereo components, speakers, amplifiers, portable audio/GPS devices and accessories into motorized vehicles. They also provide technical advice and assistance to customers. They must also hold and maintain a basic level of MECP certification prior to working in an Autotech bay. 80% of your time you will: Install mobile electronic components according to store guidelines and procedures. Engage customers using selling skills to build solutions based on their needs and best business results.
20% of your time you will: Performs other duties as assigned. Engage with sales team, explaining services and technology to help them achieve business group goals. Perform administrative functions for the Autotech Bay including managing client communication.
What are the Professional Requirements of a Geek Squad Autotech Car Installer, Basic MECP Certification? Basic Requirements: High school diploma or equivalent Achieve and maintain MECP Basic Certification Valid driver’s license
Preferred Requirements: Retail experience Soldering experience Prior experience with installing mobile electronics

job.title: IT Manager, R&D Mobile Enablement
job.description: IT Manager, R&D Mobile Enablement-5098150226DescriptionJanssen Research & Development, L.L.C. is currently recruiting for an IT Manager, R&D Mobile Enablement, based in Raritan, NJ.Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C. develops treatments that improve the health and lifestyles of people worldwide. Research and development areas encompass novel targets in neurologic disorders, gastroenterology, oncology, infectious disease, diabetes, hematology, metabolic disorders, immunologic disorders, and reproductive medicine.Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.The R&D Mobile Enablement Manager will own the development and execution of a strategy for defining and delivering a set of mobile capabilities for the Janssen R&D organization of 8,000+ users in over 45 locations and 60 countries. The organization is seeking to define a strategy that will provide transformational change that will leapfrog the mobile capabilities of the R&D business units to achieve key mid-term business objectives for 2015 and long-term for 2020.In Janssen R&D, we define mobility as simplifying a business process by altering the user’s interactions through a mobile application that leverages device capabilities to make it easier to do their work. While the rest of J&J has more broadly accepted the use of mobility in their business processes, the Janssen R&D organization has just begun to do so and is sitting at the more basic level of maturity. The primary objective of this position is to lead R&D to the “emerging” level of maturity, driving toward the manifestation of a much broader shift to new systems of engagement. This position will achieve this three year strategy by providing leadership in three key areas. The first is engaging with the J&J teams that lead mobility today to deliver medium size projects that will raise the maturity level for the top three capability pain points. The second is to partner with the top mobile ready target user profiles to drive mobile enablement for key business processes in those business units. The final area is to drive mobility awareness and adoption throughout the R&D business through the appropriate marketing and communications.The position will require the review of external capabilities, choices by comparable, analyst deductions etc. – guidance in developing materials to help direct the strategy including leadership presentations, challenge sessions, and facilitate topical business process change discussions. The position will achieve this by analyzing IT requirements within companies and giving independent and objective advice on the use of IT. The role will require the candidate to act as an IT consultant working in partnership with clients, advising them how to use information technology in order to meet their business objectives or overcome problems. The position will provide strategic guidance to R&D organizations with regard to technology, IT infrastructures and the enablement of major business processes through enhancements to IT. The candidate in this position will also be responsible for identifying technology trends, and based on demand, develop innovative programs to assess new capabilities for business growth and where needed launch pilot efforts to support strategic goals.This role will also own the relationship with the key mobility leaders across the corporate engineering, operations, and leads across the other J&J sectors. The role participates in strategic planning, business planning and business analysis, needs analysis and business risk assessment, and consults with business partners to shape demand and determine how to best support the business through the effective use of technology. Roles in this family interface with and manage strategic relationships with partners (who may be in IT or the business) by representing and promoting IT capabilities.Responsibilities of this job include: Talented individual that knows enterprise mobile computing and has a strong application development background; This is a position of key influence and will be responsible for architecting, leading, and driving the Mobile App Store, Mobile Reference Architecture, and Enterprise Mobile Projects; Serves as an expert resource supporting one or more areas, processes, or technologies; Leads large, moderate to complex projects, programs or initiatives across the franchise or enterprise; Manages relationships across all IT, legal, finance, and the impacted Business IT areas, etc.; Works effectively as part of a team; Manages relationship with compliance, privacy and security as services need; Develops technology road maps, while keeping up-to-date with emerging technologies, and recommends business directions based on these technologies; Manage and give direction on the mobile product roadmaps of our Strategic mobility partners to ensure the required capabilities are delivered faster and in line with the Business needs; Provides technical leadership and is responsible for developing components and the overall systems design; Lead: Must be a strong proponent of change, primarily by championing change within and across organizational boundaries as well as processes and standards. Continue to evolve the process of an enterprise leader that delivers value as well as develops and improves the skills of the mobility function and team.Service Development responsibilities include: Identifying, investigating, and proving out new technologies for adding to the mobile reference architecture; Governance of vendor relationships with IT for mobile projects to ensure consistency with vision, adherence to standards, and quality of final product; Manage mobility capabilities strategy and portfolio from Business and IT point of view; Lead the development of mobile best practices, guidelines and mobile design & development standards; Act as custodian of the mobility guidelines to keep mobility solutions & processes as simple as possible; Assess and communicate the successes and business value of Mobility architecture to key stakeholders; Working with IT, Engineering, and Technical team to provide overall support for Mobility deployment and/or support of mobile devices across the enterprise; Communicate: Responsible for ensuring that all aspects of the Enterprise Mobility strategy are communicated effectively.Decision Making responsibilities include: Solves complex or unusual problems in consideration of the potential impacts; Negotiates the needs of multiple users or business partners; Balances between IT standards and strategies and business needs to guide well-informed decisions; Applies compliance requirements within scope of responsibility, provides documentation as necessary, and participates in compliance activities as required; Analyzes and reports meaningful data to identify issues, trends, or exceptions to drive improvement of the strategy.Knowledge in the following areas includes: Understanding of business issues and strategy, and the ability to factor them into technical direction and recommendations; Broad understanding of current and emerging technical architecture (i.e., what is and what is not possible); Understanding of the business and its operating environment (e.g., trends, competitors, compliance landscape, and regulatory environment); Advanced knowledge of the strategic plans/initiatives of a business partner and/or the ability to quickly come up to speed on the strategies and critical success factors for a business partner; Understanding of business activities of competitors and of the industry in general; Maintains a good understanding and awareness of competitors products and services; Familiarity with many technologies and processes with a particular focus on their capabilities and limitations; Expert understanding of technology lifecycle management, serving as a resource to others; Up-to-date knowledge about the company, industry trends, and strategy; Demonstrated understanding of mobile industry trends’ Understanding of changing business needs for supported areas, with ability to recommend strategies for the future; Expert working knowledge of changing business processes and the subsequent impact on applications; Expert understanding of J&J IT’s technology standards and strategies; In-depth knowledge of all areas of IT and the resources available to deliver projects, programs or manage portfolios; Strong understanding of the current and future state technology and applications; Understanding of the business impact of different solutions, and the ability to assess and communicate the tradeoffs between business needs, technology requirements, costs, and risk.Supervision responsibilities include: Functions very independently, receiving high-level and/or strategic guidance; able to self-direct, plan and execute initiatives (projects, programs, strategies); Manages business partner expectations at a senior level, resolving conflicts between requirements and budgets; Works independently in formulating innovative ideas and solutions on products, processes, and systems; Provides leadership, mentorship, or guidance to others; May manage vendors necessary to complete a project.QualificationsA minimum of a Bachelor’s degree and 8+ years of relevant experience OR an advanced degree with 6+ years experience required. A minimum 3 years of experience in application development/engineering required. Experience with the majority of the following professional software engineering practices and best practices for full software development life cycle required: coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations. Prior experience developing the mobility strategy and/or executing the deployment of a mobility strategy required. Previous people or project management experience is required.An understanding of mobile enablement and business processes in use in the Pharmaceutical industry is preferred. Experience with IT mobility services (i.e. MDM) preferred. Previous experience developing a strategic platform and delivery strategy is preferred. Vendor management experience is preferred. Experience in conducting proof of concepts or pilots to support the future growth of the services preferred. Strong verbal and written communication skills with specific skills in executive dialogue are required. Up to 25% travel required.BE VITAL in your Career; be seen for the talent you bring to your work. job.title: Associate Actuary - Corporate Actuarial GAAP Oversight
Message Mining Analyst
job.description: Job Requisition Number:44522The Role:Do you want be part of an exciting product that combines latest technology with financial markets? Do you want to be part of a team with a lot of growth and potential? The Bloomberg Diversified Data Support in Skillman, NJ is seeking highly motivated and enthusiastic people to be part of the Message Mining product. MSG Mining is a service that is aimed at providing credible, transparent and high quality pricing that is based on E-mail and Instant Messaging traffic received by clients. The data received is digitized and acts as a pricing source for transparency of OTC instruments for use in analytical functions. Helping thousands of clients organize, control and monitor their portfolios and holdings. Our clients are drowning in data. Do you want to help our clients easily navigate through their data, enjoy transparency and make better decisions?Team members are responsible for ensuring that price information across Bonds, CDS, Loans and Mortgage products are properly scraped from individual messages and displayed in a customized function to the client. This process includes understanding how traders/sales clients discuss prices via email/chat for the supported products as well as knowledge of the algorithm behind the programming mechanism. Analysts on the data team are also responsible for providing real-time support for our clients through Bloomberg's Instant Messaging platform. Additionally the team works very closely with our Business team on providing guidance for the future direction of the product, and works with our R&D staff to test code changes and introduce new products to the system.What we need you to be:Curious. Competitive. Driven. Creative. Collaborative. Altruistic. Results-oriented. Flexible.What we need to you have:- Degree in Finance and/or Computer-science related field- 1-3 years of professional experience in finance or computer science fields- Knowledge and understanding of financial markets- Strong analytical and project management skills- Ability to interact with customers and understand their needsWhat we would like you to know:- Excel with VBA/Macro functionality- Python, Natural Language Processing- Over-the-counter traded instruments- Statistical Analysis- Data Mining toolsThe Company:Bloomberg, the global business and financial information and news leader, gives influential decision makers a critical edge by connecting them to a dynamic network of information, people and ideas. The company's strength , delivering data, news and analytics through innovative technology, quickly and accurately , is at the core of the Bloomberg Professional service, which provides real time financial information to more than 315,000 subscribers globally. Bloomberg's enterprise solutions build on the company's core strength, leveraging technology to allow customers to access, integrate, distribute and manage data and information across organizations more efficiently and effectively. Through Bloomberg Law, Bloomberg Government, Bloomberg New Energy Finance and Bloomberg BNA, the company provides data, news and analytics to decision makers in industries beyond finance. And Bloomberg News, delivered through the Bloomberg Professional service, television, radio, mobile, the Internet and three magazines, Bloomberg Businessweek, Bloomberg Markets and Bloomberg Pursuits, covers the world with more than 2,400 news and multimedia professionals at more than 150 bureaus in 73 countries. Headquartered in New York, Bloomberg employs more than 15,000 people in 192 locations around the world. Apply on Career Site

job.title: Director, Global Data Science & Analytics Practice
job.description: Director, Global Data Science & Analytics Practice-0475150311DescriptionJohnson and Johnson Inc. is recruiting for a Director, Global Data Science & Analytics Practice. This position will be located in Skillman, NJ to start; however, it will move to New Brunswick, NJ later this year. Travel up to 10% required.Johnson and Johnson Inc. is a member of the Johnson and Johnson Family of Companies, the world's most comprehensive and broadly based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices and diagnostics. Johnson and Johnson Inc. markets innovative consumer products focusing on skin and hair care, baby care, wound care, oral health and women's health as well as a broad range of well-known and trusted over-the-counter products through our McNeil Consumer Healthcare division.At Johnson and Johnson Inc. our purpose is to "Bring Science to the Art of Healthy Living" by providing consumers with some of the most world's most widely used and trusted brands including; JOHNSON'S ® Baby, NEUTROGENA®, AVEENO® LISTERINE®, BAND-AID® Brand Adhesive Bandages, TYLENOL®, REACTINE® , BENYLIN® , NICORETTE®, NICODERM® and many more.Johnson and Johnson Inc. aspires to accelerating game-changing analytics as a core capability that fuels our competitive edge through differentiated insights and better, faster decisions, enabling our purpose and driving sustainable growthThe Director, Global Data Science & Analytics Practice reports to the Vice-President – Global Analytics as part of the Global Analytics COE, and will sit on Global Analytics Leadership Team. This role will oversee the sourcing, development, deployment, evolution and on-going operation of globally consistent and standardized analytics capabilities, models and methods for statistical analysis, forecasting, simulation, and optimization tools. This role will manage a team of internal and external data scientists and statistical modelers, and oversees strategic global suppliers and managed services – partnering closely with global and regional analytics directors and key business stakeholders to provide advanced analytics services.Responsibilities include: Develop and implement analytics policies and methods to ensure consistent application and use of competitive analytics that reflect industry best practices; Monitor emerging analytical trends. Recommend, source, develop and/or implements optimal research management tools, techniques and technologies for data discovery to sustain our competitive advantage; Attract, develop and retain pipeline of highly engaged, superior internal and externally sourced analytics talent. Advance overall analytics IQ by building analytics learning plan for the analytics COE, marketing (MX) and customer (CX) talent strategies, engraining ‘lead with data’ philosophy; Manage engaged network of high-performing, insourced and outsourced suppliers, data scientists and statistical modelers through proactive leadership, coaching and development; Establish and maintain global data strategy enabling standard use of data through managed suppliers, sourcing, ingestion and storage of high quality, authoritative data sets. Define and enforce global data governance policies for data stewardship and quality; In partnership with IT, enable advanced analysis, knowledge exchange and self-service through a flexible, adaptable future-state technology platform, advanced and predictive insight generation.Additional responsibilities include: Ensure overall analytic capabilities of the organization are increasing at a rate commensurate with the volume, velocity and variety of data available to the organization, buying and building advanced capabilities (as appropriate) and ensuring the consistent use of modeling, simulation, forecasting and discovery methods to drive decision-making across all marketing and customer teams: Deploy standardized processes, predictive and real-time methodologies with advanced simulation tools that drive spend and performance optimization opportunities; Drive sustainable revenue growth through the delivery and on-going support of advanced and automated advertising, digital, pricing, promotion, assortment simulation models and insight decision making; Oversee development and institutionalization of consistent processes, predictive and competitive sales forecasting and business planning methods including demand sensing, casual factors and risk volatility; Leverage market structures to derive differentiated consumer/shopper insight that enhance understanding of our consumers and the marketplace, leading to larger product launches, executional excellence and innovation. Focus on consumer and shopper segmentation, market/purchase structure, brand offer optimization, test and learn analysis, and other improved performance program.QualificationsMaster’s Degree or PhD in Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Economics or other related fields with emphasis in quantitative methods is required. A minimum of 12 years of experience in advanced analytics, model building, and optimization is required. Experience in information-intensive industries or digitally advanced enterprises are preferred. Working knowledge of the CPG business is preferred. Experience with data manipulation and analysis such as SQL, noSQL, Java, C, SAS EGuide, MapReduce, PIG, HIVE, Python, SAS, SAS HPA, SAS Visual Analytics, SAS EMiner, Salford TreeNet, R, and machine learning approaches such as Mahout, is required. Experience working with big data and real time/near real time analytics and big data platforms such as Hadoop is required. Strong theoretical and practical knowledge of some of the following analytic techniques is required: segmentation creation, mix and time series modeling, response modeling, lift modeling, experimental design, neural networks, data mining, optimization techniques, clustering, vector analysis, classification, factoring and/or algorithms. Background and experience developing and implementing behavioral structures and simulations is required. Knowledge of data structure; information systems/tools, and related software and data management; enterprise content management, and record-keeping policies and practices are required. Experience integrating complex, cross-corporate processes and data models is preferred. Experience leading multiple high profile projects with demanding deadlines, changing requirements, and working with limited resources is required. Ability to estimate required effort for project objectives and prioritize work items appropriately is required.Additional requirements include: Demonstrated strength in examining issues, shaping strategy and influencing effectively across the organization, driving people, process and technology changes; Demonstrated ability to improve organizational performance through the application of original thinking to existing and emerging methods, processes, products and services. Employs sound judgment in determining how innovations will be deployed to produce a value outcome; Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (oral and written), including the ability to explain digital concepts and technologies to business leaders, as well as business concepts to technologists. Demonstrated strength in partnering with internal/external contacts globally to generate mutually beneficial, long-term opportunities and negotiating win-win outcomes; Demonstrated ability to manage large team across business and technical areas. Ability to succeed in a matrixed environment and influence adoption of new thinking.BE VITAL in your Career; be seen for the talent you bring to your work. Explore opportunities within the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies.J2W:LI NAJ2W:DICEPrimary Location:North America-United States-New Jersey-SkillmanOther Locations:North America-United States-New Jersey-New BrunswickOrganization: Johnson & Johnson Consumer Inc.
